4279392028,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-bi-analyst-at-aon-4279392028?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=gvcHtygM%2FEN8pB%2F0YgjX3A%3D%3D&trackingId=QkM%2FYPObu13AXRPf1PCY3A%3D%3D,Data & BI Analyst,Aon,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Descrizione del messaggio
Sei interessata/o allo sviluppo di progetti strategici e consulenziali in ambito data analysis, business intelligence e intelligenza artificiale?

Questa è una fantastica opportunità per un giovane professionista che desidera entrare a far parte di un ambiente di lavoro collaborativo e dinamico, con la possibilità di lavorare con un team altamente specializzato e stakeholder di alto profilo.

L’Innovation Hub è parte del team Affinity, Mobility & DCS, dedicato allo sviluppo di soluzioni innovative e ad alto valore aggiunto per le diverse aree di business del mondo Motor. Attraverso l’adozione di tecnologie avanzate, tra cui strumenti di intelligenza artificiale, l’hub gestisce progetti volti a ottimizzare processi e attività aziendali. L’area Mobility/Mobility Innovation Hub ti offrirà un percorso formativo nel mondo della consulenza e della gestione dei dati, con ampie possibilità di crescita professionale.
Si tratta di un ruolo ibrido che può offrire la flessibilità di lavorare in parte virtualmente e in parte presso la nostra sede di Milano.
Aon is the business of better decisions.

In Aon, diamo forma alle decisioni migliori per proteggere e arricchire la vita delle persone in tutto il mondo. Siamo un’organizzazione fondata sulla fiducia reciproca e sulla diversità, aiutiamo con passione i nostri colleghi e clienti ad avere successo.

Il Data & BI Analyst è la figura che supporta l’area Mobility/Mobility Innovation Hub nella gestione e valorizzazione dei dati, contribuendo all’efficienza operativa e alla qualità delle decisioni aziendali.
Gestione dei flussi informativi da e verso stakeholder interni (IT, Business Unit) ed esterni (Clienti, Compagnie)
Creazione di analisi e dashboard per la visualizzazione e condivisione dei dati
Orchestrazione e automazione dei processi di ingestion, data cleaning e normalizzazione in collaborazione con i team IT
Supporto all’adozione di soluzioni basate su intelligenza artificiale per l’analisi predittiva e l’ottimizzazione dei processi.
Quali sono le competenze ed esperienze richieste?
Laureandi/Laurea triennale e/o magistrale in discipline STEM, economiche o affini
Esperienza pregressa (anche breve) in ambito data analysis o BI costituisce un plus
Ottima conoscenza dei principali pacchetti Office (in particolare Excel e PowerPoint)
Conoscenza di strumenti di BI (es. Power BI, Tableau) e linguaggi di elaborazione dati (es. SQL, Python)
Conoscenza di base o interesse per strumenti di intelligenza artificiale e machine learning è considerata un vantaggio
Ottimo livello di inglese scritto e parlato
Completano il profilo: curiosità, proattività, precisione, orientamento al risultato, buone capacità relazionali e organizzative, attitudine al team working.

La nostra organizzazione aperta ed inclusiva consente, grazie all’approccio agile e alla modalità di lavoro ibrida, di gestire l'equilibrio tra lavoro e vita privata assicurando ad ogni collega di poter dare il meglio di sé. Inoltre, annualmente sono previsti due ""Global Wellbeing Days"", in modo da poter dedicare del tempo al proprio benessere.

La nostra cultura sostiene un ambiente di lavoro innovativo e diversificato in cui tutti i colleghi, sentendosi sé stessi, sono ispirati e motivati ad imparare, condividere e sviluppare le proprie competenze.
Sede di lavoro: Milano, Via Ernesto Calindri 6.

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 9l5.93-4L15 6.54l-6.15 4.2a1.5 1.5 0 01-1.69 0L1 6.54 2.07 5z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Siamo una società benefit e una B Corp certificata, specializzata nella creazione di soluzioni su misura che trasformano la sostenibilità in un vantaggio competitivo. Accompagniamo le aziende in ogni fase del loro percorso di sostenibilità, offrendo un approccio unico che combina team di esperti, piattaforme innovative e metodi efficaci. I nostri servizi aiutano le organizzazioni a misurare, ridurre e compensare le emissioni, migliorare la formazione, coinvolgere i dipendenti e comunicare in modo trasparente gli sforzi di sostenibilità. Il nostro obiettivo finale è rendere le aziende autonome e competenti nella gestione del loro impatto e nel miglioramento delle performance ESG.
Se la persona giusta per Up2You se:

Hai una forte orientamento ai risultati. Siamo estremamente flessibili e confidiamo nella tua capacità di raggiungere i tuoi obiettivi senza una supervisione costante. Allo stesso modo, ci piace che la nostra fiducia venga ricambiata
Hai un forte interesse per la materia. Sei interessato a temi legati all'innovazione e all'ambiente. Come noi, credi nella necessità di agire concretamente per il nostro Pianeta
Ti consideri una persona intelligente e indipendente. Non aspetti istruzioni dettagliate per metterti al lavoro. Sei intraprendente, autonomo e proattivo
Ti piace dare e ricevere feedback. Nessuno ha tutte le risposte e tutti abbiamo ancora molto da imparare. Sei aperto sia a dare che a ricevere feedback costruttivi

Flessibilità. In Up2You non esiste il cartellino. Lavoriamo per obiettivi e diamo valore alla tua capacità di gestire tempi e modalità di lavoro con autonomia e responsabilità. Scegli come organizzarti per dare il massimo, perché qui la libertà è uno strumento per raggiungere risultati eccellenti

Work-life integration. Per noi, il lavoro non è un obbligo da separare dalla vita, ma una parte integrante di ciò che siamo e vogliamo realizzare. Abbiamo obiettivi ambiziosi e ci dedichiamo con passione per raggiungerli. Se ami ciò che fai e vuoi contribuire ad un cambiamento significativo, in Up2You lavoro e vita si fondono in un'esperienza di crescita continua

Lavora ovunque. In Up2You abbiamo un mix flessibile sul luogo di lavoro: goditi la ricchezza e il coinvolgimento della vita in ufficio, la comodità di casa o la libertà di quel posto molto carino adocchiato su Airbnb

Ownership. Dal primo giorno, sarai coinvolto in progetti sfidanti e concreti. Ogni contributo è prezioso e ti aspettiamo pronto a prenderti la responsabilità dei tuoi risultati. Avrai anche l'opportunità di ricevere quote societarie e partecipare direttamente al successo dell'azienda

Green & dream team. Siamo un team motivato, competente e con grandi ambizioni. Crediamo nel valore delle persone e nella forza delle relazioni. L'informalità e la fiducia si uniscono alla responsabilità e al desiderio di fare bene le cose. Qui ci si aiuta, si impara e si cresce insieme

Team building. Due volte l'anno ci prendiamo del tempo per rafforzare il nostro spirito di squadra: un retreat di più giorni e una giornata di team building. Occasioni per ricaricare le energie insieme, consolidare i legami e prepararci alle sfide future

Ferie illimitate. La fiducia si estende anche alla gestione dei momenti off. Decidi tu quando prenderti del tempo per ricaricarti, perché sappiamo che un team motivato è un team che sa gestire con responsabilità il proprio impegno

In Up2You, lavoriamo tanto e lo facciamo con passione. Il lavoro è parte della nostra vita, un elemento che ci ispira e ci sfida a fare sempre meglio. Se condividi questa visione, sei nel posto giusto.
Ti riconosci in questa descrizione? Allora ti aspettiamo a braccia aperte!
Il futuro è up to you.

Up2You è un datore di lavoro che offre pari opportunità. Promuoviamo un ambiente di lavoro che valorizza la diversità: non ci importa dell'etnia, del genere, della religione, dell'età, della disabilità, dell'orientamento sessuale o dell'identità. Ci interessa chi sei e cosa porti a Up2You, sia professionalmente che personalmente.

Piacere di conoscerti!

Siamo una società benefit e una B Corp certificata, specializzata nella creazione di soluzioni su misura che trasformano la sostenibilità in un vantaggio competitivo. Accompagniamo le aziende in ogni fase del loro percorso di sostenibilità, offrendo un approccio unico che combina team di esperti, piattaforme innovative e metodi efficaci. I nostri servizi aiutano le organizzazioni a misurare, ridurre e compensare le emissioni, migliorare la formazione, coinvolgere i dipendenti e comunicare in modo trasparente gli sforzi di sostenibilità. Il nostro obiettivo finale è rendere le aziende autonome e competenti nella gestione del loro impatto e nel miglioramento delle performance ESG.

Requirements

Se la persona giusta per Up2You se:

  • Hai una forte orientamento ai risultati. Siamo estremamente flessibili e confidiamo nella tua capacità di raggiungere i tuoi obiettivi senza una supervisione costante. Allo stesso modo, ci piace che la nostra fiducia venga ricambiata
column2: • Hai un forte interesse per la materia. Sei interessato a temi legati all'innovazione e all'ambiente. Come noi, credi nella necessità di agire concretamente per il nostro Pianeta
column3: • Ti consideri una persona intelligente e indipendente. Non aspetti istruzioni dettagliate per metterti al lavoro. Sei intraprendente, autonomo e proattivo
column4:
• Ti piace dare e ricevere feedback. Nessuno ha tutte le risposte e tutti abbiamo ancora molto da imparare. Sei aperto sia a dare che a ricevere feedback costruttivi

    • Benefits

    Lavorare con noi significa:

    • Flessibilità. In Up2You non esiste il cartellino. Lavoriamo per obiettivi e diamo valore alla tua capacità di gestire tempi e modalità di lavoro con autonomia e responsabilità. Scegli come organizzarti per dare il massimo, perché qui la libertà è uno strumento per raggiungere risultati eccellenti
    • Work-life integration. Per noi, il lavoro non è un obbligo da separare dalla vita, ma una parte integrante di ciò che siamo e vogliamo realizzare. Abbiamo obiettivi ambiziosi e ci dedichiamo con passione per raggiungerli. Se ami ciò che fai e vuoi contribuire ad un cambiamento significativo, in Up2You lavoro e vita si fondono in un'esperienza di crescita continua
    • Lavora ovunque. In Up2You abbiamo un mix flessibile sul luogo di lavoro: goditi la ricchezza e il coinvolgimento della vita in ufficio, la comodità di casa o la libertà di quel posto molto carino adocchiato su Airbnb
    • Ownership. Dal primo giorno, sarai coinvolto in progetti sfidanti e concreti. Ogni contributo è prezioso e ti aspettiamo pronto a prenderti la responsabilità dei tuoi risultati. Avrai anche l'opportunità di ricevere quote societarie e partecipare direttamente al successo dell'azienda
    • Green &

dream team. Siamo un team motivato, competente e con grandi ambizioni. Crediamo nel valore delle persone e nella forza delle relazioni. L'informalità e la fiducia si uniscono alla responsabilità e al desiderio di fare bene le cose. Qui ci si aiuta, si impara e si cresce insieme
  • Team building. Due volte l'anno ci prendiamo del tempo per rafforzare il nostro spirito di squadra: un retreat di più giorni e una giornata di team building. Occasioni per ricaricare le energie insieme, consolidare i legami e prepararci alle sfide future
  • Ferie illimitate. La fiducia si estende anche alla gestione dei momenti off. Decidi tu quando prenderti del tempo per ricaricarti, perché sappiamo che un team motivato è un team che sa gestire con responsabilità il proprio impegno

4237924959,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-stage-at-lynx-spa-4237924959?position=3&pageNum=5&refId=nHjILgruERVpFNv1pXWqag%3D%3D&trackingId=ofRDKcTpgcbr691d7b%2BnoQ%3D%3D,Junior Data Analyst (stage),Lynx Spa,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Il Gruppo Lynx è specializzato nella progettazione e realizzazione di soluzioni software presente in Italia, Spagna e America Latina con oltre 1.100 risorse ed è da anni partner di primarie realtà internazionali in molti settori di mercato, fra i quali Finance, Energy e Insurance.

I contesti che ci vedono protagonisti sul mercato sono caratterizzati da una forte componente innovativa, come ad esempio l’uso di metodologie quali DevOps, Agile e tecnologie Microservizi, front-end web innovativi, Big Data, Machine Learning, Intelligenza Artificiale e Cyber Security.
Siamo alla ricerca di profili junior entusiasti e motivati da inserire nella nostra Business Unit specializzata nello sviluppo di soluzioni di Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence e Big Data.
Percorso Formativo: Durante lo stage, i tirocinanti seguiranno un percorso formativo strutturato per fornire competenze tecniche e professionali nel settore IT.
Ecco una panoramica delle principali fasi:
Sistemi di basi dati e modelli relazionali
Introduzione ai concetti di Data Warehouse e Business Intelligence
Fondamenti di Statistica inferenziale e Machine Learning
Accesso a libri, corsi online e video training
Esercitazioni pratiche e quiz di autovalutazione
Utilizzo di tecnologie come Windows Server, SQL Server, MongoDB, Visual Code, Visual Studio e strumenti di BI come Power BI
Interfacciamento con un team e un referente di progetto
Partecipazione a meeting di stato avanzamento lavori
Laurea in Ingegneria Gestionale o Informatica (indirizzo Data Science/Machine Learning)
Conoscenza teorica di basi dati e modelli relazionali
Utilizzo avanzato del pacchetto MS Office (Excel, Word)
Flessibilità oraria e capacità di lavorare in team
Dedizione allo studio e forte volontà di apprendere
Un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e stimolante
Supporto costante da parte di un supervisore esperto
Possibilità di partecipare a progetti innovativi e di alto impatto

column2: Presenza richiesta in sede

column1: Contratto: tirocinio retribuito di 6 mesi finalizzato all’assunzione.

Se sei appassionato di IT e desideri iniziare la tua carriera in una realtà dinamica e innovativa, inviaci il tuo CV all'indirizzo cvannunci_mi@lynxspa.com, dichiarando di concedere l'autorizzazione per il trattamento dei dati personali in base all’art. 13 del D.Lgs n.196/03 e all’art. 13 del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679) e riportando nell'oggetto il riferimento all'annuncio.

Il Gruppo Lynx è specializzato nella progettazione e realizzazione di soluzioni software presente in Italia, Spagna e America Latina con oltre 1.100 risorse ed è da anni partner di primarie realtà internazionali in molti settori di mercato, fra i quali Finance, Energy e Insurance.

I contesti che ci vedono protagonisti sul mercato sono caratterizzati da una forte componente innovativa, come ad esempio l’uso di metodologie quali DevOps, Agile e tecnologie Microservizi, front-end web innovativi, Big Data, Machine Learning, Intelligenza Artificiale e Cyber Security.


Siamo alla ricerca di profili junior entusiasti e motivati da inserire nella nostra Business Unit specializzata nello sviluppo di soluzioni di Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence e Big Data.


Percorso Formativo: Durante lo stage, i tirocinanti seguiranno un percorso formativo strutturato per fornire competenze tecniche e professionali nel settore IT.


Ecco una panoramica delle principali fasi:


Studio Teorico:

  • Sistemi di basi dati e modelli relazionali
  • Linguaggi di programmazione: .NET 2012, C#, Python
  • Introduzione ai concetti di Data Warehouse e Business Intelligence
  • Fondamenti di Statistica inferenziale e Machine Learning
  • Approccio conoscitivo all'AI generativa


Autoapprendimento:

  • Accesso a libri, corsi online e video training
  • Esercitazioni pratiche e quiz di autovalutazione


Contestualizzazione Funzionale:

  • Apprendimento pratico tramite progetti reali
  • Utilizzo di tecnologie come Windows Server, SQL Server, MongoDB, Visual Code, Visual Studio e strumenti di BI come Power BI


Lavoro in Team:

  • Interfacciamento con un team e un referente di progetto
  • Partecipazione a meeting di stato avanzamento lavori


Requisiti necessari:

  • Laurea in Ingegneria Gestionale o Informatica (indirizzo Data Science/Machine Learning)
  • Conoscenza teorica di basi dati e modelli relazionali
  • Utilizzo avanzato del pacchetto MS Office (Excel, Word)
  • Flessibilità oraria e capacità di lavorare in team
  • Dedizione allo studio e forte volontà di apprendere


Cosa offriamo:

  • Un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e stimolante
  • Opportunità di crescita professionale
  • Supporto costante da parte di un supervisore esperto
  • Possibilità di partecipare a progetti innovativi e di alto impatto


Sede di lavoro: Milano

Se sei appassionato di IT e desideri iniziare la tua carriera in una realtà dinamica e innovativa, inviaci il tuo CV all'indirizzo cvannunci_mi@lynxspa.com, dichiarando di concedere l'autorizzazione per il trattamento dei dati personali in base all’art. 13 del D.Lgs n.196/03 e all’art. 13 del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679) e riportando nell'oggetto il riferimento all'annuncio.

4266426331,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/financial-planning-and-analysis-junior-at-naba-nuova-accademia-di-belle-arti-4266426331?position=4&pageNum=5&refId=nHjILgruERVpFNv1pXWqag%3D%3D&trackingId=omjtZ%2B1yQuhjJ%2BbUjWmF8w%3D%3D,"Financial, Planning and Analysis Junior",NABA Nuova Accademia di Belle Arti,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","NABA is currently seeking motivated individuals for the role of

The successful candidate will join the FP&A team in Milan. Reporting directly to the Financial Planning & Analysis Manager, he/she will support the team in providing financial and analytical insights to enhance business operations. In this role, the candidate will assist in ensuring easy access to financial data, tracking key projects, setting budgets, developing financial forecasts, and monitoring key performance indicators. Under the supervision of the FP&A Manager, she/ he will also contribute to the optimization and automation of financial processes, playing an active role in driving efficiency and accuracy within the department.
The selected candidate will carry out the following activities:
Supporting the preparation of monthly management reports by analyzing key variances and trends against forecasts.
Identifying the nature of variances (fixed/phasing) and promptly updating forecasts.
Assisting in revenue, cost, and CAPEX forecasting, collaborating with department heads.
Reconciling the latest forecast with budget values.
Supporting budget preparation for all entities by creating the Masterfile and consolidated NABA overview.
Uploading actual and budget data from SAP into the Group reporting tool Tagetik.
Monitoring FTE and student numbers via Tagetik, ensuring monthly updates.
Ensuring monthly reconciliation of intercompany transactions with Group entities.
The ideal candidate possesses the following qualifications and skills:
2-3years of experience in FP&A, Controlling, or Business Analysis, preferably in structured environments.
Strong skills in financial reporting, budgeting, forecasting, and management control.
Excellent knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint, and preferably SAP and Tagetik.
Analytical mindset, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills and ability to work in a team.
Degree in Economics, Finance, or related fields.
Good knowledge of English for reporting and group interactions.
If you meet these requirements and are motivated to contribute to business growth with strategic financial insights, we look forward to receiving your application!
Please, send your application and authorizing the treatment of personal data in compliance with the GDPR 679/16.

According to the GDPR 679/16 we inform you that the treatment of Personal Data contained in your resume, will respect the principles of legality, fairness and transparency and protection of your privacy and your rights. We only use the personal data we collect for the recruiting activities, such as your name, surname, address, email address, educational and employment background and job qualifications.

Financial, Planning and Analysis Junior

La risorsa selezionata, anche senza esperienza, avrà la possibilità di costruire una professionalità e una carriera nell’ambito della sicurezza, in un contesto aziendale solido e serio.

Come Guardia Particolare Giurata diverrai parte di un team destinato a garantire sicurezza e prevenzione dei beni dei nostri clienti. A titolo esemplificativo, potrai essere adibito ad attività di PIANTONAMENTO DINAMICO (presidio e controllo presso clienti) e sarai di supporto in attività di reception e controllo accessi.
Possesso di titoli prefettizi in corso di validità (Decreto e Porto d’arma) o disponibilità al conseguimento.
Disponibilità a lavorare su 3 turni/festivi e ad effettuare straordinari.
Cittadinanza italiana o di uno Stato membro dell’UE.
Il/la candidat* ideale ha il domicilio o la residenza in provincia di Milano.
Possibilità di assunzione con contratto a tempo indeterminato.
Applicazione CCNL vigilanza privata comprensivo di tredicesima e quattordicesima.
Il nostro obiettivo è la vostra tranquillità, la nostra forza è la forza di un gruppo, il nostro nome è garanzia di sicurezza. UNISCITI AL NOSTRO TEAM!

4284556137,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/addetto-a-al-confezionamento-assunzione-urgente-at-jobbit-4284556137?position=6&pageNum=5&refId=nHjILgruERVpFNv1pXWqag%3D%3D&trackingId=Y41ZXGTdo1n1Jlj0jFgG9w%3D%3D,ADDETTO/A AL CONFEZIONAMENTO - Assunzione Urgente,Jobbit,"Pieve Emanuele, Lombardy, Italy","Temporary S.p.A.

Temporary Spa, agenzia per il lavoro, ricerca per un'importante azienda operante nel settore alimentare un Addetto al Confezionamento per assunzione urgente a partire dal 18 agosto fino al 18 settembre.
La risorsa sarà inserita all'interno del reparto di produzione e si occuperà di confezionare i prodotti alimentari a fine linea, del picking e della preparazione dei bancali.
Eseguire il confezionamento dei prodotti alimentari secondo le procedure aziendali
Controllare la qualità del prodotto prima del confezionamento
Etichettare i prodotti in modo preciso e conforme agli standard
Gestire il corretto utilizzo delle attrezzature di confezionamento
Mantenere l'area di lavoro ordinata e pulita, nel rispetto delle normative igienico-sanitarie
Collaborare con il team di produzione per garantire efficienza e puntualità nelle consegne
Esperienza pregressa nel confezionamento, preferibilmente nel settore alimentare
Capacità di lavorare in team e di rispettare le scadenze
Ottima attenzione ai dettagli e abilità nel controllo qualità
Conoscenza delle norme igienico-sanitarie e sicurezza alimentare

Tipo di occupazione: Lavoro temporaneo a scopo assunzione

Temporary S.p.A.

Temporary Spa, agenzia per il lavoro, ricerca per un'importante azienda operante nel settore alimentare un Addetto al Confezionamento per assunzione urgente a partire dal 18 agosto fino al 18 settembre.

La risorsa sarà inserita all'interno del reparto di produzione e si occuperà di confezionare i prodotti alimentari a fine linea, del picking e della preparazione dei bancali.

Mansioni

  • Eseguire il confezionamento dei prodotti alimentari secondo le procedure aziendali
  • Controllare la qualità del prodotto prima del confezionamento
  • Etichettare i prodotti in modo preciso e conforme agli standard
  • Gestire il corretto utilizzo delle attrezzature di confezionamento
  • Mantenere l'area di lavoro ordinata e pulita, nel rispetto delle normative igienico-sanitarie
  • Collaborare con il team di produzione per garantire efficienza e puntualità nelle consegne

Requisiti

  • Esperienza pregressa nel confezionamento, preferibilmente nel settore alimentare
  • Capacità di lavorare in team e di rispettare le scadenze
  • Ottima attenzione ai dettagli e abilità nel controllo qualità
  • Flessibilità oraria
  • Conoscenza delle norme igienico-sanitarie e sicurezza alimentare
  • Patente di guida per raggiungere il luogo di lavoro

Luogo di lavoro: Pieve Emanuele (MI)

  • 7.00-16.00
  • 8.00-17.00
  • 9.00-18.00
  • 10.00-19.00
  • 11.00-20.00

4263961196,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-rode-kruis-vlaanderen-4263961196?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=p%2F6uFCBzf7qZQmlGd1a1CA%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen,"Mechelen, Flemish Region, Belgium","Intro

Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen zorgt ervoor dat ziekenhuizen in Vlaanderen altijd beschikken over voldoende veilig en kwalitatief bloed. Een belangrijke opdracht waarin we elke dag slagen dankzij de enthousiaste inzet van talloze medewerkers.

Onze humanitaire diensten zijn dan weer actief in binnen- en buitenland. Samen met onze vrijwilligers staan we in voor de meest diverse opdrachten: jeugdwerking, preventie, hulp bij rampen en events, sociale hulpverlening, internationale hulp, opvang van verzoekers om internationale bescherming, eerstehulpopleidingen, enzovoort.

Onze experts ICT, Finance, Aankoop, Logistiek, HR en Communicatie vind je in onze Centraal Ondersteunende Diensten. Zij zorgen er elke dag voor dat alle medewerkers, donoren en vrijwilligers hun missie kunnen opnemen: ‘helpen helpen'.

Als Business Intelligence Analist draag je je steentje bij in het optimaliseren van uiteenlopende activiteiten van onze organisatie (van preventieve eerste hulp tot voldoende veilig bloed). Omwille van deze uiteenlopende activiteiten beschikt Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen over een grote hoeveelheid aan data die heel divers is. Op basis van de noden van de business, zorg je er mee voor dat de juiste data beschikbaar zijn en gevisualiseerd kunnen worden om hen nieuwe inzichten te verschaffen.
Een veelzijdige en complexe datapool als fundament voor analyses en data gedreven beslissingen.
Een positieve bijdrage leveren aan de maatschappij als grote doel.

Als Business Intelligence Analist breng je de noden in kaart, analyseer je de data en zet je deze op een creatieve manier om in systemen en tools die de operationele processen, risico's en strategieën visualiseren
Je gaat intern en extern proactief op zoek naar informatie en geeft de business nieuwe inzichten waarmee ze verder aan de slag kan gaan
Je weet de behoeften van business te vertalen naar betekenisvolle en overzichtelijke visualisaties en rapporteringsvormen en formuleert advies m.b.t. deze duidelijk interpreteerbare datavoorstelling
Je werkt nauw samen met andere technische analisten, ontwikkelaars, proces ingenieurs en dienstverantwoordelijken
Je formuleert verbetervoorstellen en onderhoudt en bewaakt de best practices m.b.t. het gebruik van de tools en rapportontwikkelingen
Je staat in voor de opleiding van anderen in deze rapporteringstools
Je communiceert op regelmatige basis met je interne klanten omtrent hun verwachtingen en gaat op zoek naar het juiste cijfermateriaal
Als data-expert adviseer je diensten en collega's in een veelzijdige werkomgeving.
Je werkt zowel voor de centrale diensten als voor de Humanitaire Diensten en de afdelingen die zich met Bloed bezighouden. Zo draag je bij aan de maatschappelijke missie van Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen.

Je hebt kennis van Business Intelligence tools en methodologieën en bovendien ben je sterk geïnteresseerd in IT. Kennis van PowerBI en Microsoft Azure (Data Factory, Synapse) is vereist. SQL kennis en kennis van data modellering is wenselijk.
Je genoot een master opleiding of gelijkwaardig door ervaring
Je bent geïnteresseerd in een (bio)medische context of humanitaire dienstverlening
Je beschikt over een aantal jaar relevante ervaring
Je bent sterk in het capteren van noden en het analyseren van data
Je hebt oog voor detail. Details kunnen in een wetenschappelijke omgeving immers van groot belang zijn
Je bent een sterke communicator, weet prioriteiten naar voren te brengen en anderen te overtuigen van je inzichten
Je hebt zin voor initiatief en je bent ondernemend.
Je wil je engageren voor een organisatie met maatschappelijke impact.

Je draait mee in een veelzijdige, boeiende organisatie met maatschappelijke meerwaarde waarbij jouw expertise er mee voor zorgt dat Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen die meerwaarde evidence-based en data-driven kan bieden
Een marktconform salaris in functie van je ervaring
On the job training en coaching is een continu proces. Er is blijvende ondersteuning van consultants om bij te leren
Een voltijdse functie met een contract van onbepaalde duur.

Intro

Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen zorgt ervoor dat ziekenhuizen in Vlaanderen altijd beschikken over voldoende veilig en kwalitatief bloed. Een belangrijke opdracht waarin we elke dag slagen dankzij de enthousiaste inzet van talloze medewerkers.


Onze humanitaire diensten zijn dan weer actief in binnen- en buitenland. Samen met onze vrijwilligers staan we in voor de meest diverse opdrachten: jeugdwerking, preventie, hulp bij rampen en events, sociale hulpverlening, internationale hulp, opvang van verzoekers om internationale bescherming, eerstehulpopleidingen, enzovoort.


Onze experts ICT, Finance, Aankoop, Logistiek, HR en Communicatie vind je in onze Centraal Ondersteunende Diensten. Zij zorgen er elke dag voor dat alle medewerkers, donoren en vrijwilligers hun missie kunnen opnemen: ‘helpen helpen'.


Als Business Intelligence Analist draag je je steentje bij in het optimaliseren van uiteenlopende activiteiten van onze organisatie (van preventieve eerste hulp tot voldoende veilig bloed). Omwille van deze uiteenlopende activiteiten beschikt Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen over een grote hoeveelheid aan data die heel divers is. Op basis van de noden van de business, zorg je er mee voor dat de juiste data beschikbaar zijn en gevisualiseerd kunnen worden om hen nieuwe inzichten te verschaffen.


Functiebeschrijving


Microsoft Azure als dataplatform.

Een veelzijdige en complexe datapool als fundament voor analyses en data gedreven beslissingen.

Een positieve bijdrage leveren aan de maatschappij als grote doel.

You'll collaborate with powerful APIs (like Channable and Social Media APIs) and build seamless data pipelines across Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, and our broader IT stack.

Deep experience with SQL and Spark SQL
Solid grasp of dimensional data modelling

Ability to build and manage PySpark applications on Databricks

Ability to maintain naming conventions, documentation, and data taxonomies
Marketing data experience is a plus

If you're looking to make an impact in the marketing tech space with a forward-thinking team and cutting-edge tools — we'd love to hear from you.
📩 Apply now or message us to learn more!

*** Freelance Data Engineer (Remote | Marketing Technology Team) ***


Join our prestigious Client's Marketing Technology Team as a Freelance Data Engineer, where you’ll work at the cutting edge of data integration and digital marketing. You'll collaborate with powerful APIs (like Channable and Social Media APIs) and build seamless data pipelines across Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, and our broader IT stack.


What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Designing, developing, and maintaining robust data integration pipelines using Databricks and Azure Synapse Analytics
  • Collaborating closely with stakeholders and data product users to understand needs and solve real-world challenges
  • Enhancing and optimizing existing processes for performance, reliability, and scalability


What You’ll Need to Succeed:

  • Strong problem-solving mindset and a collaborative, analytical approach
  • Deep experience with SQL and Spark SQL
  • Solid grasp of dimensional data modelling
  • Proven experience with Azure Synapse Analytics and Databricks
  • Ability to build and manage PySpark applications on Databricks
  • Familiarity with streaming data ingestion, Python, Git, CI/CD, and the broader Microsoft Azure stack
  • Detail-oriented with a passion for clean, high-quality data
  • Ability to maintain naming conventions, documentation, and data taxonomies
  • Marketing data experience is a plus
  • Proactive, self-motivated, and a strong team player


🌍 Remote | Freelance


If you're looking to make an impact in the marketing tech space with a forward-thinking team and cutting-edge tools — we'd love to hear from you.


📩 Apply now or message us to learn more!

4276025730,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-analyst-at-engie-international-supply-energy-management-4276025730?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=4YzsEJIbOkycyd9BMOSQjw%3D%3D,Quantitative Analyst,ENGIE - International Supply & Energy Management,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Quantitative analyst

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 100,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress

BU Supply & Energy Management provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients (businesses and retail) through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

15000 employees around the world develop our solutions, through international business platforms and B2C entities. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors, industrials and retail. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.
At S&EM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation

Context: The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within GEMS is a team of around 115 quantitative analysts. It’s mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to all Business Platforms (BP) of GEMS and to Engie worldwide. The quantitative analyst will be part of the “Pricing” team (approximately 15 people) and will be fully dedicated to the Business Platform Power Trading & Commercial.
The quantitative analyst should design and provide robust quantitative tools that have a concrete impact on the power business:

Work very closely with the BP Power Trading & Commercial, mainly with the Renewable and Batteries Trading team and the Asset Backed Power Trading team. He / She needs to understand their business needs, and needs to provide them with high-quality quantitative support in their day to day activities.
Participate in enhancing the existing pricing and managing framework.
Deliver ad hoc tactical solutions as well as develop new pricers in the official pricing library.
Play a key role for developing new products, linked for example to the renewable and battery business (pricing, managing strategies, various risk indicators, …).
Promote best coding practices that comply with general rules and standards.
Document and share knowledge across GEMS on the different models used within GEMS.
Strong Financial Mathematical background (probability, stochastic calculus, various numerical methods such as Monte Carlo, finite differences, …)
Coding experience (preferably C# and python), object oriented programming skills
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues
Engineering or university degree (Master of PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Financial Engineering.
0 to 3 years of experience in a similar role.
Travels: Occasional travels (for example conferences) are possible, but limited.
If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!
Apply by attaching your updated CV.
ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

Master’s degree (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Economics)

DynaFin is a consulting company with 15 years of experience in delivering high quality services to one single sector: Financial Services. We have built a team of > 150 financial services experts in Belgium, Luxembourg and France, passionate to support the sustainable transformation of the financial industry.
DynaFin advises this key sector of the global economy to boost its operating performance and innovate for the future.
We provide unique and pragmatic solutions to address market challenges, bundled in 5 DynaFin core expertises:

Since 2017, DynaFin is part of Alan Allman Associates, a worldwide ecosystem of 20 strong brands specialized in strategy and digital transformation, representing 3.200 Consultants. AAA aims to bring together the expertise of its brands, allowing DynaFin to create integrated end to end services for our customers

We are looking for a Data Analyst with strong expertise in data warehousing and modelling to support data-driven initiatives within a banking environment. The analyst will work closely with business stakeholders, architects, and delivery teams to translate complex business needs into reliable and scalable data solutions.


Responsibilities:

  • Analyse and challenge business requirements and translate them into structured functional and technical specifications
  • Collaborate with Solution Architects to ensure alignment with existing data architecture
  • Model and document data structures using 3NF and dimensional modelling (Kimball methodology)
  • Support the design, validation, and optimisation of ETL processes
  • Conduct impact analysis and formulate clear solution proposals
  • Maintain consistent and structured documentation of requirements, models, and solutions
  • Support testing and validation activities (e.g. defect analysis, UAT follow-up)
  • Contribute to knowledge sharing, peer reviews, and team improvement efforts
  • Actively participate in Agile ceremonies (e.g. sprint planning, retrospectives)
  • Identify data-related risks and ensure compliance with internal governance and security standards


Profile:

  • Master’s degree (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Economics)
  • Minimum 3 years of experience as a data analyst, business analyst, or functional analyst in a complex environment
  • Deep knowledge of data modelling techniques: 3NF, Kimball/star schema (facts/dimensions)
  • Strong SQL skills and solid experience with ETL tools
  • Experience with Oracle and Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) is a strong asset
  • Knowledge of Data Vault modelling is a plus
  • Able to work independently and provide structured input to project teams
  • Precise, analytical, and solution-focused approach
  • Fluent in Dutch (mandatory), with a good command of English or French


About Dynafin Consulting

4270751599,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/job-data-analyst-risk-finance-brussel-at-belfius-4270751599?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=YZuctj79wzwxIOuPgZbdwQ%3D%3D,Job | Data Analyst Risk & Finance | Brussel,Belfius,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Omschrijving

De belangrijkste focus van het team is het tijdig en kwalitatief aanleveren van data uit het Risk & Finance domein. Dit domein omvat onder meer data over klantenrentabiliteit, risico-positie en het balansbeheer van de bank. Met onze recurrente rapportering en ad-hoc analyses zorgen we ervoor dat onze stakeholders op het juiste moment over de juiste data beschikken om hun beslissingen te kunnen nemen.

In deze rol bouw je mee aan een breed spectrum van dataoplossingen. Enerzijds zet je je schouders onder het ontwikkelen van data-flows, nieuwe rapporten of automatisering van bestaande rapporten. Hiervoor ga je rechtstreeks in gesprek met de eindgebruikers om hun noden te begrijpen en tot de meest ideale oplossing te komen. Anderzijds ben je ook in staat om zelfstandig specifieke ad-hoc analyses uit te voeren binnen het domein.

Je komt terecht in uitdagende en transversale omgeving waar je in aanraking komt met veel verschillende aspecten van de bank. Je krijgt een hoge mate van autonomie en houdt ervan om hierbinnen end-to-end verantwoordelijkheid te nemen over je projecten.
Je analyseert de informatienoden van verschillende stakeholders en vertaalt die naar dataoplossingen.
Je neemt verantwoordelijkheid over de verschillende elementen bij het ontwikkelen van de dataproducten.
Je werkt aan nieuwe rapportering of uitbreiding van bestaande rapporten.
Je bouwt herbruikbare datasets of ontwikkelt programma’s voor data-integratie, -transformatie en -preparatie.
Je maakt ad-hoc analyses om specifieke vragen te beantwoorden.
Je waakt over de kwaliteit van onze data, maar ook over de veiligheid en confidentialiteit van de gegevens.
Jij hoeft geen witte raaf te zijn
Al kan je er bij ons wel één worden. Bij ons mag je volop je vleugels uitslaan indien je voldoet aan de volgende voorwaarden:
Een masterdiploma Informatica, Ingenieur of Economie met informatica-oriëntatie of een aantal jaren relevante ervaring in dit domein.
Een autonome, proactieve, planmatige, flexibele en resultaatgerichte aanpak.
Een analytische en synthetische geest: in staat om complexe situaties te analyseren en te structureren.
Je hebt een sterke interesse voor technologie en alle evoluties op technologisch vlak.
Goede communicatievaardigheden: je begrijpt het functionele aspect en bent in staat om dit naar een technische oplossing te vertalen
Je hebt een basiskennis en ervating met data en data-transformaties met bijvoorbeeld SQL, Hadoop, (Py)Spark, Python,... en bent bereid om je hier verder in te ontwikkelen
Je hebt kennis van Finance en/of Risk Managment, bij voorkeur in een bancaire context.
Ervaring met een BI-tool (bijvoorbeeld QlikSense, PowerBI, SAP BO,...) en data visualisatie.
Ervaring met Microsoft Azure cloud services (Azure Synapse, devops).
Behalve de kans om elke dag te shinen, bieden wij jou een fulltime contract van onbepaalde duur met:

Een mooi loon aangevuld met een innovatief aanbod om een persoonlijk budget samen te stellen dat je kan besteden volgens je voorkeuren (bv. wagen, fiets, pc, smartphone, tablet, huisvesting onder bepaalde voorwaarden) en extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, personeelsvoordeel op eigen producten en diensten, en een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Mogelijkheden te over om je te ontwikkelen door een brede waaier aan opleidingen en carrièrekansen in de hele Belfius-groep
Een goede werk-privé balans dankzij flexibele uren, de combinatie kantoor- en thuiswerk en een aantrekkelijk aantal vakantiedagen

Een moderne werkplek in het hart van Brussel met een coole fitness, een lekker gezond restaurant en gezellige ontmoetingsruimtes, dit alles op wandelafstand van de winkelstraat, het treinstation Brussel-Noord en de metrohalte Rogier

Omschrijving

De belangrijkste focus van het team is het tijdig en kwalitatief aanleveren van data uit het Risk &
column2:
Finance domein. Dit domein omvat onder meer data over klantenrentabiliteit, risico-positie en het balansbeheer van de bank. Met onze recurrente rapportering en ad-hoc analyses zorgen we ervoor dat onze stakeholders op het juiste moment over de juiste data beschikken om hun beslissingen te kunnen nemen.

In deze rol bouw je mee aan een breed spectrum van dataoplossingen. Enerzijds zet je je schouders onder het ontwikkelen van data-flows, nieuwe rapporten of automatisering van bestaande rapporten. Hiervoor ga je rechtstreeks in gesprek met de eindgebruikers om hun noden te begrijpen en tot de meest ideale oplossing te komen. Anderzijds ben je ook in staat om zelfstandig specifieke ad-hoc analyses uit te voeren binnen het domein.

Je komt terecht in uitdagende en transversale omgeving waar je in aanraking komt met veel verschillende aspecten van de bank. Je krijgt een hoge mate van autonomie en houdt ervan om hierbinnen end-to-end verantwoordelijkheid te nemen over je projecten.

De job in een notendop

  • Je analyseert de informatienoden van verschillende stakeholders en vertaalt die naar dataoplossingen.
  • Je neemt verantwoordelijkheid over de verschillende elementen bij het ontwikkelen van de dataproducten.
  • Je werkt aan nieuwe rapportering of uitbreiding van bestaande rapporten.
  • Je bouwt herbruikbare datasets of ontwikkelt programma’s voor data-integratie, -transformatie en -preparatie.
  • Je maakt ad-hoc analyses om specifieke vragen te beantwoorden.
  • Je waakt over de kwaliteit van onze data, maar ook over de veiligheid en confidentialiteit van de gegevens.


Jij hoeft geen witte raaf te zijn

Al kan je er bij ons wel één worden. Bij ons mag je volop je vleugels uitslaan indien je voldoet aan de volgende voorwaarden:

  • Een masterdiploma Informatica, Ingenieur of Economie met informatica-oriëntatie of een aantal jaren relevante ervaring in dit domein.
  • Een autonome, proactieve, planmatige, flexibele en resultaatgerichte aanpak.
  • Sterk gericht op samenwerking.
  • Een analytische en synthetische geest: in staat om complexe situaties te analyseren en te structureren.
  • Je hebt een sterke interesse voor technologie en alle evoluties op technologisch vlak.
  • Goede communicatievaardigheden: je begrijpt het functionele aspect en bent in staat om dit naar een technische oplossing te vertalen
  • Je hebt een basiskennis en ervating met data en data-transformaties met bijvoorbeeld SQL, Hadoop, (Py)Spark, Python,... en bent bereid om je hier verder in te ontwikkelen


Je scoort extra met:

  • Tweetaligheid (Nederlands/Frans).
  • Je hebt kennis van Finance en/of Risk Managment, bij voorkeur in een bancaire context.
  • Ervaring met een BI-tool (bijvoorbeeld QlikSense, PowerBI, SAP BO,...) en data visualisatie.
  • Ervaring met Microsoft Azure cloud services (Azure Synapse, devops).


Belfius koestert zijn talenten

Behalve de kans om elke dag te shinen, bieden wij jou een fulltime contract van onbepaalde duur met:

  • Een mooi loon aangevuld met een innovatief aanbod om een persoonlijk budget samen te stellen dat je kan besteden volgens je voorkeuren (bv. wagen, fiets, pc, smartphone, tablet, huisvesting onder bepaalde voorwaarden) en extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, personeelsvoordeel op eigen producten en diensten, en een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
  • Mogelijkheden te over om je te ontwikkelen door een brede waaier aan opleidingen en carrièrekansen in de hele Belfius-groep
  • Een goede werk-privé balans dankzij flexibele uren, de combinatie kantoor- en thuiswerk en een aantrekkelijk aantal vakantiedagen
  • Een moderne werkplek in het hart van Brussel met een coole fitness, een lekker gezond restaurant en gezellige ontmoetingsruimtes, dit alles op wandelafstand van de winkelstraat, het treinstation Brussel-Noord en de metrohalte Rogier

4279473357,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-analyst-at-in4matic-4279473357?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=GUps7oyYYFsNF89kw205bg%3D%3D,Senior Data Analyst,In4Matic,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","We're looking for a skilled consultant to join our client's dynamic team focused on enhancing health data integration. This role emphasizes ensuring high-quality data services, contributing to a system that enables all insured individuals access to effective medical services while supporting individuals in maintaining their employment capability post-disability.

The ideal candidate will engage regularly with diverse business stakeholders, including data teams and subject matter experts, to gather and understand their specific data needs. Responsibilities include:
Identifying and assessing business processes, as well as operational and analytics data flows (both incoming and outgoing).
Translating client needs into clear data and technical requirements.
Collaborating with Data Architects to design data architecture and validate data models.
Establishing functional designs in collaboration with the Data Governance team and Technical Leads.
Working alongside the Data Protection Officer to ensure compliance with GDPR and security standards.
Participating in testing and validating developed data products and serving as a user liaison for ongoing training and improvements post-delivery.
The successful candidate will possess a strong foundation in data functional analysis, demonstrated through extensive experience and technical capabilities:
A Master’s degree in Computer Science or comparable experience.
A minimum of 10 years in data functional analysis.
Proficient in data modeling, especially conceptual and logical modeling within a data warehouse framework (preferably using the Kimball methodology).
Experience in designing and analyzing diverse data flows.
Prior experience as a data engineer is advantageous.
The candidate should excel in communication and collaboration, with a solid understanding of both business and technical aspects. Key traits include:
Fluency in both Dutch and French, with excellent communication skills in speaking, reading, and writing.
Strong presentation skills and an ability to translate business needs into technical solutions.
A proactive attitude, coupled with a sense of ownership and autonomy.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities and a pragmatic, results-oriented mindset.
Exceptional relationship-building skills with the capacity to establish trust and rapport with stakeholders.
Demonstrated flexibility, perseverance, and a willingness to learn.

We're looking for a skilled consultant to join our client's dynamic team focused on enhancing health data integration. This role emphasizes ensuring high-quality data services, contributing to a system that enables all insured individuals access to effective medical services while supporting individuals in maintaining their employment capability post-disability.

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate will engage regularly with diverse business stakeholders, including data teams and subject matter experts, to gather and understand their specific data needs. Responsibilities include:

  • Identifying and assessing business processes, as well as operational and analytics data flows (both incoming and outgoing).
  • Translating client needs into clear data and technical requirements.
  • Collaborating with Data Architects to design data architecture and validate data models.
  • Establishing functional designs in collaboration with the Data Governance team and Technical Leads.
  • Working alongside the Data Protection Officer to ensure compliance with GDPR and security standards.
  • Participating in testing and validating developed data products and serving as a user liaison for ongoing training and improvements post-delivery.


Technical Skills

The successful candidate will possess a strong foundation in data functional analysis, demonstrated through extensive experience and technical capabilities:

  • A Master’s degree in Computer Science or comparable experience.
  • A minimum of 10 years in data functional analysis.
  • Proficient in data modeling, especially conceptual and logical modeling within a data warehouse framework (preferably using the Kimball methodology).
  • Experience in designing and analyzing diverse data flows.
  • Prior experience as a data engineer is advantageous.


Profile of the Ideal Candidate

The candidate should excel in communication and collaboration, with a solid understanding of both business and technical aspects. Key traits include:

  • Fluency in both Dutch and French, with excellent communication skills in speaking, reading, and writing.
  • Strong presentation skills and an ability to translate business needs into technical solutions.
  • A proactive attitude, coupled with a sense of ownership and autonomy.
  • Excellent problem-solving capabilities and a pragmatic, results-oriented mindset.
  • Exceptional relationship-building skills with the capacity to establish trust and rapport with stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated flexibility, perseverance, and a willingness to learn.

4278785880,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-bi-data-analyst-at-coinspaid-4278785880?position=7&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=HeKDlMmCL%2BTFfrAWFyMUmA%3D%3D,Senior BI Data Analyst,CoinsPaid,European Union,"CoinsPaid offers ready-to-use crypto payment solutions tailored to business’ every need. Standing at the forefront of mass adoption, our products help businesses gear up for the new era of digital assets. We showed a tremendous growth in terms of transactions and volumes since 2019 and in 2023 were marked by Forbes as the ""Best Crypto Payment Gateway for High-Volume Transactions"".

Headquartered in Estonia and having 3 international hubs, we are still a remote-first company with employees working from 30+ countries around the world. At CoinsPaid, we are passionate about crypto, fintech and are putting great effort into building a team that will get the world ready for every-day crypto use. If these feel close to you - give us a shout!

Analyzing and interpreting complex data sets from various sources (e.g., blockchain transactions, financial markets, and customer data), using statistical techniques and data visualization tools to identify patterns, trends, and insights
Developing, maintaining, and optimizing SQL queries (Columnar databases) to ensure data accuracy, efficiency, and accessibility, perform statistical data analysis
Leveraging your expertise in Python to design and implement advanced data models, predictive analytics, and machine learning algorithms to support business decision-making and strategic initiatives

Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders, to translate data insights into actionable recommendations and to develop data-driven strategies for our products and services
Creating and maintaining comprehensive documentation of data analysis processes, methodologies, and results, ensuring that key findings are effectively communicated to relevant stakeholders
Working with key stakeholders to identify needs and report outputs to answer questions and drive decisions
Staying current with industry trends and best practices in data analysis, blockchain, and finance, and identifying opportunities for improving our data infrastructure and analytical capabilities
English B2+ and experience of verbal communication in international teams
Strong experience with Tableau data visualization
Internally-motivated, self-starter mindset with an analytical thinking and curiousity to help find insights and show the value of data-driven decision making
Ability to work cross-functionally and communicate with technical and non-technical teams
Detail-oriented approach with a passion for analytics and problem-solving
Proficiency in English and Russian, written and verbal
Experience with Vertica or similar columnar database
Demonstrable experience in the blockchain or finance domain
Experience or familiarity with forecasting data (Python, R)
Experience building and maintaining data pipelines, ETL processes in Apache Airflow
Experience or familiarity with Machine Learning algorithms and their real-world advantages/drawbacks

To become a part of this solid team, passionate about their jobs and the crypto industry as a whole. To feel a great team spirit and meet people supporting each other's growth and development. To become a part of a rapidly developing international company and a crypto payments leader. Only in 2024 CoinsPaid was awarded more than 10 times:
- Acquisition International 2024 - Best Crypto-payment Solutions Firm 2024 - Europe

Sounds good? Well then, we can’t wait to see your resume!
To learn more please visit: https://coinspaid.com/about-us/ & https://coinspaid.com/careers/

Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond. Your journey with us

The Payroll & Reward Analyst will play an important role in the Reward & Analytics team, part of the Deloitte People & Purpose department (internal focus). In this entry level role you will provide analytical support and insights to drive people strategies in various domains: reward, workforce planning, budgeting, payroll, etc. This position requires a strong analytical mindset to ensure high data quality and accuracy
column2: you need to be attentive to detail and have the ability to understand the data generation process. At the same time, we also need a person that relates well with the business, communicates efficiently, and can translate complex data into actionable recommendations.

column1: Data Analysis: Collect, analyse, and interpret data related to employee compensation, benefits, and rewards.
Reporting: Develop and maintain regular reports and dashboards to track key metrics and trends in employee rewards and benefits.
Operational Payroll Support: Reporting and controls of Master Data, mobility- & benefit-related data.
Benchmarking: Support market research and benchmarking studies to ensure competitive compensation and benefits packages.
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business, Economics, Statistics, or a related field.
Experience: experience in HR analytics, compensation, or a related field.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Power BI) and HRIS systems.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy and attention to detail in all aspects of work.
Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple priorities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Dutch, with the ability to present data-driven insights clearly and concisely.

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.

Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities
Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.
Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!
Can’t wait to make an impact on the world?

This role blends technical expertise with training and knowledge sharing, you’ll deliver high-quality analysis while helping business users get the most from analytics tools.

Experience reviewing code with a focus on clean coding principles
Experience in the financial sector is a plus

Ability to train, support, and guide business users in analytics
Language: Fluent in French or Dutch, + English

4276024830,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-analyst-at-engie-international-supply-energy-management-4276024830?position=11&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=aa4CMilC0VFb1o9PYPu6Fw%3D%3D,Quantitative Analyst,ENGIE - International Supply & Energy Management,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Quantitative analyst

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 100,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress

BU Supply & Energy Management provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients (businesses and retail) through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

15000 employees around the world develop our solutions, through international business platforms and B2C entities. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors, industrials and retail. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.
At S&EM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation

Context: The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within GEMS is a team of around 115 quantitative analysts. It’s mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to all Business Platforms (BP) of GEMS and to Engie worldwide. The quantitative analyst will be part of the “Pricing” team (approximately 15 people) and will be fully dedicated to the Business Platform Power Trading & Commercial.
The quantitative analyst should design and provide robust quantitative tools that have a concrete impact on the power business:

Work very closely with the BP Power Trading & Commercial, mainly with the Renewable and Batteries Trading team and the Asset Backed Power Trading team. He / She needs to understand their business needs, and needs to provide them with high-quality quantitative support in their day to day activities.
Participate in enhancing the existing pricing and managing framework.
Deliver ad hoc tactical solutions as well as develop new pricers in the official pricing library.
Play a key role for developing new products, linked for example to the renewable and battery business (pricing, managing strategies, various risk indicators, …).
Promote best coding practices that comply with general rules and standards.
Document and share knowledge across GEMS on the different models used within GEMS.
Strong Financial Mathematical background (probability, stochastic calculus, various numerical methods such as Monte Carlo, finite differences, …)
Coding experience (preferably C# and python), object oriented programming skills
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues
Engineering or university degree (Master of PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Financial Engineering.
0 to 3 years of experience in a similar role.
Travels: Occasional travels (for example conferences) are possible, but limited.
If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!
Apply by attaching your updated CV.
ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

4249634815,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-consultant-v-m-x-at-amaris-consulting-4249634815?position=12&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=pY7rY%2FC1M7oYG%2B50QClxdw%3D%3D,Data Consultant V/M/X,Amaris Consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Who are we?
Amaris Consulting is een onafhankelijke technologie consultancy bedrijf dat ondersteuning en oplossingen biedt aan bedrijven.
Met meer dan 1 000 klanten over de wereld hebben we veel oplossingen uitgerold voor grote projecten voor meer dan een decennium.

Dit is mogelijk gemaakt door ons internationale team met meer dan 7 600 professionals verspreidt over 5 continenten in meer dan 60 landen. Onze oplossingen richten zich op vier business lijnen: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering.

We zijn gefocussed op het bouwen en behouden van een top talent gemeenschap waarin al onze team leden hun volle potentie kunnen behalen. Amaris is je ‘steppingstone’ om een rivier van veranderingen over te steken, uitdagingen aan te gaan en om je projecten met succes af te ronden.

Bij Amaris Consulting zijn we op zoek naar veelzijdige en ambitieuze professionals om ons Data & AI Center of Excellence te versterken als Data Consultant. Of je nu gespecialiseerd bent in analytics, engineering of machine learning: jouw ervaring doet ertoe bij ons.
Wat doet een Data Consultant bij Amaris?

Als Data Consultant werk je aan strategische en technische projecten die jouw expertise combineren met de behoeften van toonaangevende organisaties. Jouw missie? Klanten helpen om waarde te halen uit hun data – of dat nu betekent: robuuste datapijplijnen bouwen, businessinzichten leveren, ML-modellen implementeren of datagovernance verbeteren.
Wij verwelkomen professionals met ervaring in een of meerdere van de volgende profielen:

Je past machine learning en statistische technieken toe om zakelijke problemen op te lossen, van voorspellende modellen tot aanbevelingssystemen. Je bent vertrouwd met Python, scikit-learn en experimentatie-frameworks, en je weet hoe je inzichten omzet in tastbare bedrijfswaarde.

Je ontwerpt, bouwt en onderhoudt schaalbare datapijplijnen en -platformen. Je werkt met cloudtools (Azure, AWS, GCP), orkestratietools (Airflow, dbt) en big data-frameworks (Spark, Databricks) om schone, betrouwbare en toegankelijke data te garanderen.

Je operationaliseert machine learning-modellen en overbrugt de kloof tussen data science en productie. Je hebt ervaring met CI/CD, containerisatie (Docker, Kubernetes), MLOps-pijplijnen en de implementatie van modellen in real-time- of batchomgevingen.

Je onderzoekt en visualiseert data om bruikbare inzichten te bieden. Je bent vertrouwd met SQL, BI-tools (Power BI, Tableau), Excel en basiskennis van Python. Je weet hoe je KPI’s structureert, dashboards bouwt en overtuigende dataverhalen vertelt aan stakeholders.
🔥 Wat je doet als Data Consultant:
Samenwerken in multidisciplinaire teams met engineers, wetenschappers, analisten en projectmanagers
Bijdragen aan volledige dataprojectlevenscycli: van verkenning en ontwerp tot ontwikkeling, testen en implementatie
Analyseren en beoordelen van datasystemen, -architectuur of -kwaliteit van de klant en aanbevelingen doen ter verbetering
Technische oplossingen vormgeven en implementeren in cloud-, hybride of on-premises omgevingen
Klantbehoeften vertalen naar datastrategieën en oplossingen die tastbare impact genereren
Deelnemen aan interne R&D-initiatieven en bijdragen aan accelerators en assets van ons Center of Excellence
Wij zijn technologie-agnostisch en pragmatisch: we passen onze stack aan op de behoeften van de klant. Veelgebruikte technologieën zijn o.a.:
Cloudplatforms: Azure (Data Factory, Synapse, Purview), AWS, GCP
Orkestratie & Transformatie: dbt, Airflow, Kedro, Dataform
Analytics & BI: Power BI, Tableau, Looker
MLOps & DevOps: MLflow, Docker, Git, CI/CD pipelines
Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist, Engineer, Analyst of ML Engineer
Ervaring met consultancy of een sterke interesse in klantgerichte rollen
Zowel technisch onderlegd als nieuwsgierig naar businessinzichten

column2: kennis van Frans of Nederlands is een plus

column1: 🚀 Waarom werken in ons Data & AI Center of Excellence?
Werk aan impactvolle projecten met grote klanten in Europa en wereldwijd
Maak deel uit van een community van meer dan 600 data-experts
Volg continue bijscholing, tech-uitwisselingen en mentorshiptrajecten
Groei door naar rollen zoals tech lead, architect of domeinspecialist – of maak een overstap naar cloud, productontwikkeling, AI-ethiek enz.
Geniet van hybride werk, internationale ervaring en een mensgerichte cultuur
💡 Wij zijn een onafhankelijke organisatie die waarde hecht aan:
Wendbaarheid: floreer in een flexibele, dynamische en stimulerende omgeving
Internationale reikwijdte: dagelijkse internationale samenwerking en mobiliteitskansen in meer dan 60 landen
Intrapreneurschap: verdiep je in gerelateerde thema’s of ontwikkel je eigen businessunit
Persoonlijke begeleiding: met een beperkt aantal consultants per manager krijg je individuele ondersteuning tijdens je loopbaan

Amaris Consulting is trots een werkgever te zijn die gelijke kansen biedt. We streven ernaar diversiteit op de werkvloer te bevorderen en een inclusieve werkomgeving te creëren. Daarom verwelkomen wij sollicitaties van alle gekwalificeerde kandidaten – ongeacht gender, seksuele geaardheid, afkomst, overtuiging, leeftijd, burgerlijke staat, handicap of andere kenmerken.

Who are we?

  • Analyseren en beoordelen van datasystemen, -architectuur of -kwaliteit van de klant en aanbevelingen doen ter verbetering
  • Technische oplossingen vormgeven en implementeren in cloud-, hybride of on-premises omgevingen
  • Klantbehoeften vertalen naar datastrategieën en oplossingen die tastbare impact genereren
  • Deelnemen aan interne R&
column4:
D-initiatieven en bijdragen aan accelerators en assets van ons Center of Excellence


Onze werkomgeving &
column5:
tech stack:

Wij zijn technologie-agnostisch en pragmatisch: we passen onze stack aan op de behoeften van de klant. Veelgebruikte technologieën zijn o.a.:


  • Talen: Python, SQL, R
  • Cloudplatforms: Azure (Data Factory, Synapse, Purview), AWS, GCP
  • Orkestratie &
column6:
Transformatie: dbt, Airflow, Kedro, Dataform
  • Analytics &
column7:
BI: Power BI, Tableau, Looker
  • MLOps &
column8:
DevOps: MLflow, Docker, Git, CI/CD pipelines
  • Big Data: Spark, Databricks, Snowflake


    • 🎯 Jouw profiel:


    • Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist, Engineer, Analyst of ML Engineer
    • Ervaring met consultancy of een sterke interesse in klantgerichte rollen
    • Zowel technisch onderlegd als nieuwsgierig naar businessinzichten
    • Vloeiend in Engels
column9:
kennis van Frans of Nederlands is een plus
  • Proactief, samenwerkingsgericht en leergierig


    • 🚀 Waarom werken in ons Data &
column10:
AI Center of Excellence?


  • Werk aan impactvolle projecten met grote klanten in Europa en wereldwijd
  • Maak deel uit van een community van meer dan 600 data-experts
  • Volg continue bijscholing, tech-uitwisselingen en mentorshiptrajecten
  • Groei door naar rollen zoals tech lead, architect of domeinspecialist – of maak een overstap naar cloud, productontwikkeling, AI-ethiek enz.
  • Geniet van hybride werk, internationale ervaring en een mensgerichte cultuur


💡 Wij zijn een onafhankelijke organisatie die waarde hecht aan:


  • Wendbaarheid: floreer in een flexibele, dynamische en stimulerende omgeving
  • Internationale reikwijdte: dagelijkse internationale samenwerking en mobiliteitskansen in meer dan 60 landen
  • Intrapreneurschap: verdiep je in gerelateerde thema’s of ontwikkel je eigen businessunit
  • Persoonlijke begeleiding: met een beperkt aantal consultants per manager krijg je individuele ondersteuning tijdens je loopbaan


Amaris Consulting is trots een werkgever te zijn die gelijke kansen biedt. We streven ernaar diversiteit op de werkvloer te bevorderen en een inclusieve werkomgeving te creëren. Daarom verwelkomen wij sollicitaties van alle gekwalificeerde kandidaten – ongeacht gender, seksuele geaardheid, afkomst, overtuiging, leeftijd, burgerlijke staat, handicap of andere kenmerken.

4183121362,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/consultant-bi-h-f-at-davidson-consulting-4183121362?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=QqyeowxtXtQsQWF0docdTw%3D%3D,Consultant BI (H/F),Davidson consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Rejoindre Davidson, ce n’est pas seulement intégrer un groupe de 3000 consultants dans 6 pays et 2 continents, c’est intégrer LA société qui a été élue par ses salariés Great Place To Work France et Europe pendant 4 ans mais aussi une des plus grandes B Corp de France, nommée Best of the World dans la catégorie “collaborateurs” en 2022 ! (Les “B Corp” formant une communauté de sociétés qui ont décidé d’être non pas les meilleures du monde mais les meilleures POUR le monde).
Parce que notre développement repose sur des principes forts :

Un profond respect de l’ensemble de nos parties prenantes : consultant(e)s, clients et fournisseurs. Car si le travail “ne fait pas le bonheur”, il peut cependant “faire le malheur”. Nous nous engageons donc à écouter et agir avec honnêteté.

Une égalité des chances dans le traitement de nos candidatures et dans la gestion de carrière de nos salarié(e)s. Nous croyons en un milieu de travail où équité F/H, inclusion et diversité sont la norme.

Une empreinte environnementale minimale, et sociétale maximale. C’est pourquoi, au-delà des missions que vous réaliserez, vous pourrez également contribuer à des projets que Davidson soutient : missions de solidarité internationale (avec Planète Urgence), bénévolat auprès d’associations (chaque Davidsonien(ne) dispose de 3 jours par an pour intervenir à leurs côtés), accompagnement d’étudiant(e)s issus de milieux peu favorisés (avec Article 1), investissement dans des startups développant des solutions innovantes, actions collectives et individuelles pour la réduction de notre impact carbone…

Un Management adhocratique basé sur la mise en œuvre des principes de “l’entreprise horizontale” et du “management tribal”. Sur ce dernier point une précision d’importance : le bien-être au travail est un luxe qu’il faut pouvoir s’offrir en étant une entreprise “solide”. Ceci induit pour les Davidsonien(ne)s d’allier prises d’initiative, engagement et professionnalisme. Car “sans travail, le talent n’est qu’une sale manie”. Et cela nous incite à chercher à recruter des personnes… meilleures que nous…
Nous encourageons les candidatures de personnes en situation de handicap, et nous nous engageons à répondre au mieux à leurs besoins spécifiques.

Tu interviendras au sein du pôle Big Data & Data Science de Davidson. Cette équipe a pour but de construire des architectures permettant de collecter et faire parler les données ! Ceci dans des secteurs et clients très divers : de la startup de l’IoT au grand groupe audiovisuel…
Mener les analyses fonctionnelles destinées à traduire les besoins du client
Aider les équipes projet dans la conception de modèles de données
Identifier les pistes de création de valeur, au-delà des attentes du client
Concevoir les solutions (Data Integration, ETL, Datawarehouses), les indicateurs et les tableaux de bord
Organiser et préparer les travaux de recette utilisateurs
Mettre en place les processus d’industrialisation
De formation BAC + 5, tu as déjà une première expérience réussie dans le domaine de la BI
Tu sais que SQL ne s’écrit pas escuelle
Tu maîtrises parfaitement un ETL (SSIS, Talend, Datastage, Informatica) et un outil de restitution (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik …) ou à défaut un outil de reporting (BO, Cognos, Microstrategy)
Et soyons fous : tu as des connaissances en archi Big Data

Rejoindre Davidson, ce n’est pas seulement intégrer un groupe de 3000 consultants dans 6 pays et 2 continents, c’est intégrer LA société qui a été élue par ses salariés Great Place To Work France et Europe pendant 4 ans mais aussi une des plus grandes B Corp de France, nommée Best of the World dans la catégorie “collaborateurs” en 2022 ! (Les “B Corp” formant une communauté de sociétés qui ont décidé d’être non pas les meilleures du monde mais les meilleures POUR le monde).

  • Une égalité des chances dans le traitement de nos candidatures et dans la gestion de carrière de nos salarié(e)s. Nous croyons en un milieu de travail où équité F/H, inclusion et diversité sont la norme.
