C’est pourquoi, au-delà des missions que vous réaliserez, vous pourrez également contribuer à des projets que Davidson soutient : missions de solidarité internationale (avec Planète Urgence), bénévolat auprès d’associations (chaque Davidsonien(ne) dispose de 3 jours par an pour intervenir à leurs côtés), accompagnement d’étudiant(e)s issus de milieux peu favorisés (avec Article 1), investissement dans des startups développant des solutions innovantes, actions collectives et individuelles pour la réduction de notre impact carbone…
  • Un Management adhocratique basé sur la mise en œuvre des principes de “l’entreprise horizontale” et du “management tribal”. Sur ce dernier point une précision d’importance : le bien-être au travail est un luxe qu’il faut pouvoir s’offrir en étant une entreprise “solide”. Ceci induit pour les Davidsonien(ne)s d’allier prises d’initiative, engagement et professionnalisme. Car “sans travail, le talent n’est qu’une sale manie”. Et cela nous incite à chercher à recruter des personnes… meilleures que nous…

Nous encourageons les candidatures de personnes en situation de handicap, et nous nous engageons à répondre au mieux à leurs besoins spécifiques.

Profil / Mission

Tu interviendras au sein du pôle Big Data &
column2:
Data Science de Davidson. Cette équipe a pour but de construire des architectures permettant de collecter et faire parler les données ! Ceci dans des secteurs et clients très divers : de la startup de l’IoT au grand groupe audiovisuel…

Tes Activités Seront Les Suivantes

  • Mener les analyses fonctionnelles destinées à traduire les besoins du client
  • Aider les équipes projet dans la conception de modèles de données
  • Identifier les pistes de création de valeur, au-delà des attentes du client
  • Concevoir les solutions (Data Integration, ETL, Datawarehouses), les indicateurs et les tableaux de bord
  • Organiser et préparer les travaux de recette utilisateurs
  • Mettre en place les processus d’industrialisation

Compétences requises ou à acquérir

  • De formation BAC + 5, tu as déjà une première expérience réussie dans le domaine de la BI
  • Tu sais que SQL ne s’écrit pas escuelle
  • Tu maîtrises parfaitement un ETL (SSIS, Talend, Datastage, Informatica) et un outil de restitution (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik …) ou à défaut un outil de reporting (BO, Cognos, Microstrategy)
  • Et soyons fous : tu as des connaissances en archi Big Data

Aptitudes / Savoir-être

  • Excellent relationnel
  • Capacité d’analyse
  • Curiosité
  • Rigueur
  • Anglais

4282450023,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-equans-belux-4282450023?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=euxeDjGyd4wd%2FHPx3iFzCA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Equans BeLux,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","What if you could shape the future of HR decision-making?
With us, your expertise won’t just sit in dashboards – it will actively support HR innovation across the entire organization.
To strengthen our HR IS team, we’re looking for a Data Analyst who thrives in a dynamic, agile environment and is eager to turn complex HR data into powerful insights.

You’ll get to work on varied, business-critical HR projects with real impact – all while collaborating with a supportive and passionate team. If you love working at the intersection of data, people, and technology, this job was made for you.
Your work location: our Equans-site in Brussels
As our HR Data Analyst, you will:
translate business needs into clear analysis and reporting actions
collaborate closely with analysts with different expertise within HR
act as the bridge between business and the developers
collect, clean and prepare data from multiple sources (databases, systems…)
evaluate results and help steer improvements
document processes, solutions and user guides
support the business during testing phases and guide them through test scenarios
What You Bring To The Table
5+ years of experience in data analysis,
2+ years of experience working in agile teams
hands-on knowledge of Power BI and MS Office
experience with Azure DevOps, MS Visio, DAX or SAP BI is a plus
strong communication & social skills and a proactive mindset
analytical, independent and focused on solutions
customer-oriented and eager to keep learning
fluent in Dutch, French and English
Ready to shape the way data drives HR?
Want to tackle tomorrow’s multi-technical challenges with us?

At Equans, you find an exciting career within a stable and financially sound company. You work on challenging, diverse projects and assist our clients with today’s three major transitions: the energy transition, the industrial transition, and the digital transition.
You have the opportunity to discover cutting-edge technologies and further develop your skills.
Joining Equans is more than that! You also get:
a competitive salary in line with your education and experience
eco & meal vouchers, 13th month, holiday pay
concessionary travel, lease car (with fuel/charging card), parking, bicycle lease plan
additional paid leave, seniority leave, homeworking
discounts through Benefits@Work (culture, sports, travel, and more)
Add to that the contagious warm atmosphere at Equans, and what are you waiting for?
We look forward to welcoming you!

Does this description fit you and would you like more information? Contact our HR colleague Erwin Verniers – 02 370 30 62 – erwin.verniers@external.equans.com – https://www.linkedin.com/in/erwin-verniers

4268621585,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/e-bi-insights-monitoring-partner-at-ucb-4268621585?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=9K5KYinSMjZuj6AQMreV4w%3D%3D,E&BI Insights Monitoring Partner,UCB,"Anderlecht, Brussels Region, Belgium","We are looking for a E&BI Insights Monitoring Partner who is detail-oriented, collaborative, and proactive to join our Ethics & Business Integrity team, based at our HQ office, in Brussels, Belgium.

You will be working in a team that ensures ethical business practices as the owner of the E&BI global monitoring program. Your work will help identify process gaps, mitigate risks, support transparency, and strengthen compliance across the organization.

You will be part of the Ethics & Business Integrity team, collaborating closely with local leads and external monitoring vendors. You’ll also engage with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement.
Manage external vendors conducting monitoring activities, including sample selection, quality checks, and regular reviews
Share monitoring results and insights with local leads to support compliance and transparency
Conduct centralized monitoring and analytics aligned with the annual monitoring plan
Support decentralized monitoring in collaboration with local teams
Collect and analyze data to generate dashboards and insights on monitoring results
Contribute to the development of analytics methodologies and implementation of tools
Interested? For this role we’re looking for the following education, experience and skills
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field
3+ years of experience in compliance, risk management, or a related function
Strong knowledge of global healthcare regulatory standards and compliance monitoring
Excellent organizational and project management skills, including vendor coordination
Strong communication skills and ability to work independently with discretion
Experience in data analytics and tools such as Qlik or Power BI
Are you ready to ‘go beyond’ to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!
UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

At UCB, we don’t just complete tasks, we create value. We aren’t afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected, and has equal opportunities to do their best work. We ‘go beyond’ to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that’s on our patients, our employees, or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.
UCB is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions will be made without regard to any characteristic protected by applicable laws.

Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on EMEA-Reasonable_Accommodation@ucb.com . Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments

4280218663,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-supply-chain-fr-en-at-page-personnel-4280218663?position=17&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=RolqGbyqyzlOpDFipbpr7A%3D%3D,Data Analyst Supply Chain (FR/EN),Page Personnel,"Wavre, Walloon Region, Belgium","Impact direct sur la supply chain terrain.

Notre client présent dans le secteur de la logistique et spécialisé dans la gestion et l'optimisation des flux de marchandises à l'échelle nationale. Afin de renforcer ses équipes data, il recherche un Data Analyst Supply Chain, avec une première expérience, prêt à contribuer à l'amélioration continue des opérations.
Collecter et analyser les données issues des systèmes logistiques (ERP)
Développer et maintenir des tableaux de bord pour le suivi des KPI
Identifier les tendances, anomalies et opportunités d'amélioration dans les flux logistiques
Participer à des projets transverses d'optimisation des processus grâce à la data
Collaborer avec les équipes terrain pour traduire les besoins opérationnels en analyses data pertinentes
Garantir la qualité et la cohérence des données utilisées dans les reportings
Formation en data analytics, supply chain, statistiques ou équivalent
Première expérience en data analysis appliquée à la logistique ou supply chain
Maîtrise des outils d'analyse : Excel avancé, SQL, Power BI ou similaires
Connaissance des principes et processus de la supply chain et logistique
Esprit analytique, rigueur et capacité à communiquer des résultats complexes de manière claire
Autonomie, curiosité et sens du travail collaboratif
Maîtrise parfait du français et de l'anglais
Intégration au sein d'une entreprise innovante du secteur logistique
Opportunités de développement et formation continue
Environnement de travail stimulant avec une forte dimension collaborative

• Impact direct sur la supply chain terrain.
  • Projets data concrets et formateurs.

About Our Client

Notre client présent dans le secteur de la logistique et spécialisé dans la gestion et l'optimisation des flux de marchandises à l'échelle nationale. Afin de renforcer ses équipes data, il recherche un Data Analyst Supply Chain, avec une première expérience, prêt à contribuer à l'amélioration continue des opérations.

Job Description

  • Collecter et analyser les données issues des systèmes logistiques (ERP)
  • Développer et maintenir des tableaux de bord pour le suivi des KPI
  • Identifier les tendances, anomalies et opportunités d'amélioration dans les flux logistiques
  • Participer à des projets transverses d'optimisation des processus grâce à la data
  • Collaborer avec les équipes terrain pour traduire les besoins opérationnels en analyses data pertinentes
  • Garantir la qualité et la cohérence des données utilisées dans les reportings

The Successful Applicant

  • Formation en data analytics, supply chain, statistiques ou équivalent
  • Première expérience en data analysis appliquée à la logistique ou supply chain
  • Maîtrise des outils d'analyse : Excel avancé, SQL, Power BI ou similaires
  • Connaissance des principes et processus de la supply chain et logistique
  • Esprit analytique, rigueur et capacité à communiquer des résultats complexes de manière claire
  • Autonomie, curiosité et sens du travail collaboratif
  • Maîtrise parfait du français et de l'anglais

What's on Offer

  • Intégration au sein d'une entreprise innovante du secteur logistique
  • Opportunités de développement et formation continue
  • Environnement de travail stimulant avec une forte dimension collaborative

Contact: Aurelie Everard

Quote job ref: JN-082025-6808834

4178648730,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-data-analytics-academic-year-2025-2026-at-deloitte-4178648730?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=oygTLZZEdeOsWY6OCjxkCw%3D%3D,Internship Data & Analytics - Academic Year 2025-2026,Deloitte,"Zaventem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond. Your journey with us
Join us and you’ll be immersed in a dynamic company where you’ll work with a diverse group of talented colleagues on a variety of exciting projects.

You’ll be inspired and learn every day, exploring many different industries and collaborating with our clients, ranging from large national to multinational companies to non-profit and public sector organisations.
This is the field of interest for you, if you want to conduct in-depth analyses of business and technology issues, but also make recommendations to improve or transform our clients' businesses.
Depending on the team you join, you will have different kinds of tasks:
You'll work on interesting and challenging assignments that inspire you daily with their diversity
You’ll assist in analysing data, helping our clients to unlock their data solutions and to drive analytical needs
You’ll put your analytical skills into practice, improving your strong analytical mind.
You’ll capture and translate requirements from the business as well as new existing environments.
You’ll extract, collect, and organise data to find correlations and patterns that produce meaningful conclusions relevant to businesses.
You’ll work with different kinds of software, data tools, and ERP systems.
You'll structure and leverage our clients’ data to improve their businesses.
The list above is a general overview. You'll receive more information during the interviews.
You are in the final year of your bachelor or master’s degree or your pre-final master year.
You are highly motivated, and a reliable team player with a sense of initiative.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and have a good knowledge of English.
You have a critical mindset and good analytical skills.
You have the ability to conceptualise and articulate ideas and solutions.
You are able to use MS Office tools (Excel, Word and PowerPoint).
You are rigorous in your daily routine, but also in your working tools and methods.

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.

Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you. We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Real impact: interns at Deloitte contribute to real client projects, making tangible business impacts from day one.
Mentorship: access to a structured support system, including a mentor and buddy.
Lunch & Transport allowance: interns receive an amount for meals and commuting, adding to overall comfort and convenience.
Network opportunities: building a strong professional network through firmwide events, team activities and leadership exposure.
Interns Ignite event: a signature experience designed to connect interns across the firm, foster innovation and putting our interns in the spotlight.
Career perspective: as we highly value & believe in the potential of our interns, we offer our final year interns the opportunity to start working within our company after graduation.
Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond. Your journey with us


Join us and you’ll be immersed in a dynamic company where you’ll work with a diverse group of talented colleagues on a variety of exciting projects.

You’ll be inspired and learn every day, exploring many different industries and collaborating with our clients, ranging from large national to multinational companies to non-profit and public sector organisations.

This is the field of interest for you, if you want to conduct in-depth analyses of business and technology issues, but also make recommendations to improve or transform our clients' businesses.

Depending on the team you join, you will have different kinds of tasks:

  • You'll work on interesting and challenging assignments that inspire you daily with their diversity
  • You’ll assist in analysing data, helping our clients to unlock their data solutions and to drive analytical needs
  • You’ll put your analytical skills into practice, improving your strong analytical mind.
  • You’ll capture and translate requirements from the business as well as new existing environments.
  • You’ll extract, collect, and organise data to find correlations and patterns that produce meaningful conclusions relevant to businesses.
  • You’ll work with different kinds of software, data tools, and ERP systems.
  • You'll structure and leverage our clients’ data to improve their businesses.
The list above is a general overview. You'll receive more information during the interviews.







Let’s talk about you
  • You are in the final year of your bachelor or master’s degree or your pre-final master year.
  • You are highly motivated, and a reliable team player with a sense of initiative.
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and have a good knowledge of English.
  • You have a critical mindset and good analytical skills.
  • You have the ability to conceptualise and articulate ideas and solutions.
  • You are results oriented.
  • You are able to use MS Office tools (Excel, Word and PowerPoint).
  • You work methodically and conscientiously.
  • You are rigorous in your daily routine, but also in your working tools and methods.











Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.


Why Deloitte?

4267760499,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/marketing-data-analyst-f-m-x-at-jcdecaux-4267760499?position=19&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=9TJkJS%2BAh9xAjpWOWaypbQ%3D%3D,Marketing Data Analyst (f/m/x),JCDecaux,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Ready to shape the urban landscape of tomorrow?
Join JCDecaux, the world's leading company in outdoor advertising!
Imagine having a daily impact on the lives of more than 850 million people worldwide.
At JCDecaux, this is our reality!
For over 60 years, we have been reinventing cities by designing innovative and aesthetic communication solutions, from intelligent street furniture to spectacular digital screens in airports.

Present in more than 80 countries with a team of 13,000 talents (including 300 passionate individuals in Belgium and Luxembourg), we are on the brink of a new urban era: smarter, connected, and sustainable.
Driven by our values ""Stronger Together"" and an ambitious climate strategy, we are looking for brilliant and committed minds to innovate with us.
Choosing JCDecaux means joining a strong company, a leader in its market, where kindness, continuous training, and retention (10 years average seniority!) are realities.
Make data actionable throughout all our commercial systems and turn data into actionable insights.

Be our marketing data hero : You manage available marketing data, you modelize them where necessary and prepare them for integration in our tools, such as our planning and allocation system, and our data management platform.
Drive data & insights innovation: You are the first to pick up new research and data projects in the market and you follow up with our international data team on JCDecaux’ advanced data tools.
Drive market research projects: You develop new groundbreaking market research to respond to commercial needs. You follow-up and analyze existing market research.
Respond brilliantly to challenges: You analyze client briefings in an efficient way and provide clear information and strategic advice on our available data and insights.
Optimize efficiency: You find or create new tools to optimize the way of working.
Juggle with numbers: You easily turn numbers into useful and easily understandable information to support our go to market team.
You have a bachelor's or master’s degree in business management, data science, operational research or marketing.
You have at least 2 years' professional experience in market research, market intelligence, preferably in a market research agency, a media agency or a marketing department.
You exhibit precision and efficiency in all tasks.
You are passionate about advertising and its influence.
You possess a unique blend of analytical skills, precision, commercial acumen, and effective communication abilities, with an eagerness to explore new data and AI developments.
You are proficient in Microsoft Office applications and adept with big data tools like Power BI, with a talent for quickly mastering new software.
You communicate in a clear and effective way.
You are organized and able to navigate between various tools and applications.
You're a proactive team player who enjoys collaborative work with marketing and sales.
More than anything else, you are driven by a strong desire to learn and the ambition to grow within JCDecaux BeLux organization.
You have a perfect command of French and Dutch (essential for meetings) and know English (for creating presentations and to communicate with international teams).
As part of the bigger marketing department, you will work closely with the data and insights team
In addition to statutory holidays, you have 12 extra leave per year
Possibility of teleworking two days a week
Central working location in Brussels (Quartier du Sablon)
In-depth training from day one, enabling you to gradually familiarise yourself with all the
IT tools and applications used at JCDecaux
Join the JCDecaux adventure and help shape the city of tomorrow! Apply now.

Ready to shape the urban landscape of tomorrow?


Join JCDecaux, the world's leading company in outdoor advertising!


Imagine having a daily impact on the lives of more than 850 million people worldwide.

At JCDecaux, this is our reality!

For over 60 years, we have been reinventing cities by designing innovative and aesthetic communication solutions, from intelligent street furniture to spectacular digital screens in airports.

Present in more than 80 countries with a team of 13,000 talents (including 300 passionate individuals in Belgium and Luxembourg), we are on the brink of a new urban era: smarter, connected, and sustainable.

Driven by our values ""Stronger Together"" and an ambitious climate strategy, we are looking for brilliant and committed minds to innovate with us.

Choosing JCDecaux means joining a strong company, a leader in its market, where kindness, continuous training, and retention (10 years average seniority!) are realities.


Your mission:

Make data actionable throughout all our commercial systems and turn data into actionable insights.


Your role is to :

  • Be our marketing data hero : You manage available marketing data, you modelize them where necessary and prepare them for integration in our tools, such as our planning and allocation system, and our data management platform.
  • Drive data &
column2:
insights innovation: You are the first to pick up new research and data projects in the market and you follow up with our international data team on JCDecaux’ advanced data tools.
  • Drive market research projects: You develop new groundbreaking market research to respond to commercial needs. You follow-up and analyze existing market research.
  • Respond brilliantly to challenges: You analyze client briefings in an efficient way and provide clear information and strategic advice on our available data and insights.
  • Optimize efficiency: You find or create new tools to optimize the way of working.
  • Juggle with numbers: You easily turn numbers into useful and easily understandable information to support our go to market team.



    • Are you the right fit?

    • You have a bachelor's or master’s degree in business management, data science, operational research or marketing.
    • You have at least 2 years' professional experience in market research, market intelligence, preferably in a market research agency, a media agency or a marketing department.

    • You possess a unique blend of analytical skills, precision, commercial acumen, and effective communication abilities, with an eagerness to explore new data and AI developments.
    • You are proficient in Microsoft Office applications and adept with big data tools like Power BI, with a talent for quickly mastering new software.
    • You communicate in a clear and effective way.
    • You are organized and able to navigate between various tools and applications.
    • You're a proactive team player who enjoys collaborative work with marketing and sales.
    • More than anything else, you are driven by a strong desire to learn and the ambition to grow within JCDecaux BeLux organization.
    • You have a perfect command of French and Dutch (essential for meetings) and know English (for creating presentations and to communicate with international teams).
    • As part of the bigger marketing department, you will work closely with the data and insights team


    What JCDecaux offers you :

    • Permanent contract, 39 hours a week

Bij darwind verwelkomen we gemotiveerde professionals die willen groeien en hun vaardigheden verder willen ontwikkelen. Je komt terecht in een omgeving waar mensen, leren en impact centraal staan.

Je past statistische methodes of machine learning toe om voorspellingen en planning te ondersteunen

Je blijft jezelf ontwikkelen en ontdekt nieuwe tools, technologieën en methodes binnen de datawereld
Je hebt 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een vergelijkbare rol
Je bent vlot met Python, SQL en Excel, ervaring met R of Azure is een plus
Je hebt gewerkt met datavisualisatietools zoals Power BI of Tableau
Je combineert analytisch denkvermogen met sterke communicatieskills
Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en hebt een goede kennis van Frans en Engels
Je bent nieuwsgierig, leergierig en neemt graag verantwoordelijkheid
Projecten die aansluiten bij jouw talenten en groeipad

Opleidingen en certificeringen op maat van jouw ambities

Klaar om je vast te bijten in data en écht impact te maken als Data Analist?

Heb je 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!

Bij darwind verwelkomen we gemotiveerde professionals die willen groeien en hun vaardigheden verder willen ontwikkelen. Je komt terecht in een omgeving waar mensen, leren en impact centraal staan.


Wat ga je doen?

  • Je verzamelt, zuivert en analyseert grote datasets om trends, patronen en inzichten bloot te leggen
  • Je bouwt dashboards en rapporten die stakeholders helpen betere beslissingen te nemen
  • Je werkt nauw samen met data engineers, business teams en andere analisten om vragen te vertalen naar bruikbare analyses
  • Je past statistische methodes of machine learning toe om voorspellingen en planning te ondersteunen
  • Je zorgt voor datakwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid door middel van validatie en documentatie
  • Je blijft jezelf ontwikkelen en ontdekt nieuwe tools, technologieën en methodes binnen de datawereld


Wie zoeken we?

  • Je hebt 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een vergelijkbare rol
  • Je bent vlot met Python, SQL en Excel, ervaring met R of Azure is een plus
  • Je hebt gewerkt met datavisualisatietools zoals Power BI of Tableau
  • Je combineert analytisch denkvermogen met sterke communicatieskills
  • Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en hebt een goede kennis van Frans en Engels
  • Je bent nieuwsgierig, leergierig en neemt graag verantwoordelijkheid


Wat mag je verwachten?

  • Projecten die aansluiten bij jouw talenten en groeipad
  • Coaching en begeleiding van ervaren data-experts
  • Opleidingen en certificeringen op maat van jouw ambities
  • Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en de keuze tussen een bedrijfswagen met tankkaart of het federaal mobiliteitsbudget
  • Flexibiliteit: werk bij de klant, op het darwind-kantoor of van thuis uit
  • En vooral: werkplezier, autonomie en een team waarop je kan rekenen


Klinkt dit als iets voor jou?

Laat van je horen, we kijken ernaar uit je te ontmoeten!

4280140073,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-durlston-partners-4280140073?position=23&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=6guR2Ml8cPCo0RFHnYdBlg%3D%3D,Data Engineer,Durlston Partners,European Economic Area,"Senior Data Engineer – Systematic Trading – Remote (UK/EU) – £200k–£300k

A technology-driven trading firm operating globally across digital asset markets. The team applies systematic strategies and cutting-edge infrastructure to provide liquidity and execute at scale. This role sits within the data engineering function, focused on building internal data products and supporting large-scale analytics across trading and research.
Design and maintain scalable, distributed data pipelines
Build monitoring tools to ensure integrity and completeness of data
Develop APIs and internal interfaces to query historical trading data
Collaborate with researchers and developers to optimise analytics workflows
Contribute to the evolution of data infrastructure in a latency-sensitive environment
Python, with experience in tick databases such as Clickhouse or Vertica
Strong background in real-time, high-volume data processing
Experience handling large-scale time series datasets
Familiarity with tooling for quant research and trading system integration
For further details, please contact xander@durlstonpartners.com. Stay informed about all our live roles by following Durlston Partners.

Senior Data Engineer – Systematic Trading – Remote (UK/EU) – £200k–£300k


Overview:

A technology-driven trading firm operating globally across digital asset markets. The team applies systematic strategies and cutting-edge infrastructure to provide liquidity and execute at scale. This role sits within the data engineering function, focused on building internal data products and supporting large-scale analytics across trading and research.


Responsibilities:

  • Design and maintain scalable, distributed data pipelines
  • Build monitoring tools to ensure integrity and completeness of data
  • Develop APIs and internal interfaces to query historical trading data
  • Collaborate with researchers and developers to optimise analytics workflows
  • Contribute to the evolution of data infrastructure in a latency-sensitive environment


Requirements:

  • Python, with experience in tick databases such as Clickhouse or Vertica
  • Strong background in real-time, high-volume data processing
  • AWS-based compute cluster experience
  • Experience handling large-scale time series datasets
  • Familiarity with tooling for quant research and trading system integration


Location: Remote – UK or Europe

Compensation: £150k–£200k + Equity (depending on experience)


For further details, please contact xander@durlstonpartners.com. Stay informed about all our live roles by following Durlston Partners.

4260786954,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-f-m-x-at-amaris-consulting-4260786954?position=24&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=J6EleWYNS8UVQp75yK0bBQ%3D%3D,Data Engineer F/M/X,Amaris Consulting,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Are you a skilled Data Engineer ready for your next career move?

Amaris Consulting is looking for a driven and talented professional to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Belgium. This is an exciting opportunity for individuals with strong analytical skills, a solid technical foundation, and outstanding communication abilities to thrive and grow in a dynamic environment.
Design and implement efficient ETL/ELT pipelines to process large volumes of data from various sources.
Build and maintain data warehousing solutions and data lakes that support analytics and reporting needs.
Optimize data pipelines for speed, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate data systems and ensure data quality.
Implement monitoring tools and processes to ensure continuous pipeline operation and proactively address issues.
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with programming languages such as Python or Scala.
Hands-on experience with cloud-based data platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and modern data warehousing solutions.
Excellent problem-solving skills with a focus on data quality and performance optimization.
Experience with big data frameworks (e.g., Apache Spark, Hadoop).
Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
Strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to work collaboratively in a multicultural and dynamic team environment.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.
💡 We are an independent company that values:
Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.

Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

4284440318,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/be-data-engineer-at-biztory-4284440318?position=26&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=fyfOYzQSa8hysm%2BOUst7Nw%3D%3D,BE Data Engineer,Biztory,"Kontich, Flemish Region, Belgium","Data Engineer (BE)
What Does The Party Look Like?

At Biztory, we accelerate the Data + AI Journey at our clients and achieve higher levels of data + AI maturity. As a leading strategic data consultancy in Europe, Biztory helps you to be at the forefront of data & AI-driven innovation - and stay there.
Biztory can help you solve any data & analytical challenge, whether technical or business.
We have the most skilled and certified Tableau, Snowflake, dbt & Fivetran consultants, and our specialists bring significant expertise to our client portfolio.

We're a €1bn start-up ... the best of both worlds. Biztory is a small, agile company with the flexibility to react to the changing winds of the market. We enjoy the backing and strength of a large company, with entrepreneurship in its DNA. We're one of more than 400 companies in the Cronos Group.

We get stuff done! We have offices across Europe in Belgium, Netherlands, Germany + the UK and we won numerous technology awards across our regions. Our customers span industries and their use cases are as interesting as they are diverse but we enjoy fixing their data, informing their people and enriching their customer experiences.

We love our people. We love helping people find answers in their data. Easier. Faster. Some of us have tattoos, some play video games and some cook amazing BBQ. We guide, inform, and train! We're nothing without trust so we maintain a flat management structure, talk to anyone about anything.
What Do You Bring To The Party?

Are you driven? Do you like to help people? Do you like puzzles? We're looking for someone to fill a brand new role at Biztory delivering world class data engineering and architecture to our customers.

You will be responsible for helping our clients design and implement modern data solutions to drive analytics and Data & AI usage. We help organisations to build data pipelines, data lakes and data warehouses to power their analytics.
You'll be part of our diverse and enthusiastic team of technical experts who take great pride in gaining knowledge and sharing this with our clients and the people in our team.
Passionate about data - seriously, that's really important
A clear, confident, and concise communicator (verbal and written)
Fluent in English (and NL or FR is a big plus)
Working with a solution-oriented and customer-first mindset
A very good understanding and working knowledge of SQL and Git
A strong understanding of Data Engineering best practices
Experience designing and implementing data marts, data lakes or data warehouses
Ability to design and apply relevant data modeling techniques (Kimball, data vault, etc...)
Experience designing and implementing robust data pipelines
Hands-on experience in the cloud data eco-systems (Snowflake, AWS, Azure GCP, etc)
You might even have (which is a big plus)
Experience in building and improving end-to-end data platforms
Experience with dbt, Docker, Terraform or Python
To be highly involved in our Data Domain competence center
To share your experience and knowledge with our growing team
To find your place as part of our team of committed and passionate data people
If you're still reading, we want you!
We are looking for people with all backgrounds with all levels of experience and a passion to further develop.
Competitive salaries with development opportunities and incentives
Laptop and help with home set-up
Annual education budget to help you explore and expand your skill set
You can send your CV to careers@biztory.com

4242021272,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-data-wizards-4242021272?position=27&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=PF9XNXVJJxXLjVYl245NWQ%3D%3D,Data Engineer,Data Wizards,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"Don’t settle for just any consulting company—choose the one that’s right for you!
We’re on the lookout for a Data Engineer to join our rapidly expanding AI & Data start-up.

As Data Wizards, we are a team of experts in AI & Data who advocate for human-centered AI development and usage. We partner with innovative companies from strategy to implementation to help them achieve their goals by unlocking the full potential of their data assets respecting cultural and ethical norms.
You're making the right choice to apply if you're eager to be part of an ambitious, high-energy team filled with curious, proactive minds who are passionate about AI and driven by integrity.

However, this isn’t the job for you if you’re looking for a routine, copy-paste kind of role. Here, every day is different, and we love people who take initiative, embrace challenges, and think outside the box. 🚀
As a Data Engineer, your mission would include:
Designing, building, and maintaining robust data pipelines to support AI and analytics initiatives.
Collaborating with stakeholders to understand business needs and ensure data is structured effectively for AI applications.
Developing and optimizing SQL queries (especially T-SQL) and Python scripts for efficient data processing.
Implementing data modeling techniques to ensure scalable and maintainable data architectures.
Working with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS, leveraging tools like Databricks, Data Factory, and Synapse Analytics.
Ensuring best practices in DevOps, version control, and data governance.
Managing orchestration workflows using Airflow or similar tools.
Supporting AI teams by preparing high-quality, structured data for machine learning applications.
Communicating technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and making data solutions accessible to broader audiences.
You’re a step closer to joining our team if you bring:
Master’s degree in a technical field.
At least 3 year of experience in Data Engineering.
Experience in client-facing roles, in consulting companies.
Strong expertise in SQL (especially T-SQL) and Python.
Experience in Azure with tools like Databricks, Data Factory, and Synapse Analytics.
Familiarity with DevOps and version control best practices.
Experience with Airflow or other orchestration tools is a plus.
Expertise in Machine Learning, especially NLP, is a plus.
Certifications such as Azure DP-203 are a plus.
Ability to manage stakeholders and communicate effectively across technical and non-technical teams.
A problem-solver with a “can-do” attitude and a hacker mentality.
Highly curious and always eager to improve and learn.
Strong ability to work independently and drive projects from intake to delivery.
Languages: Fluent in English. Native in either French or Dutch.
We know that finding the right job isn’t just about the role—it’s about what’s in it for you, too. While we’re a start-up, we’re big on taking care of our people right from day one.
Here’s a sneak peek at what we offer:
💰 A compensation package that keeps you motivated:
Mobility budget or company car with a fuel card
A top-tier laptop & smartphone with a subscription
Opportunity to earn company stock over time
🎯 A place to be your best self, grow, and thrive:
Work with the most innovative technologies in Data & AI
Work in an agile, collaborative environment
Monthly team-building events (plus one epic annual celebration)
Tailored training programs to fuel your career growth
A cool, ergonomic office with creative meeting spaces
A Nintendo Switch for spontaneous Mario Kart battles 🎮
A massage chair for those deep-thinking moments 🧘
Fresh coffee & drinks to keep you energized ☕
✨ And most importantly, a fast-growing company where opportunities are limitless!
Quick intro call with our HR team
You can apply right here on LinkedIn

If you’re passionate about what we do but aren’t sure you meet every single requirement—don’t hesitate to apply. We value potential, mindset, and growth as much as experience. At Data Wizards, we believe diversity is our strength. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and experiences because different viewpoints help us grow and evolve.
Let’s build the future of AI & Data, together 🤝

Please note: As a consulting company, our recruitment process can be either project-driven or based on strong profiles we believe in. The consultancy world moves fast, and while we always aim to match great talent with the right opportunity, there might not always be an immediate fit. With your permission, we’ll gladly keep your profile in mind for future missions — and hope to collaborate with you soon on an exciting project at Data Wizards!

Don’t settle for just any consulting company—choose the one that’s right for you!

4279892269,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-forecasting-nl-at-brussels-airport-4279892269?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=dADSL3ox88d8f2z2urGoxA%3D%3D,Data Analyst (Forecasting) -NL,Brussels Airport,"Zaventem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Be part of our beating heart

Brussels Airport wil bekend staan als een van de beste luchthavens ter wereld, een volledig verbonden economische hub voor mensen en bedrijven, het kloppende hart van Europa, waar klanten, innovatie en duurzaamheid centraal staan. Wil jij de luchthaven van vandaag en morgen helpen vormgeven?
Stop met dromen en kom ons team versterken!
Om ons departement Technology & Infrastructure te versterken, zijn we op zoek naar een Data Analyst (Forecasting) .

Als Data Analyst (Forecasting) speel je een sleutelrol in het analyseren en voorspellen van toekomstige trends. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende afdelingen en vertaalt data naar waardevolle inzichten voor operationele besluitvorming.
Wat Je Bij Ons Zal Realiseren
Uitvoeren, analyseren en optimaliseren van forecast runs en de impact ervan op processen zoals screening, border en check-in.
Voorbereiden en presenteren van forecastresultaten en analyses aan stakeholders.
Ontwikkelen van datagestuurde adviezen voor procesmanagers bij capaciteitsplanning.
Functionele analyses en testen ter ondersteuning van nieuwe ontwikkelingen binnen forecasting & optimization.
Opleiding: Master in een business-technische richting (zoals handelsingenieur, industrieel ingenieur, management information systems, TEW)

column2: operationeel onderzoek, statistiek en bijbehorende tools (Python, R, SQL, BI-tools).

column1: Vaardigheden: Sterke analytisch, data-interpretatie, en heel sterke communicatievaardigheden
Talen: Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands of Frans, hebt een goede kennis van de tweede taal en kunt je goed uitdrukken in het Engels.
Gaat je hart al sneller slaan?
Bij Brussels Airport werk je in een wereld op zich, vol nieuwe kansen en spannende uitdagingen. Je komt terecht in een unieke en inspirerende omgeving die je talenten vleugels geeft.

Wat je ervaring helemaal bijzonder maakt? Ons nieuwe Compass-gebouw met zijn prachtige panorama, ideaal uitgerust om op een hybride en flexibele manier samen te werken, waar je kan rekenen op een aantrekkelijk aanbod van extralegale voordelen voor werknemers. Daarnaast bouwen we aan een duurzame omgeving waar we met de fiets, bus of elektrische auto naartoe komen en waar we zelfs een eigen treinstation hebben. Wat wil je nog meer?
Volg het ritme van ons hart

Kan je niet wachten om jezelf te overstijgen bij Brussels Airport Company? Stuur snel jouw CV en motivatiebrief via de daarvoor bestemde link. En wie weet, misschien verwelkomen we jou heel binnenkort op onze bruisende luchthaven in het hart van Europa!
Heb je nog vragen? Contacteer gerust Sofie.Bruynooghe@brusselsairport.be

Be part of our beating heart

Brussels Airport wil bekend staan als een van de beste luchthavens ter wereld, een volledig verbonden economische hub voor mensen en bedrijven, het kloppende hart van Europa, waar klanten, innovatie en duurzaamheid centraal staan. Wil jij de luchthaven van vandaag en morgen helpen vormgeven?

Stop met dromen en kom ons team versterken!

Om ons departement Technology &
column2:
Infrastructure te versterken, zijn we op zoek naar een Data Analyst (Forecasting) .

Als Data Analyst (Forecasting) speel je een sleutelrol in het analyseren en voorspellen van toekomstige trends. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende afdelingen en vertaalt data naar waardevolle inzichten voor operationele besluitvorming.

Wat Je Bij Ons Zal Realiseren

  • Uitvoeren, analyseren en optimaliseren van forecast runs en de impact ervan op processen zoals screening, border en check-in.
  • Voorbereiden en presenteren van forecastresultaten en analyses aan stakeholders.
  • Ontwikkelen van datagestuurde adviezen voor procesmanagers bij capaciteitsplanning.
  • Functionele analyses en testen ter ondersteuning van nieuwe ontwikkelingen binnen forecasting &
column3:
optimization.


Wat Jou Onderscheidt

  • Opleiding: Master in een business-technische richting (zoals handelsingenieur, industrieel ingenieur, management information systems, TEW)
  • Ervaring: Kennis van data-analyse, data-science
column4:
operationeel onderzoek, statistiek en bijbehorende tools (Python, R, SQL, BI-tools).
  • Vaardigheden: Sterke analytisch, data-interpretatie, en heel sterke communicatievaardigheden
  • Talen: Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands of Frans, hebt een goede kennis van de tweede taal en kunt je goed uitdrukken in het Engels.


    • Gaat je hart al sneller slaan?

    Bij Brussels Airport werk je in een wereld op zich, vol nieuwe kansen en spannende uitdagingen. Je komt terecht in een unieke en inspirerende omgeving die je talenten vleugels geeft.

    Wat je ervaring helemaal bijzonder maakt? Ons nieuwe Compass-gebouw met zijn prachtige panorama, ideaal uitgerust om op een hybride en flexibele manier samen te werken, waar je kan rekenen op een aantrekkelijk aanbod van extralegale voordelen voor werknemers. Daarnaast bouwen we aan een duurzame omgeving waar we met de fiets, bus of elektrische auto naartoe komen en waar we zelfs een eigen treinstation hebben. Wat wil je nog meer?

    Volg het ritme van ons hart

    Kan je niet wachten om jezelf te overstijgen bij Brussels Airport Company? Stuur snel jouw CV en motivatiebrief via de daarvoor bestemde link. En wie weet, misschien verwelkomen we jou heel binnenkort op onze bruisende luchthaven in het hart van Europa!

    Heb je nog vragen? Contacteer gerust Sofie.Bruynooghe@brusselsairport.be

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Datashift is a fast-growing consultancy team with a focus on delivering solutions that answer business questions with data and facts. For one of our fastest growing practices, we are looking for a skilled Data Engineer.

Do you have at least 3 to 6 years of experience? Do you love to work on projects and look at them from an end-to-end data perspective. Then we are delighted to receive your personal application and we’ll contact you for an interview and a (virtual) cup of coffee.
Translate client needs into maintainable data solution (ETL/Infrastructure as a code/Interfaces/pipelines, ...)
Design data solutions, making the trade-off between cost and maintainability
Work together with Data Scientists, BI specialists and Business Consultants to deliver value to our customers
Stay up to date with the latest developments in data technology and actively participate in sharing your knowledge with your colleagues
Monitor the quality and stability of data solutions
You feel energized when writing and observing well-structured code
Strong background in development, with knowledge in languages such as Java and/or PHP
Experience with Linux is a plus

Datashift is a firm believer in growing through its people. We will guide and support you providing many opportunities to develop and grow in the direction you want. However, we equally believe that it is you who takes ownership of your growth. That is why we give you the tools and the driving seat, it's up to you to do seize the opportunity.
One thing is for sure, surrounded by an entrepreneurial team, many opportunities will present themselves to deepen your expertise knowledge or broaden your Horizon in Data.

In this role, you are on the track to become a master in leading Data Engineering solutions for our clients. Whilst collaborating within Datashift on existing competence centers or helping to establish new practices. Making sure you and we keep up with the advancements in Data engineering.
A no-nonsense working environment with a focus on high quality
Excellent terms of employment (including company car, fuel card, meal vouchers & bonus)
Fringe benefits including continuous training that builds and extends professional, technical and management skills in all areas
The opportunity to grow together with Datashift in terms of capabilities as well as financial benefits.
Are you looking for a data engineering opportunity that allows you to progress towards greater architectural responsibilities? Feel free to reach out to +32 488 34 27 19 or jobs@datashift.eu.

4280259986,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-energy-at-clearsource-4280259986?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=QPd974C81Wr4OwShEpps6A%3D%3D,Data Analyst Energy,ClearSource,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Freelance Data Analyst Energy
Hybrid Brussels, start asap, long term
Our client is looking for a Data Advisor with an Agile Mindset Service

Side-by-side with other Contingent Workers and internal staff, you will play a part in building a sustainable, green and reliable energy infrastructure that stimulates economic growth and reduces our ecological footprint.

Our client is moving towards Data-centricity, i.e. Data becomes a masterpiece in its strategy execution, and a Data-driven company. Our mission consists in facilitating and driving the entire organisation to leverage data as an enabler to achieve its targets:
Unlock transversal Data fit for purpose

One key role of a Data Advisor is to close the gap between Business and Data. Together with subject matter experts, you define and design solid foundations for the Data in terms of Metadata, Responsibilities and Discoverability to leverage the Data Platform.
As part of a product team, you will move rocks to improve Data Management practices and to ease them.
You contribute to improving the Data Governance methodology by providing feedback from the field.
You work with a Business Purpose, while breathing Data, Organisation & People, Processes, and Technology.
You understand and analyse the Business needs.
You are looking for solutions that can quickly bring benefits and keep an eye on more-long terms solutions to ensure sustainability on mid-terms.
You leverage advising and training (i.e. Data Owners, Data Stewards, Business and IT teams) by on-the-job coaching.

You continuously review and ensure transversality of the Business Glossary that defines the common and universal language within client, by formalising the Business definitions of data and their purpose.
You manage expectations from, and intensely collaborate and align with, multi-disciplinary stakeholders, departments and product teams.
You excel at bringing people with various backgrounds together to converge.
You are the ambassador of One Team for the Customer.
What you will NOT be doing
You shall not act from an Ivory Tower.
You shall not define Data Governance methodology but will influence its evolution by providing retrospective feedback from the field.
You don’t make decisions for the Business but rather advise them with careful logic or showing your reasoning.
You don’t manage the data community, nor engineering, nor development teams.
You don’t define the details of the solutions architecture, nor the technical architecture, nor will you implement technical solutions.
You are able to speak, read and write fluently English and French or Dutch.
You can demonstrate proven experience with similar projects, missions or employments, with an experience of minimum 4 years with:
Data Classification, Data Privacy, Data Security, CIA Measures – Optional
If this sound like you, please send me your CV, day rate and availability to gregor@clearsource.eu

Freelance Data Analyst Energy

Hybrid Brussels, start asap, long term


Context

Our client is looking for a Data Advisor with an Agile Mindset Service

Side-by-side with other Contingent Workers and internal staff, you will play a part in building a sustainable, green and reliable energy infrastructure that stimulates economic growth and reduces our ecological footprint.


Service description

Our client is moving towards Data-centricity, i.e. Data becomes a masterpiece in its strategy execution, and a Data-driven company. Our mission consists in facilitating and driving the entire organisation to leverage data as an enabler to achieve its targets:

  1. Creating business value through Data
  2. Think Data intuitively
  3. Unlock transversal Data fit for purpose

One key role of a Data Advisor is to close the gap between Business and Data. Together with subject matter experts, you define and design solid foundations for the Data in terms of Metadata, Responsibilities and Discoverability to leverage the Data Platform.

As part of a product team, you will move rocks to improve Data Management practices and to ease them.


What you will be doing

  • You contribute to improving the Data Governance methodology by providing feedback from the field.
  • You work with a Business Purpose, while breathing Data, Organisation &
column2:
People, Processes, and Technology.
  • You understand and analyse the Business needs.
  • You are looking for solutions that can quickly bring benefits and keep an eye on more-long terms solutions to ensure sustainability on mid-terms.
  • You leverage advising and training (i.e. Data Owners, Data Stewards, Business and IT teams) by on-the-job coaching.
  • You continuously review and ensure transversality of the Business Glossary that defines the common and universal language within client, by formalising the Business definitions of data and their purpose.
  • You manage expectations from, and intensely collaborate and align with, multi-disciplinary stakeholders, departments and product teams.
  • You excel at bringing people with various backgrounds together to converge.
  • You are the ambassador of One Team for the Customer.
  • You always generate business value.


    • What you will NOT be doing

    • You shall not act from an Ivory Tower.
    • You shall not define Data Governance methodology but will influence its evolution by providing retrospective feedback from the field.
    • You don’t make decisions for the Business but rather advise them with careful logic or showing your reasoning.
    • You don’t manage the data community, nor engineering, nor development teams.
    • You don’t define the details of the solutions architecture, nor the technical architecture, nor will you implement technical solutions.
    • You don’t develop systems.


    Requirements

    • You are able to speak, read and write fluently English and French or Dutch.


    Technical Skills (required)

    You can demonstrate proven experience with similar projects, missions or employments, with an experience of minimum 4 years with:

    • Data Governance – Mandatory
    • Data Quality Management – Mandatory
    • Metadata Management – Mandatory
    • Master Data Management – Mandatory
    • Data Classification, Data Privacy, Data Security, CIA Measures – Optional
    • Business Intelligence &
column3:
Analytics – Optional
  • Big data – Optional
  • Data Modeling – Optional
  • Data Integration &
column4:
API – Optional


If this sound like you, please send me your CV, day rate and availability to gregor@clearsource.eu

4267165497,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-tekever-4267165497?position=32&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=Ahu0ef2YDnUbRXWyCANZ%2FA%3D%3D,Data Engineer,TEKEVER,European Union,"Are you ready to revolutionise the world with TEKEVER? 🚀🌍
At TEKEVER, we lead innovation in Europe as the European leader in unmanned technology, where cutting-edge advancements meet unparalleled innovation.

We operate across four strategic areas, combining artificial intelligence, systems engineering, data science, and aerospace technology to tackle global challenges — from protecting people and critical infrastructure to exploring space.

We offer a unique surveillance-as-a-service solution that delivers real-time intelligence, enhancing maritime safety and saving lives. Our products and services support strategic and operational decisions in the most demanding environments — whether at sea, on land, in space, or in cyberspace.
🌐 Become part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary, and mission-driven team that is transforming maritime surveillance and redefining global safety standards.
At TEKEVER, our mission is to provide limitless support through mission-oriented game-changers, delivering the right information at the right time to empower critical decision-making.
If you're passionate about technology and eager to shape the future — TEKEVER is the place for you. 👇🏻🎯

As a Data Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, building and maintaining the data pipelines and systems that support our data-driven initiatives, as well as supporting the evolution of our Data & Analytics Platform. You will work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to ensure that our data & AI infrastructure is robust, scalable and efficient. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, with experience in data integration, ETL processes, database management and Data & Analytics Platform development.
Data Pipeline Development: Design, develop and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines to collect, process and store large volumes of data from various sources.
ETL Processes: Implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data is accurately and efficiently transformed and loaded into data storage systems.
Database Management: Manage and optimize databases and data warehouses to ensure data integrity, performance and availability.
Data Integration: Integrate data from multiple sources, including APIs, databases and external data providers, to create unified datasets for analysis.
Data & Analytics Platform development & expansion: support the expansion of our Data & Analytics Platform.
Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure the accuracy and consistency of data.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide the necessary data infrastructure and support.
Performance Optimization: Monitor and optimize the performance of data pipelines and databases to ensure efficient data processing and retrieval.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data pipelines, ETL processes and database schemas.
Education: Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.
Preferred location of working: UK, Portugal , France and/or Spain
Experience: 3+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Experience with SQL and database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server).
Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data warehousing solutions (e.g., Redshift, Snowflake).
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services, with a focus on Google Cloud. Google Cloud certification is preferred.
Knowledge of data integration tools and frameworks (e.g., Apache Nifi, Talend, Informatica).
Experience with data modeling and schema design.

Experience with Iaac (e.g. Ansible, Terraform), data pipeline orchestration (e.g. Airflow), log exploration tools (e.g. Streamlit, Dash), data extraction (e.g. PostGIS, Kafka, Airflow, FastAPI), pandas, scikit-learn, Docker.
Basic understanding of DevOps best practices and tools: GIT, CI/CD, telemetry and monitoring, etc.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering scalable and efficient data solutions.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Language Requirements: Advanced proficiency in Portuguese and English, with proven fluency at the C2 level in both languages.
Attention to Detail: High attention to detail and a commitment to ensuring data quality and accuracy.
Adaptability: Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.
What We Have To Offer You
An excellent work environment and an opportunity to create a real impact in the world
A truly high-tech, state-of-the-art engineering company with flat structure and no politics
Working with the very latest technologies in Data & AI, including Edge AI, Swarming - both within our software platforms and within our embedded on-board systems
Salary compatible with the level of proven experience.
Do you want to know more about us ?
Visit our LinkedIn page at https://www.linkedin.com/company/tekever/

4182799797,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/esg-quantitative-analyst-at-candriam-4182799797?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=%2FcG9M%2FL4OuVqmUYnOADtDQ%3D%3D,ESG Quantitative Analyst,Candriam,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Position description

Candriam is a global multi-specialist asset manager and a recognized pioneer and leader in sustainable investment. For more than 25 years, Candriam has offered innovative and diversified investment solutions across many asset classes including fixed income, equities, absolute return, asset allocation and illiquid assets.

As a Responsible Employer, Equal Employment Opportunity is crucial to Candriam. We are committed to building the best global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We provide an inclusive work environment and support wellbeing and work-life balance.

Within Candriam, the ESG Quantitative Analytics and Research team is a Front Office team that copes with various transversal projects linked to ESG. Its main objective is to provide innovative, state-of-the-art ESG analysis frameworks and market leading ESG investment solutions.

We are hiring an ESG Quantitative Analyst who will support and enhance the ESG universe that incorporates all the internal ESG analysis. This person will act as the liaison between Investment Engineering team, ESG analysts and Investment Managers.
Based in Brussels, he/she will contribute to the following missions:
ESG universe production, support and enhancements:
Produce the internal ESG scorings/ratings and eligibilities for portfolios.
Performs controls on ESG universe updates and coordination within the whole ESG team.
Analyze variations in the eligibility decisions of issuers and provide clear explanations.
Enhance of the ESG universe and participate in the new target architecture around ESG data.
Link with Managers, IT and ESG referential data team.
Enhance internal ESG models to be more in line with evolving client’s demand and regulations:
Develop ESG algorithm solution in Python.
Improve models and documentation linked to controversial activities
Simulate and implement new models linked to clients demands, regulations and labels.
Build tools for the team and other departments:
In particular specific tools via Power BI.
Master's degree in fields such as Quantitative Finance, Data Analysis, Mathematics, Environmental Science or Engineering.
Minimum 2 years' experience in similar role, within the Financial Services sector.
Strong IT knowledge, programming skills and working knowledge in Python are required.
Solid understanding of financial maths and instruments.
Azure synapse and Factset are a plus.
Analytical, synthetical mind and strong eye for details
Ability to explain analysis and/or models to non-technical audience.
English fluent. French or Dutch would be a plus.

Position description

Business unit

Investment Management - ESG Investments &
column2:
Research

Job title

ESG Quantitative Analyst

Contract type

Permanent

Candriam Group Presentation

Candriam is a global multi-specialist asset manager and a recognized pioneer and leader in sustainable investment. For more than 25 years, Candriam has offered innovative and diversified investment solutions across many asset classes including fixed income, equities, absolute return, asset allocation and illiquid assets.

As a Responsible Employer, Equal Employment Opportunity is crucial to Candriam. We are committed to building the best global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We provide an inclusive work environment and support wellbeing and work-life balance.

Mission

Within Candriam, the ESG Quantitative Analytics and Research team is a Front Office team that copes with various transversal projects linked to ESG. Its main objective is to provide innovative, state-of-the-art ESG analysis frameworks and market leading ESG investment solutions.

We are hiring an ESG Quantitative Analyst who will support and enhance the ESG universe that incorporates all the internal ESG analysis. This person will act as the liaison between Investment Engineering team, ESG analysts and Investment Managers.

Responsabilities

Based in Brussels, he/she will contribute to the following missions:

  • ESG universe production, support and enhancements:


Produce the internal ESG scorings/ratings and eligibilities for portfolios.

Performs controls on ESG universe updates and coordination within the whole ESG team.

Analyze variations in the eligibility decisions of issuers and provide clear explanations.

Enhance of the ESG universe and participate in the new target architecture around ESG data.

Link with Managers, IT and ESG referential data team.

  • Enhance internal ESG models to be more in line with evolving client’s demand and regulations:


Develop ESG algorithm solution in Python.

Improve models and documentation linked to controversial activities

Simulate and implement new models linked to clients demands, regulations and labels.

  • Build tools for the team and other departments:


In particular specific tools via Power BI.

Profile

Master's degree in fields such as Quantitative Finance, Data Analysis, Mathematics, Environmental Science or Engineering.

Minimum 2 years' experience in similar role, within the Financial Services sector.

Strong interest in ESG.

Skills :

Good communication skills.

Strong IT knowledge, programming skills and working knowledge in Python are required.

Solid understanding of financial maths and instruments.

Proficient in PowerBI and Excel

Azure synapse and Factset are a plus.

Experience with ESG data providers

Pro-active and stress resistant

Analytical, synthetical mind and strong eye for details

Team player.

Ability to explain analysis and/or models to non-technical audience.

English fluent. French or Dutch would be a plus.

Job location


Candidate criteria

Education

  • Master's Degree I / Bac+4


Minimum Level Of Experience Required

2-5 years

Languages

English (C1 - Fluent)

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !
Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez
Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN
Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions
Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.
Vous serez notamment en charge de :
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises
Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou master, vous justifiez d’a minima 8 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :
Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,

Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.
Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,

  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !
