4281245017,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/project-administrator-at-manpower-talent-based-outsourcing-belgium-4281245017?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=P6Ckt8k3KCW34p8w1Gb13A%3D%3D&trackingId=5nHpeSys6XyPtcKLlBqPqw%3D%3D,Project Administrator,Manpower Talent Based Outsourcing Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Are you a talented and motivated individual looking to join a world-renowned automotive brand Then we have what you are looking for!
For our client active in the automotive sector, we are looking for a Project Administrator in Zaventem to join the Homologation team.
You give administrative support by creating manuals, guidelines, technical materials and assist with visualizations.
You handle administrative tasks such as archiving, organizing meetings, and preparing schedules.
You coordinate with designers to gather the necessary information for testing.
You participate in meetings related to the homologation process.
You download documentation from different databases and upload it to SharePoint.
You make sure the technical data in Certificate of Conformity (COC) & EREG base files are processed correct.
You collect planning materials for test vehicle selection (check in with designers and share test results).
You collect approval certificates for different components.
An interest for the automotive industry is good to have for this position.
An engineering/technical background is also a great plus!
You can plan your work autonomously, to achieve results within a set deadline.
You can manage different projects at the same time.µ
You are fluent in English (verbally and written).
You have good computer skills: Excel, Sharepoint, Outlook.
A contract of indefinite duration with Manpower Talent Based Outsourcing.
A competitive salary with different extralegal advantages (meal vouchers of 8 euros per worked day, 32 vacation days, group and hospitalization insurance, travel refunds, …).
Permanent support and coaching from your personal consultant of Manpower TBO.
You will have the possibility to follow trainings to keep on growing.

At Manpower Talent Based Outsourcing (TBO) we offer outsourcing and contracting opportunities for different kinds of international and national companies. As a contractor for Manpower TBO, you work on a project at one of our clients. Those projects can be of short (at least 3 months) to very long (multiple years) duration. We are specialized in six domains: Administration, Healthcare, Logistics & Automotive, Sales & Marketing.
Are you interested or do you need more info?

Are you a talented and motivated individual looking to join a world-renowned automotive brand Then we have what you are looking for!


For our client active in the automotive sector, we are looking for a Project Administrator in Zaventem to join the Homologation team.



Job description:

  • You give administrative support by creating manuals, guidelines, technical materials and assist with visualizations.
  • You handle administrative tasks such as archiving, organizing meetings, and preparing schedules.
  • You coordinate with designers to gather the necessary information for testing.
  • You participate in meetings related to the homologation process.
  • You download documentation from different databases and upload it to SharePoint.
  • You make sure the technical data in Certificate of Conformity (COC) &
column2:
EREG base files are processed correct.
  • You collect planning materials for test vehicle selection (check in with designers and share test results).
  • You collect approval certificates for different components.



    • Who are you:

    • An interest for the automotive industry is good to have for this position.
    • An engineering/technical background is also a great plus!
    • You are accurate and organized.
    • You pay attention to details.
    • You can plan your work autonomously, to achieve results within a set deadline.
    • You can manage different projects at the same time.µ
    • You are fluent in English (verbally and written).
    • You have good computer skills: Excel, Sharepoint, Outlook.



    What we offer:

    • A contract of indefinite duration with Manpower Talent Based Outsourcing.
    • A competitive salary with different extralegal advantages (meal vouchers of 8 euros per worked day, 32 vacation days, group and hospitalization insurance, travel refunds, …).
    • Permanent support and coaching from your personal consultant of Manpower TBO.
    • You will have the possibility to follow trainings to keep on growing.



    Who are we:

    At Manpower Talent Based Outsourcing (TBO) we offer outsourcing and contracting opportunities for different kinds of international and national companies. As a contractor for Manpower TBO, you work on a project at one of our clients. Those projects can be of short (at least 3 months) to very long (multiple years) duration. We are specialized in six domains: Administration, Healthcare, Logistics &
column3: Automotive, Sales &amp
column4:
Marketing.



Are you interested or do you need more info?

Mail to: TBO@manpowergroupsolutions.be

4280259986,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-energy-at-clearsource-4280259986?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=P6Ckt8k3KCW34p8w1Gb13A%3D%3D&trackingId=bIbVKUf0MUso4xnQqNK4gQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst Energy,ClearSource,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Freelance Data Analyst Energy
Hybrid Brussels, start asap, long term
Our client is looking for a Data Advisor with an Agile Mindset Service

Side-by-side with other Contingent Workers and internal staff, you will play a part in building a sustainable, green and reliable energy infrastructure that stimulates economic growth and reduces our ecological footprint.

Our client is moving towards Data-centricity, i.e. Data becomes a masterpiece in its strategy execution, and a Data-driven company. Our mission consists in facilitating and driving the entire organisation to leverage data as an enabler to achieve its targets:
Unlock transversal Data fit for purpose

One key role of a Data Advisor is to close the gap between Business and Data. Together with subject matter experts, you define and design solid foundations for the Data in terms of Metadata, Responsibilities and Discoverability to leverage the Data Platform.
As part of a product team, you will move rocks to improve Data Management practices and to ease them.
You contribute to improving the Data Governance methodology by providing feedback from the field.
You work with a Business Purpose, while breathing Data, Organisation & People, Processes, and Technology.
You understand and analyse the Business needs.
You are looking for solutions that can quickly bring benefits and keep an eye on more-long terms solutions to ensure sustainability on mid-terms.
You leverage advising and training (i.e. Data Owners, Data Stewards, Business and IT teams) by on-the-job coaching.

You continuously review and ensure transversality of the Business Glossary that defines the common and universal language within client, by formalising the Business definitions of data and their purpose.
You manage expectations from, and intensely collaborate and align with, multi-disciplinary stakeholders, departments and product teams.
You excel at bringing people with various backgrounds together to converge.
You are the ambassador of One Team for the Customer.
What you will NOT be doing
You shall not act from an Ivory Tower.
You shall not define Data Governance methodology but will influence its evolution by providing retrospective feedback from the field.
You don’t make decisions for the Business but rather advise them with careful logic or showing your reasoning.
You don’t manage the data community, nor engineering, nor development teams.
You don’t define the details of the solutions architecture, nor the technical architecture, nor will you implement technical solutions.
You are able to speak, read and write fluently English and French or Dutch.
You can demonstrate proven experience with similar projects, missions or employments, with an experience of minimum 4 years with:
Data Classification, Data Privacy, Data Security, CIA Measures – Optional
If this sound like you, please send me your CV, day rate and availability to gregor@clearsource.eu

Freelance Data Analyst Energy

Hybrid Brussels, start asap, long term


Context

Our client is looking for a Data Advisor with an Agile Mindset Service

Side-by-side with other Contingent Workers and internal staff, you will play a part in building a sustainable, green and reliable energy infrastructure that stimulates economic growth and reduces our ecological footprint.


Service description

Our client is moving towards Data-centricity, i.e. Data becomes a masterpiece in its strategy execution, and a Data-driven company. Our mission consists in facilitating and driving the entire organisation to leverage data as an enabler to achieve its targets:

  1. Creating business value through Data
  2. Think Data intuitively
  3. Unlock transversal Data fit for purpose

One key role of a Data Advisor is to close the gap between Business and Data. Together with subject matter experts, you define and design solid foundations for the Data in terms of Metadata, Responsibilities and Discoverability to leverage the Data Platform.

As part of a product team, you will move rocks to improve Data Management practices and to ease them.


What you will be doing

  • You contribute to improving the Data Governance methodology by providing feedback from the field.
  • You work with a Business Purpose, while breathing Data, Organisation &
column2:
People, Processes, and Technology.
  • You understand and analyse the Business needs.
  • You are looking for solutions that can quickly bring benefits and keep an eye on more-long terms solutions to ensure sustainability on mid-terms.
  • You leverage advising and training (i.e. Data Owners, Data Stewards, Business and IT teams) by on-the-job coaching.
  • You continuously review and ensure transversality of the Business Glossary that defines the common and universal language within client, by formalising the Business definitions of data and their purpose.
  • You manage expectations from, and intensely collaborate and align with, multi-disciplinary stakeholders, departments and product teams.
  • You excel at bringing people with various backgrounds together to converge.
  • You are the ambassador of One Team for the Customer.
  • You always generate business value.


    • What you will NOT be doing

    • You shall not act from an Ivory Tower.
    • You shall not define Data Governance methodology but will influence its evolution by providing retrospective feedback from the field.
    • You don’t make decisions for the Business but rather advise them with careful logic or showing your reasoning.
    • You don’t manage the data community, nor engineering, nor development teams.
    • You don’t define the details of the solutions architecture, nor the technical architecture, nor will you implement technical solutions.
    • You don’t develop systems.


    Requirements

    • You are able to speak, read and write fluently English and French or Dutch.


    Technical Skills (required)

    You can demonstrate proven experience with similar projects, missions or employments, with an experience of minimum 4 years with:

    • Data Governance – Mandatory
    • Data Quality Management – Mandatory
    • Metadata Management – Mandatory
    • Master Data Management – Mandatory
    • Data Classification, Data Privacy, Data Security, CIA Measures – Optional
    • Business Intelligence &
column3:
Analytics – Optional
  • Big data – Optional
  • Data Modeling – Optional
  • Data Integration &
column4:
API – Optional


If this sound like you, please send me your CV, day rate and availability to gregor@clearsource.eu

4280020052,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/job-system-engineer-brussels-at-dkv-belgium-4280020052?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=P6Ckt8k3KCW34p8w1Gb13A%3D%3D&trackingId=xzXdOxctWapz%2BwNYBTNuQQ%3D%3D,Job | System engineer | Brussels,DKV Belgium,"Uccle, Brussels Region, Belgium","Looking for a new challenge in IT? Look no further, we have just the job for you.

DKV Belgium, a loyal partner in insurance, but there’s more that meets the eye —we’re a dynamic team of around 500 engaged colleagues driving digital transformation. As part of the international Munich Re Group, we proudly lead private health insurance in Belgium, supporting our clients during good and difficult times. You will arrive in an environment where everybody is able to be who they are, where you can get the most of yourself day in day out, with the support of your colleagues.
Together, we put our values success, diversity, collegiality, and development into practice every day to strengthen the trust of our two million clients.
Sounds like a plan? Continue reading!
What The Key Tasks Will Look Like

As a System Engineer, you are the backbone of IT operations. You’ll ensure seamless service delivery, provide expert support to users, and proactively maintain high system availability. Your role spans managing and optimizing infrastructure, leading technical projects, safeguarding system security, and ensuring business continuity. You’ll also oversee production releases, maintain clear documentation, and administer databases—all while being a trusted escalation point and a key player in daily operational readiness

You guarantee the availability of the systems and networks, and the continuity of the associated IT equipment so the end users can always do their work professionally. More concretely, your tasks will be the following:
You are the first line of defense when network or system issues arise. Your responsibility will be to:
Provide expert support to users, analyze their questions, and recommend effective solutions.
Guide and inform users to ensure smooth and confident system usage.
Proactively identify and resolve issues to maintain optimal system availability.
Act as the escalation point for the service desk, ensuring swift and effective resolution of complex problems.
You will take charge of the network and system infrastructure, ensuring it runs smoothly and evolves with the organization’s needs. In this role, you will:
Manage daily operations, maintenance, and monitoring of infrastructure.
Evaluate, adapt, and document systems to support continuous improvement.
Implement updates, patches, and enhancements provided by vendors.
Analyze usage and requests to ensure the infrastructure is properly sized and scalable.
Your role will be pivotal in driving infrastructure projects and maintaining business resilience. You will:
Collaborate on and implement new infrastructure and services.
Lead initiatives to introduce and evaluate new systems and networks.
Ensure robust security across systems and networks, including firewalls and OS-level protections.
Plan and execute the Disaster Recovery Plan (DRP) to guarantee business continuity.
Participate in on-call and shift rotations to ensure coverage and readiness, including daily ""Start Of Day"" checks.
You will ensure that systems are well-documented, releases are smooth, and databases are well-managed. Your responsibilities include:
Executing production releases in strict alignment with organizational processes and approvals.
Maintaining clear, up-to-date documentation of infrastructure configurations in collaboration with the system architect.
Administering databases across production, testing, and development environments.
Bachelor or Master degree in Computer Science or equivalent by experience.
Some years of experience as System Engineer are recommended.
strong focus on MS Azure with experience of Terraform
Symantec Enterprise Vault and Endpoint Protection
VoIP Mitel products, softphone, xPhone Fax
Knowledge of Linux (Red Hat or other distribution)
Knowledge of AS400, SQL, Dell ECS is an asset.
Affinity with containers, Kubernetes, networking, security.
You’re a quick and eager learner, ready to dive into new challenges and technologies.
You communicate with confidence and clarity, especially in spoken interactions.
You know how to ask the right questions to get to the heart of any issue.
Your analytical mindset and active listening skills help you understand complex situations and find smart solutions.
At DKV we offer you a varied job with growth opportunities (thanks to trainings, coaching, growth projects and internal mobility) and all this at a prime location in the heart of Brussels.
Besides a competitive gross salary, we offer an extensive standard package of extra-legal benefits such as:
insurance package (hospitalization, ambulatory insurance, guaranteed income insurance, pension plan)
a year-end premium, collective company premium

Moreover, you can count on an attractive leave scheme (up to 31 days), flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home up to three days a week. This way of hybrid working guarantees you a good balance between work and your private life.

We are an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs. If you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can make any reasonable adjustments needed to support you through your recruitment journey.

Together, we put our values success, diversity, collegiality, and development into practice every day to strengthen the trust of our two million clients.

Sounds like a plan? Continue reading!

Technical Skills

Required skills and competencies

  • Technical knowledge:

    • Firewall (Palo Alto - Fortigate)

    • Windows defender

  • Fluent in Dutch or French.
  • Good working knowledge of English.

Behavioral Skills

  • You’re a quick and eager learner, ready to dive into new challenges and technologies.
  • You communicate with confidence and clarity, especially in spoken interactions.
  • You know how to ask the right questions to get to the heart of any issue.
  • Your analytical mindset and active listening skills help you understand complex situations and find smart solutions.


Want to grow with us?

At DKV we offer you a varied job with growth opportunities (thanks to trainings, coaching, growth projects and internal mobility) and all this at a prime location in the heart of Brussels.

Besides a competitive gross salary, we offer an extensive standard package of extra-legal benefits such as:

  • insurance package (hospitalization, ambulatory insurance, guaranteed income insurance, pension plan)
  • a year-end premium, collective company premium
  • meal and eco vouchers
  • internet and homeworking allowance


Moreover, you can count on an attractive leave scheme (up to 31 days), flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home up to three days a week. This way of hybrid working guarantees you a good balance between work and your private life.

We are an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs. If you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can make any reasonable adjustments needed to support you through your recruitment journey.

4282222046,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/deputy-director-council-secretariat-at-nato-4282222046?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=P6Ckt8k3KCW34p8w1Gb13A%3D%3D&trackingId=%2BG%2FMMiBx0uaUcauYsOs2Bw%3D%3D,"Deputy Director, Council Secretariat",NATO,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Primary Location

The publication of this call for interest is organised as a fast track competition open to candidates who already hold a valid NATO personnel security clearance or a valid personnel security clearance (PSC) at the appropriate level issued by the candidate’s parent National Security Authority (NSA) / Designated Security Authority (DSA) or anyother competent security authority: this may include NATO International Civilians, temporary staff, consultants, contractors, interns, Voluntary National Contributions (VNCs) and members of Allied National administrations.

NATO’s Council Secretariat bears overall responsibility for the end-to-end enablement of Alliance consultation and decision-making processes – from planning and organisation to their effective and efficient implementation. It thereby provides organisational support and advice to the NATO Secretary General and the North Atlantic Council as well as to individual Allies and Partners. The Secretariat is structured in three sections: (i) Council, Committee and Conference Services
column2: (ii) Protocol and Events
column3: and (iii) Linguistic Services. The Secretariat also leads the NATO Summit and Ministerial Task Force. It is further responsible for all Protocol issues involving the Secretary General, the Deputy Secretary General and the Council.

column1: The incumbent serves as key advisor on management issues and Deputy to the Director of the Council Secretariat, assuming related management and coordination tasks in their absence. They assist the Director in the overall leadership, direction and management of the Secretariat, promoting operational excellence and the implementation of sound and inclusive management principles. They thereby help ensure the effective and efficient accomplishment of the Council Secretariat´s mission, priorities and objectives, in line with overall Alliance objectives. They identify, plan and implement initiatives and business processes aimed at improving efficiency and proficiency across all sections.

They are responsible to the Director for overseeing the efficient management of the Secretariat´s resources, including budgetary and human resources as well as information and communication technology. They will thereby put a premium on innovation and early adoption of technology, in support of enhanced business processes, working methods and IKM, and lead on related change management. Within their area of responsibility, they will represent the Director in relevant corporate initiatives and projects. They will also be in charge of ensuring that the Secretariat responds to all administrative and due diligence requirements in terms of reporting and auditing in a timely manner. They will oversee and organise the work of the Council Secretariat´s Front Office and act as their line manager.
Key challenges facing the successful candidate for this post during the next 2-3 years will include:

Designing, developing and adapting management and business processes for an exponentially growing and versatile team, supporting an integrated way of working across CONSEC and furthering operational output, customer service and staff satisfaction
Overseeing and coordinating a full review of IKM related processes and tools currently in use in CONSEC and proposing relevant upgrades and implementation strategies
Steering or contributing to innovative corporate projects in the areas of consultation, communication, event management or linguistics.

I In addition to completing the application form, including the pre-screening questions, candidates will be asked to attach one MS Word document (please limit yourself to maximum one A4 page), summarising their views on the key (and possible other) challenges, and how they would address them if selected for the position. This essay will be evaluated as part of the shortlisting assessment (see full instructions on how to apply at the end of the vacancy notice).
As part of the Council Secretariat, the post holder may be required to travel occasionally and work beyond standard office hours when required.
possess a university degree from a recognized institution, in a field relevant for this position

have at least 10 years of experience in a multilateral environment, in progressively responsible positions, out of which at least 5 years of organisational management experience, project and resource management
have a proven track record of creating a high-level strategy and successfully leading organisations to develop and implement the necessary policies and procedures
have demonstrated experience in leading on change initiatives
have strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to draft and review documents addressed to senior leadership
have experience facilitating high-level dialogue and consensus in a multilateral organisation
possess the following minimum levels of NATO’s official languages (English/French): VI (“Proficiency”) in one
column2: II (“Elementary”) in the other.

column1: The following would be considered an advantage:
management experience in the NATO operating environment and related knowledge of NATO structure, practices and business processes
knowledge and experience in working in/with one or more of the business domains of the Council Secretariat (Council, Committee, Conference services, Protocol and Events
column2: Linguistic Services)

column1: experience with planning, execution and oversight of delivery of complex technology capabilities.

Assist the Director in setting priorities and objectives for the Council Secretariat, in alignment with the strategic direction of the Alliance. Help develop, communicate and implement a vision based on well-defined priorities and objectives. Assist the Director in ensuring the proper management of human, budgetary and technological resources.

Assist the Director in managing balanced workload and resilience across the Secretariat. Act as a role model of inclusive leadership and promote collaboration, flexibility and innovation, in close cooperation with Section Heads. Lead on the organisation of the Secretariat’s Front Office, including a team of assistants providing administrative, IKM and budget support. Provide regular and fair feedback on performance, informally as appropriate and through the HQ Performance Review and Development (PRD) system. Identify possible development and mobility opportunities for team members.

Develop and foster relations at senior levels to facilitate collaboration and output. Participate in relevant committees, task forces, boards, panels and working groups linked to business integration as appropriate.
Assist the Director in overarching management and coordination of the Council Secretariat and proactively analyse and address future needs.

Assist the Director in managing the organisational structures of the Council Secretariat and promote efficient use of existing resources, including by developing and promoting improved business processes, tools and technologies.
Assist the Director in establishing objectives and priorities, propose budget aligned with the latter, and exercise oversight and management in terms of budget implementation.
Manage workload, ensure prioritisation and ensure that project/programme deliverables are attained and guide their progress. Identify risks and undertake contingency planning to mitigate them.
Review and contribute to policy papers and reports related to subjects under the Secretariat´s purview.

Ensure that the Secretariat´s corporate knowledge is retained, accessible to a variety of differentiated stakeholders, and managed according to state-of-the-art IKM policies and principles, in close coordination with relevant initiatives taken at Enterprise level.
Perform any other related duty as assigned.

The incumbent reports to the Director of the Council Secretariat, Secretary of the Council and Chief of Protocol, and works closely with the Deputy Secretary of the Council, the Deputy Chief of Protocol and the Head of Linguistics Services, forming together an integrated management team. The incumbent will maintain communication and coordination with in-house stakeholders, including the Office of the Secretary General - and notably with the Director General for Management and Deputy Director General for Management, senior interlocutors in IS Divisions and independent offices, as well as NATO Military Authorities/IMS. The incumbent will be the line manager for the Council Secretariat’s Front Office, which includes two Front Office Assistants, 1 IKM Coordinator as well as 1 Budget assistant.
Candidates must demonstrate the following competencies:
Achievement: Sets and works to meet challenging goals
Conceptual Thinking: Clarifies complex data or situations
Developing Others: Provides in-depth mentoring, coaching and training
Impact and Influence: Uses indirect influence
Initiative: Plans and acts for the long-term
Leadership: Positions self as the leader
Self-Control: Stays composed and positive even under extreme pressure.
Contract to be offered to the successful applicant (if non-seconded): Definite duration contract of three years
column2: possibility of renewal for up to three years, during which the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite duration contract.

column1: In accordance with the contract policy, this is a post in which turnover is desirable for political reasons in order to be able to accommodate the Organisation's need to carry out its tasks as mandated by the Nations in a changing environment, for example by maintaining the flexibility necessary to shape the Organisation's skills profile, and to ensure appropriate international diversity.

The maximum period of service foreseen in this post is 6 years. The successful applicant will be offered a 3-year definite duration contract, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years. However, according to the procedure described in the contract policy the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite contract during the period of renewal and no later than one year before the end of contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO’s member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject also to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.
Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Régulations.
USEFUL INFORMATION REGARDING APPLICATION AND RECRUITMENT PROCESS
Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:
For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal ( link )
Before you apply to any position, we encourage you to click here and watch our video providing 6 tips to prepare you for your application and recruitment process.
Do you have questions on the application process in the system and not sure how to proceed? Click here for a video containing the information you need to successfully submit your application on time.
Please note that the on site competition for this post is provisionally scheduled in the second half of September 2025, in Brussels, Belgium.
Candidates are requested to attach their essay to their application on Taleo, by latest 4 September 2025, 23h59 (CET Brussels time).
The title of the attachment must include the vacancy reference 251308 and the words “Key challenges”.
More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm)

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate), approval of the candidate’s medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser, verification of your study(ies) and work experience, and the successful completion of the accreditation and notification process by the relevant authorities.

NATO will not accept any phase of the recruitment and selection prepared, in whole or in part, by means of generative artificial-intelligence (AI) tools, including and without limitation to chatbots, such as Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer (Chat GPT), or other language generating tools. NATO reserves the right to screen applications to identify the use of such tools. All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO’s sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.

NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply.

NATO is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible working environment, where all candidates living with disabilities can fully participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require reasonable accommodation, please inform us during your selection process.
Candidates will be required to provide documented medical evidence to support their request for accommodation.

Building Integrity is a key element of NATO’s core tasks. As an employer, NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defence and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work.
Due to the broad interest in NATO and the large number of potential candidates, telephone or e-mail enquiries cannot be dealt with.

Applicants who are not successful in this competition may be offered an appointment to another post of a similar nature, albeit at the same or a lower grade, provided they meet the necessary requirements.
The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours.
The organization offers several work-life policies including Teleworking and Flexible Working arrangements (Flexitime) subject to business requirements.
Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium is a non-smoking environment.
For information about the NATO Single Salary Scale (Grading, Allowances, etc.) please visit our website . Detailed data is available under the Salary and Benefits tab.
NATO does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. For more info please click here .

Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO International Staff (NATO IS)

Schedule

Full-time

Application Deadline

04-Sep-2025, 10:59:00 PM

Salary (Pay Basis)

10,742.69

Grade

NATO Grade G22

The publication of this call for interest is organised as a fast track competition open to candidates who already hold a valid NATO personnel security clearance or a valid personnel security clearance (PSC) at the appropriate level issued by the candidate’s parent National Security Authority (NSA) / Designated Security Authority (DSA) or anyother competent security authority: this may include NATO International Civilians, temporary staff, consultants, contractors, interns, Voluntary National Contributions (VNCs) and members of Allied National administrations.

  • SUMMARY


NATO’s Council Secretariat bears overall responsibility for the end-to-end enablement of Alliance consultation and decision-making processes – from planning and organisation to their effective and efficient implementation. It thereby provides organisational support and advice to the NATO Secretary General and the North Atlantic Council as well as to individual Allies and Partners. The Secretariat is structured in three sections: (i) Council, Committee and Conference Services
column2: (ii) Protocol and Events
column3:
and (iii) Linguistic Services. The Secretariat also leads the NATO Summit and Ministerial Task Force. It is further responsible for all Protocol issues involving the Secretary General, the Deputy Secretary General and the Council.

The incumbent serves as key advisor on management issues and Deputy to the Director of the Council Secretariat, assuming related management and coordination tasks in their absence. They assist the Director in the overall leadership, direction and management of the Secretariat, promoting operational excellence and the implementation of sound and inclusive management principles. They thereby help ensure the effective and efficient accomplishment of the Council Secretariat´s mission, priorities and objectives, in line with overall Alliance objectives. They identify, plan and implement initiatives and business processes aimed at improving efficiency and proficiency across all sections.

They are responsible to the Director for overseeing the efficient management of the Secretariat´s resources, including budgetary and human resources as well as information and communication technology. They will thereby put a premium on innovation and early adoption of technology, in support of enhanced business processes, working methods and IKM, and lead on related change management. Within their area of responsibility, they will represent the Director in relevant corporate initiatives and projects. They will also be in charge of ensuring that the Secretariat responds to all administrative and due diligence requirements in terms of reporting and auditing in a timely manner. They will oversee and organise the work of the Council Secretariat´s Front Office and act as their line manager.

Key challenges facing the successful candidate for this post during the next 2-3 years will include:

  • Designing, developing and adapting management and business processes for an exponentially growing and versatile team, supporting an integrated way of working across CONSEC and furthering operational output, customer service and staff satisfaction
column4: • Overseeing and coordinating a full review of IKM related processes and tools currently in use in CONSEC and proposing relevant upgrades and implementation strategies
column5:
• Steering or contributing to innovative corporate projects in the areas of consultation, communication, event management or linguistics.


    • I In addition to completing the application form, including the pre-screening questions, candidates will be asked to attach one MS Word document (please limit yourself to maximum one A4 page), summarising their views on the key (and possible other) challenges, and how they would address them if selected for the position. This essay will be evaluated as part of the shortlisting assessment (see full instructions on how to apply at the end of the vacancy notice).

    As part of the Council Secretariat, the post holder may be required to travel occasionally and work beyond standard office hours when required.

    • QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE


    The candidate must:

    • possess a university degree from a recognized institution, in a field relevant for this position
column6: • have at least 10 years of experience in a multilateral environment, in progressively responsible positions, out of which at least 5 years of organisational management experience, project and resource management
column7: • have a proven track record of creating a high-level strategy and successfully leading organisations to develop and implement the necessary policies and procedures
column8: • have demonstrated experience in leading on change initiatives
column9: • have experience managing cross-functional teams
column10: • have strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to draft and review documents addressed to senior leadership
column11: • have experience facilitating high-level dialogue and consensus in a multilateral organisation
column12: • possess the following minimum levels of NATO’s official languages (English/French): VI (“Proficiency”) in one
column13:
II (“Elementary”) in the other.
  • DESIRABLE


    • The following would be considered an advantage:

    • management experience in the NATO operating environment and related knowledge of NATO structure, practices and business processes
column14: • knowledge and experience in working in/with one or more of the business domains of the Council Secretariat (Council, Committee, Conference services, Protocol and Events
column15: Linguistic Services)
column16:
• experience with planning, execution and oversight of delivery of complex technology capabilities.
  • MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES


    • Vision and Direction

    Assist the Director in setting priorities and objectives for the Council Secretariat, in alignment with the strategic direction of the Alliance. Help develop, communicate and implement a vision based on well-defined priorities and objectives. Assist the Director in ensuring the proper management of human, budgetary and technological resources.

    People Management

    Assist the Director in managing balanced workload and resilience across the Secretariat. Act as a role model of inclusive leadership and promote collaboration, flexibility and innovation, in close cooperation with Section Heads. Lead on the organisation of the Secretariat’s Front Office, including a team of assistants providing administrative, IKM and budget support. Provide regular and fair feedback on performance, informally as appropriate and through the HQ Performance Review and Development (PRD) system. Identify possible development and mobility opportunities for team members.

    Stakeholder Management

    Develop and foster relations at senior levels to facilitate collaboration and output. Participate in relevant committees, task forces, boards, panels and working groups linked to business integration as appropriate.

    Planning and Execution

    Assist the Director in overarching management and coordination of the Council Secretariat and proactively analyse and address future needs.

    Organisational Efficiencies

    Assist the Director in managing the organisational structures of the Council Secretariat and promote efficient use of existing resources, including by developing and promoting improved business processes, tools and technologies.

    Financial Management

    Assist the Director in establishing objectives and priorities, propose budget aligned with the latter, and exercise oversight and management in terms of budget implementation.

    Project Management

    Manage workload, ensure prioritisation and ensure that project/programme deliverables are attained and guide their progress. Identify risks and undertake contingency planning to mitigate them.

    Policy Development

    Review and contribute to policy papers and reports related to subjects under the Secretariat´s purview.

    Knowledge Management

    Ensure that the Secretariat´s corporate knowledge is retained, accessible to a variety of differentiated stakeholders, and managed according to state-of-the-art IKM policies and principles, in close coordination with relevant initiatives taken at Enterprise level.

    Perform any other related duty as assigned.

    • INTERELATIONSHIPS


    The incumbent reports to the Director of the Council Secretariat, Secretary of the Council and Chief of Protocol, and works closely with the Deputy Secretary of the Council, the Deputy Chief of Protocol and the Head of Linguistics Services, forming together an integrated management team. The incumbent will maintain communication and coordination with in-house stakeholders, including the Office of the Secretary General - and notably with the Director General for Management and Deputy Director General for Management, senior interlocutors in IS Divisions and independent offices, as well as NATO Military Authorities/IMS. The incumbent will be the line manager for the Council Secretariat’s Front Office, which includes two Front Office Assistants, 1 IKM Coordinator as well as 1 Budget assistant.

    • COMPETENCIES


    Candidates must demonstrate the following competencies:

    • Achievement: Sets and works to meet challenging goals
column17: • Change Leadership: Personally leads change
column18: • Conceptual Thinking: Clarifies complex data or situations
column19: • Developing Others: Provides in-depth mentoring, coaching and training
column20: • Impact and Influence: Uses indirect influence
column21: • Initiative: Plans and acts for the long-term
column22: • Leadership: Positions self as the leader
column24:
• Self-Control: Stays composed and positive even under extreme pressure.


    • 6. CONTRACT

    Contract to be offered to the successful applicant (if non-seconded): Definite duration contract of three years
column25:
possibility of renewal for up to three years, during which the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite duration contract.

Contract clause applicable:

In accordance with the contract policy, this is a post in which turnover is desirable for political reasons in order to be able to accommodate the Organisation's need to carry out its tasks as mandated by the Nations in a changing environment, for example by maintaining the flexibility necessary to shape the Organisation's skills profile, and to ensure appropriate international diversity.

The maximum period of service foreseen in this post is 6 years. The successful applicant will be offered a 3-year definite duration contract, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years. However, according to the procedure described in the contract policy the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite contract during the period of renewal and no later than one year before the end of contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO’s member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject also to the agreement of the national authority concerned. 4285708226,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/bi-engineer-at-pauwels-consulting-4285708226?position=2&pageNum=5&refId=4QoBuU1dyiopyBOBdRknbA%3D%3D&trackingId=KPYaWMryjP5JRG7E8Bbx1Q%3D%3D,BI Engineer,Pauwels Consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Our client is looking to hire a Business Intelligence Engineer to join a specialized team developing a national-scale application to monitor and detect fraudulent companies. Building on an established proof of concept, the project now has a solid architecture, integrated data sources, and initial dashboards in place. The goal is to deliver actionable insights to end users while ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.
You’ll work closely with a data engineer, Python developer, and BI architect to deliver high-quality, user-friendly data solutions that empower non-technical users and other development teams.
Deliver relevant data from the data warehouse to end-user interfaces (Power BI dashboards, custom-built applications).
Collaborate with the team to define product requirements and maximize value for end users.
Build and improve reports and dashboards, including complex calculations and data structures.
Automate data delivery and refresh processes.
Ensure solutions are maintainable, structured, and adaptable for local configuration (templates, parameters).
Make data solutions intuitive for non-technical users.

Power BI – dashboard/report development and optimization.

dbt – data transformation in the warehouse.

Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable visualizations.
Experience in BI projects involving legal and compliance constraints is a plus

Our client is looking to hire a Business Intelligence Engineer to join a specialized team developing a national-scale application to monitor and detect fraudulent companies. Building on an established proof of concept, the project now has a solid architecture, integrated data sources, and initial dashboards in place. The goal is to deliver actionable insights to end users while ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.

You’ll work closely with a data engineer, Python developer, and BI architect to deliver high-quality, user-friendly data solutions that empower non-technical users and other development teams.

What You’ll Do

  • Deliver relevant data from the data warehouse to end-user interfaces (Power BI dashboards, custom-built applications).
  • Collaborate with the team to define product requirements and maximize value for end users.
  • Build and improve reports and dashboards, including complex calculations and data structures.
  • Automate data delivery and refresh processes.
  • Ensure solutions are maintainable, structured, and adaptable for local configuration (templates, parameters).
  • Make data solutions intuitive for non-technical users.
  • Use APIs to deliver data to applications or other teams.
  • Explore opportunities for new use cases with existing data sources.

What are we looking for?

Confirmed experience with:

  • Power BI – dashboard/report development and optimization.
  • Relational databases (Postgres) – querying, modeling, performance tuning.
  • APIs – integration and data delivery.
  • JavaScript (Vue.js preferred) – building or enhancing front-end applications.
  • dbt – data transformation in the warehouse.
  • GIT – version control and collaborative workflows.
  • Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable visualizations.
  • Experience in BI projects involving legal and compliance constraints is a plus

Langauges

English: Active working proficiency.

Dutch: Passive knowledge.

French: Passive knowledge.

What do we offer?

Location: Brussels (on-site)

Contract: Freelance or Perm
column2: Start: ASAP

4278987452,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/v-i-e-12months-jr-fp-a-controller-%E2%80%AFbrussels-h-f-at-danone-4278987452?position=3&pageNum=5&refId=4QoBuU1dyiopyBOBdRknbA%3D%3D&trackingId=5l52aG6flbJfZ2k0%2BYwjnA%3D%3D,V.I.E - 12months Jr. FP&A Controller -  Brussels _ H/F,Danone,"Brussels Region, Belgium","About The Job

Are you looking for a new opportunity in a fast moving & dynamic environment within a great company such as Danone? Do you get energized by finding the perfect next career step for our (future) colleagues?
Well, then you may just have found your dream job! Hungry to apply? Don’t hesitate and submit your application today so we can get in touch.

Are you at the beginning of your finance career? Would you like to kick it off within an international FMCG company with opportunities to grow further? Here is your chance! Join us as Operations Controller (V.I.E) in Belgium and learn a multicultural environment.

We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Financial Analyst to join our dynamic Finance operations team supporting the Plant-Based and First Diet categories. Based in Brussels, you will play a key role in supporting financial planning, analysis, and reporting activities, helping to drive operational efficiency and cost transparency across the factory.
Assist in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports
Support the budgeting and forecasting processes by gathering data, analyzing trends, and preparing financial models
Perform variance analysis between actuals, forecasts, and budgets, and provide insights to management
Collaborate with various departments to collect and validate financial data
Maintain and improve financial dashboards and reporting tools
Help ensure compliance with internal controls and financial policies
Participate in ad hoc financial analysis and projects as needed
To be able to achieve the above, you have a relevant master’s Degree (business management, finance or engineering).

You speak English and have good communication skills with the power to collaborate efficiently with all functions, at all levels both internally and externally. We believe our ideal candidate also needs to be rigorous, independent and autonomous, have an analytical and critical mindset.
Finance degree, Accounting, Economics, or a related field
0–3 years of experience in Accounting, FP&A, controlling, or financial analysis (internships or entry-level roles are acceptable)
Strong proficiency in Excel and familiarity with financial modeling
Experience with ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle) and BI tools (e.g., Power BI)
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team-oriented environment
Speaks English, French & Dutch is a plus
Are you eligible for a V.I.E?
V.I.E is a type of contract linked to Business France (French public organism) allowing Europeans to work internationally for a designated company. This is a 6 to 24 months contract.
You must be aged 18 to 28. You must have completed national service obligation.
You must be a citizen of the European Economic Area.
You must have never worked in the country in which you wish to do your V.I.E.
You have never done a V.I.E before.
What are the contractual advantages of the V.I.E ?
There are no taxes and charges on salary, as a V.I.E your social security is covered by April international.
You will be granted with 2,5 days off per month.
Your gratification is fixed according to the Business France grid.
The cost of your back-and-forth flight or train tickets is covered.

Danone’s mission is bringing health through food to as many people as possible and we want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world. We recognize the power people have to impact the world through their daily choices. Healthy food needs a healthy planet, and this is what our new signature One Planet One Health embodies.

In the heart of our dairy factory of Belgium (Rotselaar), you will work closely with diverse stakeholders, such as financial (operations, industrial and material controllers) and operations departments (activity, planning, master data and project managers) as well as other European countries (purchasing, marketing and transfer price controllers and EU Operation finance teams). This international environment is a great opportunity to start your career in finance.
But more importantly – growth opportunities for next steps in finance environment or towards a next role in other departments closely related to this function.

About The Job

This international environment is a great opportunity to start your career in finance.

But more importantly – growth opportunities for next steps in finance environment or towards a next role in other departments closely related to this function.

4279889026,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-business-analyst-at-semetis-4279889026?position=4&pageNum=5&refId=4QoBuU1dyiopyBOBdRknbA%3D%3D&trackingId=Vm7RJcPuLK%2BOeeDppmDjXA%3D%3D,Digital Business Analyst,Semetis,"St-Jans-Molenbeek, Brussels Region, Belgium","We are looking to recruit young graduates, willing to learn the ins and outs of the Digital Advertising World and use their analytical skills to grow and develop the Semetis clients' online businesses.
Are you ready to enter the Semetis Digital Business Program?

You will be working with more experienced colleagues, in direct relationship with our clients and partners. You will be contributing to Digital Advertising campaigns & Digital Business Intelligence activities, before being able to fully lead and manage projects.
Combine a strategic mind with a hands-on attitude
Plan, manage, optimize and analyze digital advertising campaigns on a variety of advertising platforms (Google, Facebook, LinkedIn, TikTok, Youtube, Spotify, Instagram, Snapchat, Waze …)
Provide business-minded recommendations and ensure that our clients are satisfied with their Return-On-Investment
Leverage your analytical skills to turn data into insights, and propose trendy features, projects and services to your clients
Collaborate with experienced Semetissians in the management of your clients
Advise clients on new market trends, services and any other digital opportunities
University degree (Master) in economics or business
Curious, data-driven, hungry to learn and love to challenge yourself
Entrepreneurial spirit: you take ownership of your projects, you learn from your wins and your failures
Team player attitude is a must-have
Native in Dutch and fluent in English
A continuous learning experience with a clear growth path
Become a real Swiss army knife in the Digital Marketing field
An attractive package with net allowances (frais forfaitaires and work from home indemnity) and extra advantages (hospitalization insurance, pension plan, etc.)
Freedom and responsibility to shape your own function and challenge ideas

An amazing office within a coworking community (Escaut) featuring a bar for after-work drinks, a ping-pong table, table football and darts. Our cozy seating areas with comfortable sofas provide you a great place to work together or unwind.

Connect with your colleagues during office lunches, afterworks, parties, mind-blowing team buildings or during our Annual Semetis Trip abroad. We also have an Impact Team organizing activities with social or ecological impact, or even wellbeing initiatives!
Hybrid way of working for a good work-life balance. We’d like to see you 3 times a week in the office, for the rest, we use Google Meet and chats!
Possibility to work from anywhere during summer
First months focused on digital advertising projects and learning the basics,
Continuous learning internally (self-learning & through colleagues) and externally,
Intensive training and development track with dedicated ‘bootcamps’,
Growth path towards client & project management, as well as digital business intelligence & digital strategy.
Our recruitment process is complete and fast. It usually takes 2-3 weeks.
Round 2: Case to solve at home
Round 3: Case presentation in our office
Round 4: Wrap up interview in our office
Congrats, you are a Semetissian now!

4283768092,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-laco-4283768092?position=5&pageNum=5&refId=4QoBuU1dyiopyBOBdRknbA%3D%3D&trackingId=5qiXu0B1RxaBtJsyOqUz7w%3D%3D,Data Analyst,LACO,"Brussels Region, Belgium","LACO is geen doorsnee IT-bedrijf. We zijn een Belgische pionier in Data & AI, al meer dan 35 jaar. Als trotse partner van zowel SAS als Microsoft (Data & AI Solutions Partner) en specialist in Data Governance bouwen we dagelijks mee aan de groei van data-gedreven organisaties.

Wat ons écht onderscheidt, zijn onze mensen. Bij LACO geloven we in mensen. In connectie. In de kracht van data. Met meer dan 120 consultants begeleiden we bedrijven uit zowel de publieke als private sector in het slim inzetten van data. We geloven in lange termijn relaties met klanten én collega’s en werken in een business domein dat de wind in de zeilen heeft.
Je wordt een sleutelfiguur in het realiseren van end-to-end data-oplossingen:
Je analyseert de businessbehoeften en vertaalt ze naar datagedreven oplossingen.
Je verzamelt, verwerkt en optimaliseert data uit verschillende bronnen.
Je bouwt visueel sterke en functionele dashboards in Power BI die bedrijven écht vooruithelpen.
Je werkt nauw samen met stakeholders en collega’s uit verschillende disciplines.
Je lost data-uitdagingen op en zet complexe datasets om in heldere inzichten.
Je blijft up-to-date met de nieuwste features binnen Power BI & Microsoft Fabric.
Je hebt een bachelor of master in (toegepaste) informatica of een gelijkaardig domein.
Minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of vergelijkbaar.
Je denkt analytisch, werkt oplossingsgericht en bent een teamspeler.
Je beheerst SQL, DAX en Power BI tot in de puntjes.
Je bent vertrouwd met datamodellering (Kimball, Dimensional Modeling, Data Vault).
Je weet hoe je complexe data omzet naar heldere visualisaties.
Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory of Databricks.
Comfortabel bent met verschillende soorten datastorage.
Zowel in het Nederlands als Engels vlot communiceert.
Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfswagen, …
Een persoonlijke opleidings- en groeitraject (met focus op certificeringen).
Flexibiliteit: of je nu als werknemer of freelancer werkt — wij staan open voor beide.
Uitdagende projecten in een moderne Microsoft-omgeving.
Een warme bedrijfscultuur waar ook ruimte is voor fun: skitrips, familiedagen, sportactiviteiten, spelavonden …
📩 Interesse of benieuwd naar meer info?
Solliciteer direct of stuur een berichtje – ook als je gewoon vrijblijvend wil kennismaken.

4264621777,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-3-month-internship-at-kfc-europe-4264621777?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=PJTV7rUdxjzJrQ9UOOh2qw%3D%3D,Data Analyst (3-month internship),KFC Europe,"Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland","Job Description
Support our Commercial Finance Lead in building our regional data & analytics capabilities
Enable common Western Europe product hierarchy and product mix analysis standardization (60%)
Map local product hierarchies to WEBU hierarchy
Enable pricing strategy across Western Europe (20%)
Analyze Items by price ranges & gaps vs competition
Enable Franchisee data sharing (Sales Growth, brand Metrics, Operations metrics 20%)
Test Franchisee user accesses / Test brand & ops metrics
Power BI knowledge is a plus
Ability to connect with cross functional teams

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin’ good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can’t share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We’re part of Yum! Brands, Inc.—collaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central & Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we’ve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original.

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow’s technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you’ve ever tasted. We exist to feed people’s potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact.
The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so.
Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we’re grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.

Job Description

Purpose of the position:

Support our Commercial Finance Lead in building our regional data &
column2:
analytics capabilities

  • Enable common Western Europe product hierarchy and product mix analysis standardization (60%)
  • Map local product hierarchies to WEBU hierarchy
  • Connect &
column3:
Align with Marketing
  • Enable pricing strategy across Western Europe (20%)
  • Competitor Set Mapping
  • Analyze Items by price ranges &
column4:
gaps vs competition
  • Enable Franchisee data sharing (Sales Growth, brand Metrics, Operations metrics 20%)

column5:
ops metrics

  • Power BI knowledge is a plus
  • English fluent mandatory

#PanEurope

About Us

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin’ good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can’t share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We’re part of Yum! Brands, Inc.—collaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central &
column6:
Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we’ve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original.

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow’s technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you’ve ever tasted. We exist to feed people’s potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact.

The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so.

Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we’re grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 9l5.93-4L15 6.54l-6.15 4.2a1.5 1.5 0 01-1.69 0L1 6.54 2.07 5z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.
Data Processing and ETL Development – Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
Analysis and Insights – Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
Collaboration – Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
Automation – Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
Documentation and Reporting – Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
Customer Support – Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.
Technical Proficiency – Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
Statistical and Analytical Skills – Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
Data Engineering Exposure – Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
GIS (Preferred but Not Required) – Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
Communication – Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem-Solving – Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.
Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Job Term: Full-Time

The Opportunity

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities

  • Data Processing and ETL Development – Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
  • Analysis and Insights – Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
  • Collaboration – Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
  • Automation – Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
  • Documentation and Reporting – Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
  • Customer Support – Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.



Skills and Abilities

  • Technical Proficiency – Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
  • Statistical and Analytical Skills – Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
  • Data Engineering Exposure – Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
  • GIS (Preferred but Not Required) – Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
  • Communication – Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Problem-Solving – Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.

Qualifications

  • Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
  • Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
  • Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
  • Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
  • Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

4234460316,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-h-f-at-rolex-4234460316?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=smQcqc%2ByBp0%2FBCEeO47yfg%3D%3D,Data analyst (H/F),ROLEX,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","Pour notre division Systèmes d'information, nous sommes à la recherche d'un Data Analyst (H/F), dont la mission principale au sein du groupe Data Analytics sera de modéliser, interpréter et valoriser les données dans un environnement technologique en pleine évolution. Il prendra en charge les développements et la maintenance des produits de reporting pour plusieurs domaines d’activités de Rolex et/ou Tudor. Il sera le principal interlocuteur de nos répondants métiers sur ce(s) domaine(s).
Analyser et interpréter les données pour en extraire des insights stratégiques et opérationnels, contribuant directement aux activités de Rolex et Tudor
Produire des sources de données et des visualisations avec des outils de premier plan tels que Tableau et Power BI, afin de faciliter la prise de décision
Optimiser ces produits pour garantir une expérience utilisateur conforme aux attentes
Participer activement à l'amélioration de la qualité des données et garantir la fiabilité des analyses
Contribuer à l'automatisation et à l'optimisation des processus analytiques, avec une compréhension approfondie des outils de transformation de données
Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes de data engineering pour garantir l'intégrité et la pertinence des données utilisées dans les analyses

Assister activement la communauté des Data Citizens dans l'élaboration de produits de données qualitatifs, réutilisables et innovants via des communications, accompagnements et formations des utilisateurs
Formation supérieure en informatique ou ingénierie EPF ou HES, avec une spécialisation en analyse de données
Expérience significative dans des postes de Data Engineer et/ou Data Analyst, acquise dans des environnements OnPrem et Cloud
Langue maternelle française avec une bonne maîtrise de l'anglais
Maîtrise de technologies telles que Snowflake, Dataiku, BW4Hana Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse ou Talend, pour optimiser le traitement et l'exploitation des données
Bonne maîtrise des outils de visualisation tels que Tableau et Power BI
Forte culture de l'automatisation, associée à un engagement envers la qualité des données et l'observabilité pour maintenir un contrôle rigoureux
Bonne connaissance des concepts de sécurité de l'information
Sens du relationnel et force de proposition
Haut degré d'autonomie dans la recherche de solutions, capacité à évaluer la qualité des livrables
Fortes compétences interpersonnelles et capacité à travailler efficacement en équipe
Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.
Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

Pour notre division Systèmes d'information, nous sommes à la recherche d'un Data Analyst (H/F), dont la mission principale au sein du groupe Data Analytics sera de modéliser, interpréter et valoriser les données dans un environnement technologique en pleine évolution. Il prendra en charge les développements et la maintenance des produits de reporting pour plusieurs domaines d’activités de Rolex et/ou Tudor. Il sera le principal interlocuteur de nos répondants métiers sur ce(s) domaine(s).

Responsabilités

  • Analyser et interpréter les données pour en extraire des insights stratégiques et opérationnels, contribuant directement aux activités de Rolex et Tudor
  • Produire des sources de données et des visualisations avec des outils de premier plan tels que Tableau et Power BI, afin de faciliter la prise de décision
  • Optimiser ces produits pour garantir une expérience utilisateur conforme aux attentes
  • Participer activement à l'amélioration de la qualité des données et garantir la fiabilité des analyses
  • Contribuer à l'automatisation et à l'optimisation des processus analytiques, avec une compréhension approfondie des outils de transformation de données
  • Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes de data engineering pour garantir l'intégrité et la pertinence des données utilisées dans les analyses
  • Assister activement la communauté des Data Citizens dans l'élaboration de produits de données qualitatifs, réutilisables et innovants via des communications, accompagnements et formations des utilisateurs

Profil

  • Formation supérieure en informatique ou ingénierie EPF ou HES, avec une spécialisation en analyse de données
  • Expérience significative dans des postes de Data Engineer et/ou Data Analyst, acquise dans des environnements OnPrem et Cloud
  • Langue maternelle française avec une bonne maîtrise de l'anglais
  • Maîtrise de technologies telles que Snowflake, Dataiku, BW4Hana Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse ou Talend, pour optimiser le traitement et l'exploitation des données
  • Bonne maîtrise des outils de visualisation tels que Tableau et Power BI
  • Forte culture de l'automatisation, associée à un engagement envers la qualité des données et l'observabilité pour maintenir un contrôle rigoureux
  • Bonne connaissance des concepts de sécurité de l'information
  • Sens du relationnel et force de proposition
  • Haut degré d'autonomie dans la recherche de solutions, capacité à évaluer la qualité des livrables
  • Fortes compétences interpersonnelles et capacité à travailler efficacement en équipe

Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).
