● Drive Data Equivalency: Design and execution of study migration checks to formally assess and ensure data and output equivalency between legacy platforms (HPC and MS Azure) and the novel data analysis environment (AWS based).

● Validation & Quality Assurance: Meticulously check data for completeness and correctness post-migration, troubleshooting and resolving any discrepancies to maintain the highest standards of data quality.
● Script Migration & Adaptation: Assist study team’s adaptation of existing Python scripts from legacy systems to the new AWS workspace, ensuring they are optimized for performance and reliability.

● User Onboarding & Support: Develop and deliver comprehensive onboarding materials, documentation, and training sessions to empower the team. Provide ongoing expert support to facilitate a smooth adoption of the new platform.
● Cloud Environment Management: Assist in the creation and configuration of cloud workspaces and analytical environments tailored to the needs of specific studies and analysis tasks.
● Independent Problem Solving: Proactively identify potential issues, bottlenecks, or risks in the migration process and independently develop and implement effective solutions.

● Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate closely with study stakeholders to align on migration priorities, provide progress updates, and ensure the new platform capabilities meet their research needs.

You are a detail-oriented and self-reliant individual with a strong sense of ownership. You thrive in a collaborative environment where your technical expertise can directly empower your peers and advance scientific goals. You are adept at working effectively in a hybrid and multi-cultural team environment.
● University degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Bioinformatics, or a related quantitative field.
● 3+ years of professional experience in a data analysis role, with a proven track record of working with sensor data.
● Demonstrated, hands-on experience in performing data equivalency analysis and system-to-system data migration projects.
● Strong proficiency in Python and its core data science libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, SciPy).
● Solid understanding of and practical experience with cloud computing environments, preferably AWS.
● Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently to troubleshoot complex technical and data-related issues.
● Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to explain complex concepts to a diverse audience.
● Experience with the R programming language.
● Familiarity with working in a regulated (e.g., GxP) environment and handling clinical study data.
● Experience in creating technical documentation, training materials, or user guides.

4274205626,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/intern-cocoa-sustainability-data-analyst-100%25-at-lindt-spr%C3%BCngli-4274205626?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=SrGxWWZCnAj0qQUwcWUcZg%3D%3D,Intern Cocoa Sustainability Data Analyst (100%),Lindt & Sprüngli,"Kilchberg, Zurich, Switzerland","You are passionate about data and sustainability, like project work and have good experience and knowledge working with big data sets, analytics, coding and statistics, but want to learn more about corporate sustainability and the world of cocoa? Then you may be interested in doing an one year internship at Lindt & Sprüngli in the Cocoa Sustainability Team.

Lindt & Sprüngli has been enchanting the world with chocolate for 180 years. The long-established Swiss company with its roots in Zurich is a global leader in the premium chocolate product sector. Lindt & Sprüngli produces quality chocolates today at its 12 factories in Europe and the USA. Its products are sold by 38 subsidiaries and branch offices in around 560 of its own stores as well as via a network of more than 100 independent distributors around the globe. In addition, Lindt & Sprüngli runs around 560 own shops. With around15,000 employees, the Lindt & Sprüngli Group reported sales of CHF 5.47 billion in 2024.

Our commitment to contributing to a more sustainable tomorrow is a key element driving the company’s actions and ambitions. For the responsible sourcing of its most important raw material cocoa, the company launched its own program in 2008: the Lindt & Sprüngli Farming Program.

Working at Lindt & Sprüngli headquarters offers flexible work set up with two days of home office per week. You will be working at our corporate offices in the beautiful Home of Chocolate building next to Lake Zurich in Kilchberg. You will have the opportunity to work in an enthusiastic small team and a welcoming work environment where you will be able to network and meet peers, including during our organized social events.

Reporting to the “Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning Lead” for Cocoa Sustainability and working together with a multi-disciplinary team of cocoa and sustainability experts, you will be a member of the Cocoa Sustainability Team at Lindt & Sprüngli's headquarters in Kilchberg. Amidst a changing regulatory environment, increasing sustainability requirements, and the need for data insights to guide decisions, you will have the opportunity to support sustainability work and gain experience at the heart of an internationally active, listed company and its premium chocolate brands. By supporting the dynamic cocoa team by analyzing monitoring and evaluation data from 7 cocoa sourcing regions to help steer decisions and by helping review carbon footprint data, you will gain hands-on and sought-after experience in the world of cocoa sustainability.
Maintain, quality check and further develop the Farming Program data bases
Support to review supplier reported raw datasets including geospatial data
Design and help roll out dashboards to display results for global Key Performance Indicators as well as thematic or origin specific KPIs
Run advanced statistical analysis on large data sets and present results for learning and continuous improvement purposes
Prepare forms and datasets for data collection
Compile and present reporting data for the annual sustainability statement
Support other external reporting tasks (benchmarking, surveys, membership reporting, etc)
Support to desktop review process for deforestation risk assessments
Support other tasks required by the cocoa team
Master’s degree graduate in science or engineering
Proficient knowledge and experience working with large datasets, advanced statistics, coding languages (python, R or similar) and creating dashboards (power BI)
Up to date knowledge of AI with experience of it’s application in data science
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Teams)
Experience with study design, data collection, analysis and presentation of results
Working knowledge of GIS and use of QGIS
Fluency in English required. Knowledge or additional languages of German or French a plus
First professional experience in corporate sustainability or related area preferred
An affinity for sustainability matters and desire to create positive change
Organized and ability to work independently, but as a strong team player
High standards of quality and organization

4275395130,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-%E2%80%93-bi-visualization-specialist-at-epam-systems-4275395130?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=IfSOA%2F%2BBhyDZHwMimhjt%2Bw%3D%3D,Data Analyst – BI & Visualization Specialist,EPAM Systems,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","EPAM is looking for a Data Analyst to support the data analytics team of a prestigious client in the luxury sector.
Based in our Geneva office in a hybrid setup, this is your chance to make a meaningful impact in a forward-thinking environment.
Would you like to be a part of this ambitious and innovative project? We look forward to receiving your application.
Develop data products across one or more business domains, in alignment with team objectives
Continuously enhance these products to ensure a seamless user experience and maintain data accuracy and consistency with source systems
Provide Level 3 support for these products
Define and validate data ingestion workflows for the company’s data warehouse and data lakes, ensuring reliability and alignment with business needs
Drive adoption of self-service BI tools by engaging the user community through effective communication, training sessions and ongoing support
Contribute to the design and upkeep of reporting solutions, with a strong focus on developing impactful data visualizations using Tableau
Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience with the Tableau suite, including Desktop, Server and Prep
Demonstrated advanced expertise in Tableau Desktop, particularly in environments integrating SAP BW and Snowflake as data sources
Excellent skills in data visualization, with a keen ability to translate complex data into clear, impactful insights
Strong knowledge of data modeling and data source development within BW data warehouses and/or Snowflake environments
Solid understanding of data processing techniques (extraction, transformation and loading), with hands-on experience using tools like Control-M and Dataiku
Strong interpersonal and time management skills, with the ability to effectively prioritize and deliver enhancements and new data products in a timely manner
Global business travel medical and accident insurance
Learning and development opportunities including in-house training and coaching, professional certifications, over 22,000 courses on LinkedIn Learning Solutions and much more
*All benefits and perks are subject to certain eligibility requirements
Please note that any offers will be subject to appropriate background checks
We do not accept CVs from recruiting or staffing agencies
For this position, we are able to consider applications from the following:
- Third-country nationals based in Switzerland with an appropriate work permit
- Displaced people from Ukraine who are currently in Switzerland and hold, or have already applied for, S permits

EPAM is looking for a Data Analyst to support the data analytics team of a prestigious client in the luxury sector.

Based in our Geneva office in a hybrid setup, this is your chance to make a meaningful impact in a forward-thinking environment.

Would you like to be a part of this ambitious and innovative project? We look forward to receiving your application.

Responsibilities


  • Develop data products across one or more business domains, in alignment with team objectives
  • Continuously enhance these products to ensure a seamless user experience and maintain data accuracy and consistency with source systems
  • Provide Level 3 support for these products
  • Define and validate data ingestion workflows for the company’s data warehouse and data lakes, ensuring reliability and alignment with business needs
  • Drive adoption of self-service BI tools by engaging the user community through effective communication, training sessions and ongoing support
  • Contribute to the design and upkeep of reporting solutions, with a strong focus on developing impactful data visualizations using Tableau


Requirements


  • Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience with the Tableau suite, including Desktop, Server and Prep
  • Demonstrated advanced expertise in Tableau Desktop, particularly in environments integrating SAP BW and Snowflake as data sources
  • Excellent skills in data visualization, with a keen ability to translate complex data into clear, impactful insights
  • Strong knowledge of data modeling and data source development within BW data warehouses and/or Snowflake environments
  • Solid understanding of data processing techniques (extraction, transformation and loading), with hands-on experience using tools like Control-M and Dataiku
  • Strong interpersonal and time management skills, with the ability to effectively prioritize and deliver enhancements and new data products in a timely manner
  • Fluent in French


We offer


  • 5 weeks of vacation
  • EPAM Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Extended pension plan
  • Daily sickness allowance insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Global business travel medical and accident insurance
  • Learning and development opportunities including in-house training and coaching, professional certifications, over 22,000 courses on LinkedIn Learning Solutions and much more
  • *All benefits and perks are subject to certain eligibility requirements
  • Please note that any offers will be subject to appropriate background checks
  • We do not accept CVs from recruiting or staffing agencies
  • For this position, we are able to consider applications from the following:
  • - Swiss nationals
  • - EU/EFTA nationals
  • - Third-country nationals based in Switzerland with an appropriate work permit
  • - Displaced people from Ukraine who are currently in Switzerland and hold, or have already applied for, S permits

4283021611,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-insights-analyst-intern-at-chanel-4283021611?position=7&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=UHilSHJw7rSbZFcSe%2ByIxA%3D%3D,Business insights analyst Intern,CHANEL,"Genève, Geneva, Switzerland","About Us:

CHANEL is a dynamic and innovative player in the travel retail industry, committed to delivering exceptional experiences for our global customers. As part of our continued growth, we are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Business Insights Analyst Intern to join our Global Travel Retail Team. This role presents an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our business through insightful data analysis and reporting.

As a Business Insights Analyst Intern with the Global Travel Retail Team at CHANEL, you will have a versatile role that contributes to both analytical tasks and the strategic communication of findings. You will be responsible for synthesizing business intelligence data, producing monthly reports, and providing actionable insights to drive strategic decision-making. You will play an important role in enhancing our existing data models, ensuring accuracy, and presenting information in a clear and concise manner. The ideal candidate is proficient in Excel and PowerPoint, possesses strong analytical skills, and is a collaborative team player.
Cultivate and maintain strong partnerships with travel retail data providers.
Ensure the integrity and reliability of data sources, fostering trust and transparency.
Review and validate data for accuracy, consistency, and completeness.
Diligently review data to extract meaningful insights and trends.
Act as a problem solver, proactively identifying areas for improvement and recommending data-driven changes to enhance CHANEL's global presence.
Stay abreast of industry trends and incorporate relevant insights into reports.
Communicate insights to our Travel Retail Teams, keeping CHANEL at the forefront of the industry.
Contribute to CHANEL's Monthly Reports, providing clarity and context to analyse data on the travel retail industry.
Curate industry articles to create monthly newsletter adapted to be shared with different teams.
Present information in a clear and concise manner with a keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity.
Utilize Excel, PowerPoint, and other tools to present data in a visually compelling and easy-to-understand format.
Ensure timely updates of the Power BI platform with the latest data for real-time insights.
Contribute to the improvement and expansion of existing data models.
Assist the Junior Business Intelligence Manager and the Strategic Projects & Insights Director in daily operations.
Work collaboratively with cross-functional team members to achieve common goals and objectives.
Work closely with CHANEL's Global Insight team to help to conduct surveys within airports worldwide.
Responsively address Ad hoc analysis requests and questions from CHANEL colleagues.
Ensure timely and accurate information is provided to guide decision-making.
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field. (e.g., Business Analytics, Marketing, Data Science).
Proven experience in data analysis or similar role, preferably in the travel retail and/or luxury industry.
Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI. Experience with Power Query is a plus.
Detail-oriented with the ability to simplify complex information.
Keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity, ensuring precision and visual harmony in all aspects of the role.
Proficient in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
An internship agreement is mandatory for this position and must meet the following conditions:
The internship must be part of your study program.
The internship must be required for the completion of your degree.
The internship must be validated by the award of academic credits.
Working days: 5 days a week, Monday to Friday
Join CHANEL's Global Travel Retail Team and contribute to shaping the future of travel retail through insightful data analysis and strategic collaboration !

About Us:

CHANEL is a dynamic and innovative player in the travel retail industry, committed to delivering exceptional experiences for our global customers. As part of our continued growth, we are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Business Insights Analyst Intern to join our Global Travel Retail Team. This role presents an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our business through insightful data analysis and reporting.

Position Overview:

As a Business Insights Analyst Intern with the Global Travel Retail Team at CHANEL, you will have a versatile role that contributes to both analytical tasks and the strategic communication of findings. You will be responsible for synthesizing business intelligence data, producing monthly reports, and providing actionable insights to drive strategic decision-making. You will play an important role in enhancing our existing data models, ensuring accuracy, and presenting information in a clear and concise manner. The ideal candidate is proficient in Excel and PowerPoint, possesses strong analytical skills, and is a collaborative team player.

Key Responsibilities:


  • Data Management and Relationship Building:
  • Cultivate and maintain strong partnerships with travel retail data providers.
  • Ensure the integrity and reliability of data sources, fostering trust and transparency.
  • Data Analysis and Recommendations:
  • Review and validate data for accuracy, consistency, and completeness.
  • Diligently review data to extract meaningful insights and trends.
  • Act as a problem solver, proactively identifying areas for improvement and recommending data-driven changes to enhance CHANEL's global presence.
  • Industry Insight and Trend Analysis:
  • Stay abreast of industry trends and incorporate relevant insights into reports.
  • Communicate insights to our Travel Retail Teams, keeping CHANEL at the forefront of the industry.
  • Reporting Excellence :
  • Contribute to CHANEL's Monthly Reports, providing clarity and context to analyse data on the travel retail industry.
  • Curate industry articles to create monthly newsletter adapted to be shared with different teams.
  • Present information in a clear and concise manner with a keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity.
  • Utilize Excel, PowerPoint, and other tools to present data in a visually compelling and easy-to-understand format.
  • Dashboard Maintenance:
  • Ensure timely updates of the Power BI platform with the latest data for real-time insights.
  • Contribute to the improvement and expansion of existing data models.
  • Support and Collaboration:
  • Assist the Junior Business Intelligence Manager and the Strategic Projects &
column2:
Insights Director in daily operations.
  • Work collaboratively with cross-functional team members to achieve common goals and objectives.
  • Work closely with CHANEL's Global Insight team to help to conduct surveys within airports worldwide.
  • Responsively address Ad hoc analysis requests and questions from CHANEL colleagues.
  • Ensure timely and accurate information is provided to guide decision-making.


    • Qualifications:


    • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field. (e.g., Business Analytics, Marketing, Data Science).
    • Proven experience in data analysis or similar role, preferably in the travel retail and/or luxury industry.
    • Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI. Experience with Power Query is a plus.
    • Strong communication and collaboration skills.
    • Detail-oriented with the ability to simplify complex information.
    • Keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity, ensuring precision and visual harmony in all aspects of the role.
    • Proficient in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
    • Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.


    Job Conditions:

    An internship agreement is mandatory for this position and must meet the following conditions:


    • The internship must be part of your study program.
    • The internship must be required for the completion of your degree.
    • The internship must be validated by the award of academic credits.


    Job Information:


    • Contract: Full-time internship (100%) and in-person
    • Start date: January 5, 2026
    • Duration: 6 months
    • Working days: 5 days a week, Monday to Friday
    • Location: Geneva


    Join CHANEL's Global Travel Retail Team and contribute to shaping the future of travel retail through insightful data analysis and strategic collaboration !

4268962395,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/sac-data-analyst-at-qim-info-4268962395?position=8&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=C2MK0tcmlGYGfKP9qLIhdA%3D%3D,Sac Data Analyst,Qim info,Geneva Metropolitan Area,"📣 Qim info ?
Qim info is an IT services company based in Switzerland for more than 15 years.

Our agencies in Geneva, Lausanne, Basel and Zurich in Switzerland as well as Annecy in France, together already counts 473 consultants and we are always looking for new talents to join our growing and ambitious company.
At the end of 2021, Qim info obtained the Happy at Work® label !
And ranks 3rd in the ICTJournal ranking in 2022.

We are looking for a Data Analytics & Data Management Specialist to design and optimize SAP Analytics Cloud and Datasphere solutions, enabling advanced reporting, planning, and data integration across business processes.
Design and customize analytics applications using SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) for both reporting and planning purposes.
Develop scalable and efficient data models and business layers in SAP Datasphere, integrating data from SAP and non-SAP sources.
Configure and maintain spaces, data flows, consumption models, and semantic views within Datasphere.
Ensure data models are optimized for performance, scalability, integrity, and availability.
Build and enhance interactive dashboards, analytical stories, and self-service visualizations in SAC.
Improve and stabilize existing SAC Planning implementations, including FTE planning, budgeting, data actions, and predictive functions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and integrate SAC and Datasphere into end-to-end business processes.
Provide Level 2 and Level 3 technical support and guidance to internal teams and stakeholders.
Bachelor’s degree in a scientific field with a focus on data analysis and architecture, or equivalent professional experience.
Strong expertise in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) and SAP Datasphere.
Solid experience in data management, ETL processes, and data warehousing.
In-depth knowledge of SAC Planning processes, especially FTE planning and budgeting.
Proficiency in JavaScript or similar scripting languages.
Familiarity with non-SAP BI tools is a plus.
Demonstrated autonomy, proactivity, and a hands-on approach with a strong focus on delivery and problem-solving.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and across hierarchical levels.
Languages: Fluent in French and English
column2: German is an asset.

column1: Willingness to travel between Geneva and Wangen by Dübendorf as needed.
Your first interview with one of our recruiters will be over the phone. The recruiter’s role is to understand your path and listen to your personal and professional aspirations.
Once you have been in contact with our teams, we will organise a technical evaluation of your expertise with one of our staff members.
An in-person interview with a Business Manager will then be organised to introduce you to the assignment or project we think would suit you best.
Finally, after any doubts are cleared up during the previous steps, the recruitment process ends with a hiring proposal.
🛠 Recognized IT expertise in the world of consulting with an activity focused around ten business sectors

We look forward to your application 😊

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>
Based in Fribourg, our client supports other business units by providing them with technical and logistical equipment essential to their activities.

As part of an organizational transformation, our client is looking to strengthen its team by recruiting a product data management and administrative support associate. This person will play a key role in processing and monitoring product information, in coordination with the technical and IT teams.
• Create, update, and maintain master data in the ERP (SAP), including items, inventory, suppliers, bills of materials, and locations.
• Oversee the quality, consistency, and integrity of data throughout its lifecycle.
• Collaborate with the Logistics, Maintenance, Production, and Plantation teams to ensure reliable information (locations, thresholds, reorder levels, units of measure, etc.).
• Identify and correct naming, translation, coding, and duplicate entries in the existing database (approximately 60,000 items).
• Participate in the redesign of the NIR (New Item Request) tool in collaboration with the IT and business teams, and in the definition of new procedures.
• Define and document data management procedures in accordance with internal rules.
• Define reporting and quality control tools (dashboards, audits, KPIs).
• Work in pairs to monitor item statuses (obsolete, non-renewable, etc.) and ensure business continuity.
• Provide support and coordination on data migration projects (SAGE), particularly during the mapping, cleaning, and inventory reliability phases.
• Actively participate in improving Supply Chain processes by providing a reliable database for planning, purchasing, and operational decisions.
• Train and raise awareness among internal users on best data management practices, particularly through the new NIR tool.
Education: Bachelor's degree in industrial management, data management, industrial IT, supply chain, CFC or equivalent training.
Experience: Minimum 3 years in an industrial environment with extensive exposure to inventory management and ERP issues.
Proficiency in ERP systems (SAP) and a good understanding of industrial processes are must-haves (procurement, production, maintenance).
Native French and English (C1 level required).
Knowledge of Power BI or other visualization tools is an asset
Commitment to quality and continuous improvement
Ability to work in a multidisciplinary team (production, logistics, IT).
Team spirit and a sense of teamwork.
Please send your CV and supporting documents in English.

About us:


Based in Fribourg, our client supports other business units by providing them with technical and logistical equipment essential to their activities.


As part of an organizational transformation, our client is looking to strengthen its team by recruiting a product data management and administrative support associate. This person will play a key role in processing and monitoring product information, in coordination with the technical and IT teams.


Your responsibilities:


• Create, update, and maintain master data in the ERP (SAP), including items, inventory, suppliers, bills of materials, and locations.

• Oversee the quality, consistency, and integrity of data throughout its lifecycle.

• Collaborate with the Logistics, Maintenance, Production, and Plantation teams to ensure reliable information (locations, thresholds, reorder levels, units of measure, etc.).

• Identify and correct naming, translation, coding, and duplicate entries in the existing database (approximately 60,000 items).

• Participate in the redesign of the NIR (New Item Request) tool in collaboration with the IT and business teams, and in the definition of new procedures.

• Define and document data management procedures in accordance with internal rules.

• Define reporting and quality control tools (dashboards, audits, KPIs).

• Work in pairs to monitor item statuses (obsolete, non-renewable, etc.) and ensure business continuity.

• Provide support and coordination on data migration projects (SAGE), particularly during the mapping, cleaning, and inventory reliability phases.

• Actively participate in improving Supply Chain processes by providing a reliable database for planning, purchasing, and operational decisions.

• Train and raise awareness among internal users on best data management practices, particularly through the new NIR tool.


Your Profile:


Education: Bachelor's degree in industrial management, data management, industrial IT, supply chain, CFC or equivalent training.

Experience: Minimum 3 years in an industrial environment with extensive exposure to inventory management and ERP issues.


Skills and Knowledge:

Proficiency in ERP systems (SAP) and a good understanding of industrial processes are must-haves (procurement, production, maintenance).

Database knowledge a must (SQL)

Advanced Excel

Native French and English (C1 level required).

Knowledge of Power BI or other visualization tools is an asset


Soft Skills:

Administrative rigor and analytical mind

Commitment to quality and continuous improvement

Ability to work in a multidisciplinary team (production, logistics, IT).

Initiative and autonomy

Team spirit and a sense of teamwork.

Strength and resilience


Please send your CV and supporting documents in English.

Phoenix Search has partnered with a renowned venture capital firm with a strong presence in technology-enabled industries such as e-commerce, fintech, mobility, gaming, and AI. With a global presence, they have a successful track record of 30 years in the industry. The firm is

markets, an analytical mindset, and thrive in a dynamic environment.

impact through your analytical skills, this could be the perfect

committed to driving innovation and growth through strategic investments and exceptional portfolio management.


The opportunity

We are seeking a Senior Analyst/Associate to enhance the Reporting &
column2:

markets, an analytical mindset, and thrive in a dynamic environment.

4273270995,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-insights-intern-m-f-x-d-6-months-100%25-at-swiss-re-4273270995?position=12&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=BWDr2kLxQchHdrdD4e92Dg%3D%3D,"Data & Insights Intern (m/f/x/d, 6 months, 100%)",Swiss Re,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Are you passionate about transforming complex financial data into meaningful insights? Join our dynamic Life & Health Reinsurance Finance team where you'll develop valuable skills in data analysis, financial reporting, and business intelligence while making a real impact on global business decisions!

As a Data & Insights Intern, you'll be at the heart of our data-driven decision-making process, providing crucial transparency into our global Life & Health business operations through sophisticated data analysis and visualization.
Analyze IFRS data and contribute to building robust data pipelines that transform raw information into actionable insights
Develop deep understanding of Life & Health business operations and IFRS reporting methodologies affecting income statements and balance sheets
Process and interpret performance measures and technical aspects of risk selection under IFRS reporting frameworks
Transform complex data from multiple sources into compelling visual narratives that support executive decision-making
Create standardized visualizations that effectively communicate key data stories and business messages to senior leadership
Collaborate cross-functionally with Regional Finance and Actuarial teams across multiple countries
The position is located in Zurich and the start date would be September 15, 2025.

Within Reinsurance Finance, our Data & Insights team is responsible for comprehensive financial data analysis and the continuous enhancement of information-sharing tools for Life & Health Reinsurance worldwide. We leverage our extensive data resources and company network to provide senior management with critical insights into business performance, guiding them toward accurate and impactful decisions. Our team serves as a CFO function for both the Head of Life & Health Products and the Head of Life & Health Business Management. We maintain close collaboration with pricing and actuarial teams globally to ensure the highest quality of financial information and insights.

You're an analytical thinker with a passion for translating numbers into meaningful stories. You thrive in collaborative environments and are eager to apply your technical skills to real-world business challenges. Your curiosity drives you to explore new technologies and methodologies that can enhance data processing and visualization.
We Are Looking For Candidates Who Meet These Requirements
Completed bachelor or master degree in statistics, economics, finance, business administration, or natural sciences
Strong analytical skills with the ability to critically evaluate numbers and draw relevant conclusions
Proficient in MS Excel and programming languages such as PySpark, Python, R, or similar tools
Basic understanding of financial statements, particularly IFRS17 principles
Excellent communication skills with fluency in written and spoken English
These Are Additional Nice To Haves
Experience with cloud technology for developing data pipelines
Knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques
Previous internship experience in finance, data analysis, or related fields
We are looking forward to your application, including CV and cover letter!
The base salary range for this position will be shared with you during the interview process.

Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. We cover both Property & Casualty and Life & Health. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.
If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

4280942598,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-h-f-at-manpower-switzerland-4280942598?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=pOuea%2FqrC%2B0WLrR5VL4kgw%3D%3D,Data Analyst H/F,Manpower Switzerland,"Genève, Geneva, Switzerland","Au sein de l'équipe spécialisée dans les ingrédients de parfumerie, vous serez le lien entre les équipes commerciales, réglementaires et opérationnelles, avec pour mission principale de gérer, mettre à jour et fiabiliser les données dans les systèmes.
Mettre à jour les informations produits dans les systèmes internes (SAP, MDM, etc.)
Assurer la qualité et la fiabilité des données (packaging, localisations, spécifications…)
Lancer des audits de données et participer aux nettoyages
Analyser les données, produire des synthèses et formuler des recommandations
Vérifier les informations issues de sources réglementaires, fournisseurs ou bases clients
Accompagner les équipes commerciales dans la création des listes de prix et documents de négociation
Suivre les évolutions réglementaires, achats, production ou toxicologie impactant le business
Coordonner la communication entre les différentes équipes
Rédiger et transmettre les communications internes et externes liées aux produits ou aux changements
Minimum 5 années d’expérience au sein d'un poste similaire, idéalement dans le secteur chimique à l'international
Excellente maîtrise de SAP et de Microsoft Excel
À l’aise avec les bases de données, les systèmes d'information et la communication inter-départements
Excellente organisation, gestion du temps et rigueur
Aisance relationnelle et sens de la communication

Job Requirements Si vous correspondez au profil recherché et que vous souhaitez rejoindre une équipe dynamique, veuillez soumettre votre dossier complet. Nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre candidature !Company description Pour un de nos clients, spécialisé dans le secteur de la chimie, nous recherchons un(e) Data Analyst pour une mission temporaire de 6 mois.

Au sein de l'équipe spécialisée dans les ingrédients de parfumerie, vous serez le lien entre les équipes commerciales, réglementaires et opérationnelles, avec pour mission principale de gérer, mettre à jour et fiabiliser les données dans les systèmes.

Vos missions
column2:
• Mettre à jour les informations produits dans les systèmes internes (SAP, MDM, etc.)

  • Assurer la qualité et la fiabilité des données (packaging, localisations, spécifications…)

  • Lancer des audits de données et participer aux
column3:
nettoyages

  • Analyser les données, produire des synthèses et formuler des recommandations

  • Vérifier les informations issues de sources réglementaires, fournisseurs ou bases clients

  • Accompagner les équipes commerciales dans la création des listes de prix et documents de négociation

  • Suivre les évolutions réglementaires, achats, production ou toxicologie impactant le business

  • Coordonner la communication entre les différentes équipes

  • Rédiger et transmettre les communications internes et externes liées aux produits ou aux changements

    • Votre profil
column4: • Minimum 5
column5: années&nbsp
column6:
d’expérience au sein d'un poste similaire, idéalement dans le secteur chimique à l'international

  • Excellente maîtrise de SAP et de Microsoft Excel

  • À l’aise avec les bases de données, les systèmes d'information et la communication inter-départements

  • Bilingue Anglais - Français

  • Excellente organisation, gestion du temps et rigueur

  • Aisance relationnelle et sens de la communication

4255232463,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/merchandising-data-analyst-at-kontoor-brands-inc-4255232463?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=AonAhRqGg2xpwk9PlaGf4Q%3D%3D,Merchandising Data Analyst,"Kontoor Brands, Inc.",Geneva Metropolitan Area,"Who We Are

Kontoor Brands, Inc. (KTB) is the parent company of Wrangler®, Lee® and Rock & Republic®, with owned manufacturing facilities in Mexico. Kontoor also owns and operates over 140 retail stores across the globe. Our global company employs more than 13,000 people in 65 countries, with world headquarters in Greensboro, North Carolina, and regional headquarters in Geneva and Hong Kong.

Join Kontoor Brands, home to iconic denim brands Wrangler® and Lee®. We design high-quality apparel that empowers self-expression. Be part of our global community of 17,000+ employees, fostering collaboration and innovation. Grow with us in our Geneva office and shape the future!

Reporting into the EMEA Merchandising Director, the Merchandising Data Analyst collects, processes, analyzes and interprets retail, wholesale and product data to support Merchandising decisions. The Analyst works closely with Merchandising and Planning Team to optimize product assortment, pricing strategies and buying decisions. The key responsibilities include generating reports, identifying trends and providing actionable insights.
Your Responsibilities As Our Merchandising Data Analyst
Collect data from multiple sources and combine it into consolidated reports that are easy to analyze.
Design and generate reports related to sell-through, total business performance, bestsellers, regional performance, and market trends.
Highlight any significant changes or deviations in performance and interpret potential impacts on product and retail strategy.
Work closely with product, retail, and merchandising teams to understand data needs, share insights, and provide recommendations for future strategies.
Track key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure merchandising and product strategies are on track.
Provide additional analysis and custom reports as requested by senior leadership or specific teams to help with decision-making.
A Bachelor’s degree and 3–5 years of experience in retail or merchandising analytics.
A strong understanding of product performance, retail dynamics, and merchandising strategy.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office, with solid experience in SQL, Power BI, or similar data tools.
Fluency in English, both written and verbal
column2: additional European languages are a plus.

column1: Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving ability, and a sharp eye for detail.
A collaborative mindset and the ability to communicate insights clearly and effectively.

We value trust, transparency, collaboration, and innovation, and focus on sustainability and teamwork. Our purpose, mission, and values guide us towards continuous growth and leveraging cutting-edge sustainable technologies.
Casual denim dress code at work and beyond
A multicultural, diverse, and inclusive workforce with employees from various nationalities
Employee resource groups focused on diversity, sustainability, wellbeing, and social activities
Opportunities for professional development and career growth
Advantages of being part of a global company
At Kontoor, we offer a comprehensive benefit package to fit your lifestyle. Our benefits are crafted with the same care as our products.

When our employees are healthy, secure, and well, they bring their best selves to work. Kontoor Brands supports you with a competitive benefits program that provides choice and flexibility to meet your and your family’s needs – now and in the future. We offer resources to support your physical, emotional, social, and financial wellbeing, plus benefits like discounts on our apparel. Kontoor Brands also provides four weeks of Paid Parental Leave to eligible employees who are new parents, Flexible Fridays, and Tuition Reimbursement.

We are proud to offer a workplace culture centered on equitable opportunities and a sense of belonging for all team members. Here we have a global workforce of high-performing teams that both unlocks our individual uniqueness and harnesses our collaborative talents.

Who We Are

Kontoor Brands, Inc. (KTB) is the parent company of Wrangler®, Lee® and Rock &
column2:
Republic®, with owned manufacturing facilities in Mexico. Kontoor also owns and operates over 140 retail stores across the globe. Our global company employs more than 13,000 people in 65 countries, with world headquarters in Greensboro, North Carolina, and regional headquarters in Geneva and Hong Kong.

Job Posting

Merchandising Data Analyst

Location: Geneva // Switzerland

Join Kontoor Brands, home to iconic denim brands Wrangler® and Lee®. We design high-quality apparel that empowers self-expression. Be part of our global community of 17,000+ employees, fostering collaboration and innovation. Grow with us in our Geneva office and shape the future!

What’s the scope?

Reporting into the EMEA Merchandising Director, the Merchandising Data Analyst collects, processes, analyzes and interprets retail, wholesale and product data to support Merchandising decisions. The Analyst works closely with Merchandising and Planning Team to optimize product assortment, pricing strategies and buying decisions. The key responsibilities include generating reports, identifying trends and providing actionable insights.

Your Responsibilities As Our Merchandising Data Analyst

  • Collect data from multiple sources and combine it into consolidated reports that are easy to analyze.
  • Design and generate reports related to sell-through, total business performance, bestsellers, regional performance, and market trends.
  • Highlight any significant changes or deviations in performance and interpret potential impacts on product and retail strategy.
  • Work closely with product, retail, and merchandising teams to understand data needs, share insights, and provide recommendations for future strategies.
  • Track key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure merchandising and product strategies are on track.
  • Provide additional analysis and custom reports as requested by senior leadership or specific teams to help with decision-making.

Skills For Success

  • A Bachelor’s degree and 3–5 years of experience in retail or merchandising analytics.
  • A strong understanding of product performance, retail dynamics, and merchandising strategy.
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Office, with solid experience in SQL, Power BI, or similar data tools.
  • Fluency in English, both written and verbal

additional European languages are a plus.
  • Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving ability, and a sharp eye for detail.

Analyst,Proclinical Staffing,"Basel, Basel, Switzerland","Analyst:in für operative Prozesse (80-100%) - Gesundheitsdienstleister

Ein innovatives Unternehmen im Gesundheitswesen sucht eine analytisch starke und kommunikationsfreudige Persönlichkeit zur Verstärkung des Teams im Bereich Operations & Partner Management. Die Position ist ab sofort oder nach Vereinbarung zu besetzen.
Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für die Betreuung und Weiterentwicklung eines Netzwerks externer medizinischer Fachpersonen.
Du gestaltest aktiv die Zusammenarbeit mit Partner:innen, führst Vertragsverhandlungen und entwickelst neue Kooperationsmodelle.
Du analysierst wirtschaftliche Kennzahlen und leitest daraus Optimierungspotenziale ab - z.?B. in Bezug auf Infrastruktur, Leistungen oder Abrechnungsmodelle.
Du arbeitest eng mit internen Abteilungen wie Finanzen, IT und Klinikmanagement zusammen und fungierst als zentrale Schnittstelle.
Du entwickelst Standards und Prozesse weiter und sorgst für deren transparente Dokumentation.
Du erstellst Reports und Dashboards auf Basis von Daten aus ERP-, CRM- und BI-Systemen.
Ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Betriebswirtschaft, Gesundheitsökonomie, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik oder einem vergleichbaren Bereich.
Erfahrung im Umgang mit komplexen Datenanalysen und sehr gute Excel-Kenntnisse (inkl. Pivot, Power Query
column2: VBA von Vorteil).

column1: Kenntnisse in der Nutzung von BI-Tools (z.?B. Power BI) sowie ERP- und CRM-Systemen.
Idealerweise erste Berührungspunkte mit medizinischen IT-Systemen und ein gutes Verständnis für Abläufe im Gesundheitswesen.
Kommunikationsstärke, Verhandlungsgeschick und ein lösungsorientierter Arbeitsstil.
Eine abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum und Eigenverantwortung.
Ein unterstützendes Team mit offener Feedbackkultur.
Ein zentral gelegener Arbeitsplatz mit guter Anbindung an den öffentlichen Verkehr.
Sollten Sie Fragen oder Schwierigkeiten bei der Bewerbung haben, wenden Sie sich bitte an Nur Ergiydiren unter der n.ergiydiren@proclinical.com.
Proclinical ist eine spezialisierte Personalberatung, die berufliche Chancen in der pharmazeutischen, biopharmazeutischen, biotechnologischen und medizintechnischen Branche anbietet.
Proclinical Staffing ist außerdem ein Arbeitgeber der Chancengleichheit.

Ein innovatives Unternehmen im Gesundheitswesen sucht eine analytisch starke und kommunikationsfreudige Persönlichkeit zur Verstärkung des Teams im Bereich Operations &
column2:
Partner Management. Die Position ist ab sofort oder nach Vereinbarung zu besetzen.

4282245649,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-analyst-at-nicoll-curtin-4282245649?position=17&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=TRS7oZ7hw8b87EDskFZjvw%3D%3D,Quantitative Analyst,Nicoll Curtin,"Zurich, Switzerland","Are you an experienced Model Validation Specialist?
Do you enjoy working on Independent Model Validation within Model Risk Management?
Then the role of Model Validation Specialist might be a good fit for you!
Our client, operating in the Financial Services industry, is looking for an expert to support them in the space of Independent Model Validation for regulatory compliance.
As a Model Validation Specialist, you will provide expertise in the domain of US withholding tax regulation (Section 871(m)), equity derivatives modelling, and quantitative analysis.

Setting: As part of the team, you will be focused on delivering the highest quality validation work, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards, and producing clear, well-structured validation reports.
Focus: Independent validation of a model developed to determine the US withholding tax status of financial equity-linked instruments in line with Section 871(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.

Background: To succeed in this role, you will need prior experience in withholding tax regulations (US), equity derivatives product knowledge (including Greeks), and strong quantitative modelling skills.
Duration: This is an initial contract from 25.08.2025 to 31.10.2025 with the possibility of extension.
For more information on this Model Validation Specialist opportunity or any other similar roles I am currently working on, please send your CV to:

Are you an experienced Model Validation Specialist?


Do you enjoy working on Independent Model Validation within Model Risk Management?


Then the role of Model Validation Specialist might be a good fit for you!


Our client, operating in the Financial Services industry, is looking for an expert to support them in the space of Independent Model Validation for regulatory compliance.


As a Model Validation Specialist, you will provide expertise in the domain of US withholding tax regulation (Section 871(m)), equity derivatives modelling, and quantitative analysis.


Setting: As part of the team, you will be focused on delivering the highest quality validation work, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards, and producing clear, well-structured validation reports.


Focus: Independent validation of a model developed to determine the US withholding tax status of financial equity-linked instruments in line with Section 871(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.


Background: To succeed in this role, you will need prior experience in withholding tax regulations (US), equity derivatives product knowledge (including Greeks), and strong quantitative modelling skills.


Duration: This is an initial contract from 25.08.2025 to 31.10.2025 with the possibility of extension.


Workload: 80%


Location: Zurich.


For more information on this Model Validation Specialist opportunity or any other similar roles I am currently working on, please send your CV to:


📧 vuk.susa-stupar@nicollcurtin.com


📞+41 43 508 26 71

4269632767,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-data-analyst-at-sii-group-switzerland-4269632767?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=U4jzaA3oSgzEfBAVtA3P5A%3D%3D,Data Scientist / Data Analyst,SII Group Switzerland,"Nyon, Vaud, Switzerland","Qui nous sommes

SII Group est un partenaire technologique de confiance, fournissant des solutions à forte valeur ajoutée pour les projets IT de nombreuses grandes entreprises. Depuis sa création en 1979, l’entreprise propose des solutions adaptées aux besoins de ses clients en s’appuyant sur :
> Son expertise reconnue dans divers secteurs et industries
> Des solutions « clés en main » éprouvées
Aujourd’hui, avec plus de 18 000 collaborateurs, le Groupe SII accompagne des entreprises dans 20 pays.

Chez SII Suisse, nous attachons une grande importance au bien-être personnel et professionnel de nos collaborateurs. Nous plaçons nos équipes au cœur de nos actions et de nos activités. Si vous êtes motivé par la perspective de rejoindre un grand groupe reconnu et de confiance, rencontrons-nous !
Pour développer notre offre de conseil et accompagner l’un de nos clients, nous recherchons un(e) Data Scientist / Data Analyst.
Concevoir et mettre à jour des tableaux de bord décisionnels adaptés aux besoins des différents utilisateurs (équipes soignantes, services administratifs, managers).
Faire évoluer et optimiser les tableaux existants en tenant compte des évolutions structurelles de l’hôpital.
Définir de manière autonome de nouveaux indicateurs clés (KPIs) et besoins analytiques.
Identifier proactivement les synergies entre les différentes sources de données et systèmes d’information.
Contribuer à la mise en place d’une infrastructure data en self-service pour les utilisateurs finaux.
Intégrer des technologies innovantes (intelligence artificielle, automatisation, agents intelligents) afin d’améliorer les processus.
Assurer une veille technologique active et proposer en continu des améliorations et évolutions.
Réaliser des tâches de maintenance régulières, y compris celles à faible valeur ajoutée, dans un souci constant de qualité de service.
Échange régulier avec les équipes métiers pour ajuster les livrables aux réalités terrain.
5 ans d’expérience minimum en Data Science / Data Analysis.
Maîtrise des outils de data visualisation (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Connaissances en gestion de bases de données, ETL, intégration de données multisource.
Maîtrise des outils statistiques, notamment R.
Expérience en data science (Python, modélisation prédictive, machine learning).
Capacité à gérer un système d’information et à configurer des sources de données.
Sensibilité aux enjeux d’interopérabilité des systèmes d'information hospitaliers.
Souplesse relationnelle pour collaborer avec des équipes sous forte pression.
Date de début : dès que possible

Qui nous sommes


SII Group est un partenaire technologique de confiance, fournissant des solutions à forte valeur ajoutée pour les projets IT de nombreuses grandes entreprises. Depuis sa création en 1979, l’entreprise propose des solutions adaptées aux besoins de ses clients en s’appuyant sur :


>
column2:
Son expertise reconnue dans divers secteurs et industries

>
column3:
Des solutions « clés en main » éprouvées

>
column4:
Un système qualité performant

>
column5:
Des services adaptables et évolutifs


Aujourd’hui, avec plus de 18 000 collaborateurs, le Groupe SII accompagne des entreprises dans 20 pays.

Chez SII Suisse, nous attachons une grande importance au bien-être personnel et professionnel de nos collaborateurs. Nous plaçons nos équipes au cœur de nos actions et de nos activités. Si vous êtes motivé par la perspective de rejoindre un grand groupe reconnu et de confiance, rencontrons-nous !

Pour développer notre offre de conseil et accompagner l’un de nos clients, nous recherchons un(e) Data Scientist / Data Analyst.



Missions


  • Concevoir et mettre à jour des tableaux de bord décisionnels adaptés aux besoins des différents utilisateurs (équipes soignantes, services administratifs, managers).
  • Faire évoluer et optimiser les tableaux existants en tenant compte des évolutions structurelles de l’hôpital.
  • Définir de manière autonome de nouveaux indicateurs clés (KPIs) et besoins analytiques.
  • Identifier proactivement les synergies entre les différentes sources de données et systèmes d’information.
  • Contribuer à la mise en place d’une infrastructure data en self-service pour les utilisateurs finaux.
  • Intégrer des technologies innovantes (intelligence artificielle, automatisation, agents intelligents) afin d’améliorer les processus.
  • Assurer une veille technologique active et proposer en continu des améliorations et évolutions.
  • Réaliser des tâches de maintenance régulières, y compris celles à faible valeur ajoutée, dans un souci constant de qualité de service.
  • Échange régulier avec les équipes métiers pour ajuster les livrables aux réalités terrain.



Profil


  • 5 ans d’expérience minimum en Data Science / Data Analysis.

  • Connaissances en gestion de bases de données, ETL, intégration de données multisource.
  • Maîtrise des outils statistiques, notamment R.
  • Expérience en data science (Python, modélisation prédictive, machine learning).
  • Capacité à gérer un système d’information et à configurer des sources de données.
  • Sensibilité aux enjeux d’interopérabilité des systèmes d'information hospitaliers.
  • Souplesse relationnelle pour collaborer avec des équipes sous forte pression.



Informations complémentaires


  • Date de début : dès que possible
  • Lieu : Nyon - Suisse
  • Durée : Long terme
  • Langue : Français et anglais
  • Nationalité européenne requise

4274327282,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/consultant-data-analysis-zurich-at-ey-4274327282?position=19&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=TALuVWI7g7OJ5BNUiSe%2BMA%3D%3D,Consultant Data Analysis - Zurich,EY,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders.
In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

The timely and relevant financial information provided by EY's Assurance teams is essential to global economic health and sustainable growth. Our work helps to restore and maintain public confidence in the world’s capital markets and ensure that the fundamentals are in place for businesses to move forward. Start your career in a practice rich in opportunity - the scale and scope of our clients’ businesses add to the wealth of experience that a career in Assurance EY offers you.

The ADD Team within Assurance practice supports the audit all over Switzerland in data extraction and transformation for further analytics in order to build trust and to ensure clarity, transparency in the Digital Audit of the future.

As a DID Consultant, you will collaborate with our EY clients, senior data analysts, and auditors to enable a data-driven approach. You will oversee the end-to-end data delivery process, from gathering client data to preparing the necessary data analytics solutions for audit procedures.
Support the creation and delivery of key analytical solutions for Assurance teams.
Work with a robust set of tools and infrastructure to cleanse, store, and manipulate data, following industry standards for data security and privacy.
Apply problem-solving skills to address unexpected technical or operational challenges, including communication with Assurance teams and clients across Switzerland.
Conduct business validation and QA testing of audit analytics content and solutions.

You will join a dynamic, international, and multicultural environment, benefiting from a structured learning path focused on data science, accounting, and auditing. In addition to formal training, you will receive intensive on-the-job learning and coaching.
To qualify for the role you must have
A Master degree (or equivalent) in Business Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.
Solid experience with SQL, Python, Alteryx, or similar tools used for data extraction, transformation, and manipulation.
Ability to work independently, manage pressure effectively, and meet deadlines.
Excellent oral and written communication skills

Do you have challenging plans? Stick to them and realize your goals with us! Design your career with EY in a culture that promotes diversity and education. In an environment that constantly opens new doors through knowledge sharing, flexibility and recognition. We offer you to join our highly motivated team.

You will be working and learning in a highly dynamic and cross-functional team - being able to boost your learning curve through the combination of intensive teamwork, challenging projects and being part of the network of one of the world’s leading professional services firms.
We are looking forward to receiving your application.
Take the next step and apply for this position online.

EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders.

In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

The timely and relevant financial information provided by EY's Assurance teams is essential to global economic health and sustainable growth. Our work helps to restore and maintain public confidence in the world’s capital markets and ensure that the fundamentals are in place for businesses to move forward. Start your career in a practice rich in opportunity - the scale and scope of our clients’ businesses add to the wealth of experience that a career in Assurance EY offers you.

The ADD Team within Assurance practice supports the audit all over Switzerland in data extraction and transformation for further analytics in order to build trust and to ensure clarity, transparency in the Digital Audit of the future.

As a DID Consultant, you will collaborate with our EY clients, senior data analysts, and auditors to enable a data-driven approach. You will oversee the end-to-end data delivery process, from gathering client data to preparing the necessary data analytics solutions for audit procedures.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Support the creation and delivery of key analytical solutions for Assurance teams.
  • Work with a robust set of tools and infrastructure to cleanse, store, and manipulate data, following industry standards for data security and privacy.
  • Apply problem-solving skills to address unexpected technical or operational challenges, including communication with Assurance teams and clients across Switzerland.
  • Conduct business validation and QA testing of audit analytics content and solutions.

You will join a dynamic, international, and multicultural environment, benefiting from a structured learning path focused on data science, accounting, and auditing. In addition to formal training, you will receive intensive on-the-job learning and coaching.

To qualify for the role you must have

  • A Master degree (or equivalent) in Business Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Solid experience with SQL, Python, Alteryx, or similar tools used for data extraction, transformation, and manipulation.
  • Ability to work independently, manage pressure effectively, and meet deadlines.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Proficiency in German and English.

More opportunities for your development

Do you have challenging plans? Stick to them and realize your goals with us! Design your career with EY in a culture that promotes diversity and education. In an environment that constantly opens new doors through knowledge sharing, flexibility and recognition. We offer you to join our highly motivated team.

You will be working and learning in a highly dynamic and cross-functional team - being able to boost your learning curve through the combination of intensive teamwork, challenging projects and being part of the network of one of the world’s leading professional services firms.

We are looking forward to receiving your application.

4268584291,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-sword-group-4268584291?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=OEbfw5o8uDx1bwU91iLQzg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Sword Group,"Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland","Nous ouvrons un poste de Data Analyst pour renforcer l’équipe de notre client basé à Lausanne.
Concevoir et développer des visualisations de données adaptées aux besoins des services utilisateurs, en cohérence avec l’environnement technique défini.
Collaborer activement au sein de l’équipe Données et participer aux réunions et rituels Agile.
Travailler en coordination avec les projets, l’architecture d’entreprise et les équipes d’intégration et d’infrastructure afin d’assurer la cohérence des solutions et leur fiabilité opérationnelle.
Garantir une modélisation efficace et pertinente des données exploitées.
Assurer la qualité des données collectées et veiller à leur documentation rigoureuse.
Maintenir un dialogue constant avec les utilisateurs et utilisatrices afin d’assurer une expérience utilisateur optimale.
Être moteur dans les propositions d’amélioration continue des processus et des outils.
Promouvoir les bonnes pratiques de datavisualisation au sein des équipes et accompagner leur adoption.
Diplôme en informatique d'une haute école (HES, université, EPF) ou titre jugé équivalent.
Expérience professionnelle d’au moins 3 ans dans la mise en œuvre de projets de visualisation de données.
Maîtrise avérée du mode de travail Agile dans le cadre de projets IT.
Bonne connaissance des outils de datavisualisation tels que Tableau et des outils SIG (comme Geoserver).
Compétences techniques en GitLab, VSCode, Docker, Python, DBT et autres ETL.
Connaissance des sources de données variées : Parquet (S3), PostgreSQL, DuckDB, ArangoDB, REST (OpenAPI), GraphQL, XML, Arrow, GeoJson, etc.
Expérience avec des outils d’ordonnancement comme Prefect.
Notions d’ITIL et de la méthodologie HERMES appréciées, ainsi qu'une expérience antérieure dans le secteur public.
💼 Formation continue : Un budget formation qui croit tous les mois à utiliser dans un large catalogue de formation
🏝 25 jours de congés payés : Tous nos employés ont droit à 25 jours de congés payés par an
🎉 Evènements réguliers : Des événements mensuels pour se retrouver en petit ou grand comité
🌍 Environnements internationaux : Des missions dans des groupes d'envergure internationale
🛠 Innovation : Contribuez à des projets impactants et innovants dans de nombreux secteurs d'activité
🎁 Des petits plaisirs : Nos employés bénéficient d'un programme d'avantages et remises très intéressantes

Nous ouvrons un poste de Data Analyst pour renforcer l’équipe de notre client basé à Lausanne.


Responsabilités du poste

  • Concevoir et développer des visualisations de données adaptées aux besoins des services utilisateurs, en cohérence avec l’environnement technique défini.

  • Collaborer activement au sein de l’équipe Données et participer aux réunions et rituels Agile.

  • Travailler en coordination avec les projets, l’architecture d’entreprise et les équipes d’intégration et d’infrastructure afin d’assurer la cohérence des solutions et leur fiabilité opérationnelle.

  • Garantir une modélisation efficace et pertinente des données exploitées.

  • Assurer la qualité des données collectées et veiller à leur documentation rigoureuse.

  • Maintenir un dialogue constant avec les utilisateurs et utilisatrices afin d’assurer une expérience utilisateur optimale.

  • Être moteur dans les propositions d’amélioration continue des processus et des outils.

  • Promouvoir les bonnes pratiques de datavisualisation au sein des équipes et accompagner leur adoption.

Prérequis

  • Diplôme en informatique d'une haute école (HES, université, EPF) ou titre jugé équivalent.

  • Expérience professionnelle d’au moins 3 ans dans la mise en œuvre de projets de visualisation de données.

  • Maîtrise avérée du mode de travail Agile dans le cadre de projets IT.

  • Bonne connaissance des outils de datavisualisation tels que Tableau et des outils SIG (comme Geoserver).

  • Compétences techniques en GitLab, VSCode, Docker, Python, DBT et autres ETL.

  • Connaissance des sources de données variées : Parquet (S3), PostgreSQL, DuckDB, ArangoDB, REST (OpenAPI), GraphQL, XML, Arrow, GeoJson, etc.

  • Expérience avec des outils d’ordonnancement comme Prefect.

  • Notions d’ITIL et de la méthodologie HERMES appréciées, ainsi qu'une expérience antérieure dans le secteur public.

Rejoindre Sword, c’est…
💼 Formation continue : Un budget formation qui croit tous les mois à utiliser dans un large catalogue de formation
🏝 25 jours de congés payés : Tous nos employés ont droit à 25 jours de congés payés par an
🚑 Une couverture assurance-accident internationale
🎉 Evènements réguliers : Des événements mensuels pour se retrouver en petit ou grand comité
🌍 Environnements internationaux : Des missions dans des groupes d'envergure internationale
🛠 Innovation : Contribuez à des projets impactants et innovants dans de nombreux secteurs d'activité
🎁 Des petits plaisirs : Nos employés bénéficient d'un programme d'avantages et remises très intéressantes

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Sika is expanding rapidly, and our data requirements are growing just as fast. To meet these needs, we are shaping a global strategy for how Sika manages and leverages analytical data, and we are building a state-of-the-art cloud-based data analytics platform.

Join our Central Data & Analytics Team as a Data Engineer in Zürich, where you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing innovative solutions for data engineering and analytics. In this position, you will directly influence the architecture and execution of our new global data analytics approach, helping to set the standard for how Sika utilizes data to drive business value.
What to expect in your first 6 Months
Get to know the existing data architecture, technology stack, and key data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others).
Deepen your understanding of our data mesh concept and its implementation.
Build relationships with our team, data domain specialists, and stakeholders.
Begin making initial platform improvements and laying the groundwork for scalable ETL/ELT pipelines
Design, build, and maintain production-grade ETL/ELT pipelines to load and transform data from enterprise systems (SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others) into structured formats.
Implement data transformation processes using tools like Azure Databricks, dbt and Azure Data Factory, ensuring alignment with business logic and analytics needs.
Establish automated data quality checks, consistency monitoring, and validation frameworks to ensure reliable data availability.
Collaborate with domain specialists to deliver data products for analytics and AI use cases.
Fine-tune pipelines and data models for performance (query optimization, partitioning) and cost-efficiency (autoscaling, storage tiering).
Develop reusable templates and documentation to enable domain teams to build their own ETL/ELT pipelines in alignment with global standards.
Contribute to strategic decisions about platform evolution, including evaluation of new tools and architectural patterns.
A degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, Data Science, or equivalent professional experience
column2: Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.

column1: Several years of experience in Data Engineering or relevant role.
Familiarity with domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
Experience with Azure services such as Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Storage Account, Key Vault.
Coding experience with languages such as SQL, Python, PySpark, dbt
Experience working with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub.
Experienced with DevOps principles such as CI/CD pipelines and release processes

column2: proficiency in additional languages is a plus.

column1: This position offers Hybrid working conditions and is subject to change at any time.
Candidate is required to work in the Zürich office 4 days per week with 1 day being remote.
This position does not offer Visa Sponsorship opportunities.
Friendly, personable and often surprisingly uncomplicated, that's how many of our employees describe their working relationships at Sika. We call this the Sika Spirit
We offer a fair employment package with good social benefits
We look forward to your direct online application.

Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

Sika is expanding rapidly, and our data requirements are growing just as fast. To meet these needs, we are shaping a global strategy for how Sika manages and leverages analytical data, and we are building a state-of-the-art cloud-based data analytics platform.

Join our Central Data &
column2:
Analytics Team as a Data Engineer in Zürich, where you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing innovative solutions for data engineering and analytics. In this position, you will directly influence the architecture and execution of our new global data analytics approach, helping to set the standard for how Sika utilizes data to drive business value.

Month 1-2

What to expect in your first 6 Months

  • Get to know the existing data architecture, technology stack, and key data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others).
  • Deepen your understanding of our data mesh concept and its implementation.
  • Build relationships with our team, data domain specialists, and stakeholders.
  • Begin making initial platform improvements and laying the groundwork for scalable ETL/ELT pipelines

Month 3-4

  • Design, build, and maintain production-grade ETL/ELT pipelines to load and transform data from enterprise systems (SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others) into structured formats.
  • Implement data transformation processes using tools like Azure Databricks, dbt and Azure Data Factory, ensuring alignment with business logic and analytics needs.
  • Establish automated data quality checks, consistency monitoring, and validation frameworks to ensure reliable data availability.

Month 5-onwards

  • Collaborate with domain specialists to deliver data products for analytics and AI use cases.
  • Fine-tune pipelines and data models for performance (query optimization, partitioning) and cost-efficiency (autoscaling, storage tiering).
  • Develop reusable templates and documentation to enable domain teams to build their own ETL/ELT pipelines in alignment with global standards.
  • Contribute to strategic decisions about platform evolution, including evaluation of new tools and architectural patterns.

Qualifications

  • A degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, Data Science, or equivalent professional experience
column3:
Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.
  • Several years of experience in Data Engineering or relevant role.
  • Familiarity with domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
  • Experience with Azure services such as Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Storage Account, Key Vault.
  • Coding experience with languages such as SQL, Python, PySpark, dbt
  • Experience working with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub.
  • Experienced with DevOps principles such as CI/CD pipelines and release processes
  • Fluency in English
column4:
proficiency in additional languages is a plus.

Additional Information
