Within 30 years, ALTEN has become leader in both outsourced Engineering and IT Enterprise Services. ALTEN, composed of 54,000 employees (88% engineers), carries out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of 6,500 clients, the most prestigious companies in all sectors of industry, services and telecommunications. We work with key actors in the Aeronautics & Space, Defense & Naval, Security, Automotive, Rail, Energy, Life Sciences, Finance, Retail, Telecommunications and Services sectors.

Since 2005, with 450 current employees, ALTEN Switzerland is a reference partner in providing Engineering services to 100 world leading companies. ALTEN Switzerland’s activities cover all the main strategical areas of the Swiss market in Life Sciences, Engineering & IT Services.

Join ALTEN Switzerland as a Palantir Specialist and take on the challenge of designing, configuring and managing advanced data solutions using Palantir Foundry for a key client in the financial sector.
Configure and maintain Palantir platforms to meet evolving business needs
Develop custom data models, dashboards and workflows for advanced analytics
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate requirements into effective solutions
Train and support end-users to maximize platform adoption and value.
Strong skills in data engineering and data analysis
Familiarity with AI and machine learning is preferred

column2: German language skills are a plus

column1: Background in engineering, computer science or related fields is preferred.
Location: Canton of Zurich (on-site with hybrid flexibility).

At ALTEN, you benefit from a permanent contract, access to cutting-edge projects with top-tier clients and opportunities for both national and international growth. We support your development with certified trainings in technical and soft skills.
Apply now and grow with us – we believe in building the future together!

column3:
Naval, Security, Automotive, Rail, Energy, Life Sciences, Finance, Retail, Telecommunications and Services sectors.


ALTEN Switzerland

Since 2005, with 450 current employees, ALTEN Switzerland is a reference partner in providing Engineering services to 100 world leading companies. ALTEN Switzerland’s activities cover all the main strategical areas of the Swiss market in Life Sciences, Engineering &
column4:
IT Services.


____________


Join ALTEN Switzerland as a Palantir Specialist and take on the challenge of designing, configuring and managing advanced data solutions using Palantir Foundry for a key client in the financial sector.


Key Responsibilities

  • Configure and maintain Palantir platforms to meet evolving business needs
column5: • Develop custom data models, dashboards and workflows for advanced analytics
column6: • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate requirements into effective solutions
column7:
• Train and support end-users to maximize platform adoption and value.


    • Your profile

    • Hands-on experience with Palantir Foundry
column8: • Strong skills in data engineering and data analysis
column9: • Familiarity with AI and machine learning is preferred
column10: • Fluent English is required
column11: German language skills are a plus
column12:
• Background in engineering, computer science or related fields is preferred.


    • Location: Canton of Zurich (on-site with hybrid flexibility).


    What we offer you

    At ALTEN, you benefit from a permanent contract, access to cutting-edge projects with top-tier clients and opportunities for both national and international growth. We support your development with certified trainings in technical and soft skills.


    Apply now and grow with us – we believe in building the future together!


    ___

    ALTEN Switzerland AG

    Hardturmstrasse 11

    8005 Zürich

    Tel. +41 (0) 79 103 45 63

4281490617,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/teamlead-bi-consulting-analytics-switzerland-at-hico-group-ag-4281490617?position=25&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=Cgxgu8%2B99%2BOz5yX6nLVVDw%3D%3D,Teamlead BI Consulting Analytics Switzerland,HICO Group AG,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Unternehmen aller Größen bauen erfolgreich auf HICOs Management- und IT-Beratung, um mit uns relevante BI-, Planungs- und Digitalisierungs-Herausforderungen effizient, modern und verlässlich zu lösen. Die HICO-Group verbindet die strategische Sicht und Verbindlichkeit eines Gründer-geführten Unternehmens mit der Dynamik eines Technologie-Start-Ups.
Werde bei uns Team-Leiter:in Analytics CH (100%) und übernehme Verantwortung für das Team Analytics CH sowie interessanter, anspruchsvoller Kunden-Projekte und -beziehungen.
Erkennst du dich in diesem Kurzprofil wieder?
Du hast eine Leidenschaft Berater-Teams mit technologischen Schwerpunkten in Qlik und Power BI motiviert zum Erfolg zu führen.
Du gehst Herausforderungen gemeinsam mit deiner Mannschaft kunden-, ziel- und teamorientiert an, wobei du dich erst mit einer sehr guten Lösung zufrieden gibst.
Du denkst in Systemen und verstehst Prozesse zu digitalisieren und zu leben.
Du bist eine gewinnende Persönlichkeit, verfügst über eine analytische Denkweise und bist gerne technologisch wie methodisch „up-to-date“.
Du arbeitest gerne in internationalen Teams – deine Kolleg:innen kommen aus DACH oder Südafrika.
…dann werde bei uns Team-Leiter:in Analytics CH und übernehme Verantwortung für interessante, anspruchsvolle Kunden-Projekte und -beziehungen.
3+ Jahre Erfahrung in Teamaufbau und -führung sowie im Umgang mit C-Level (intern/extern)
3+ Jahre Erfahrung entweder mit Qlik Sense / Cloud oder Power BI
Erfahrung in der Analyse von Prozessen bzw. Kundenanforderungen
Vorteilhafte Erfahrung: ERP-Systemen (SAP, MS Dynamics), Workflow- und Automatisierungssystemen, Reportingsystemen bzw. EPM/CPM-Werkzeugen
Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder vergleichbarem
Wirtschaftliche Verantwortung und Teamleitung für den Bereich BI Consulting Analytics CH
Enge Zusammenarbeit im Leiter-Team und internationalen Berater-Teams
Reiseaufkommen von ca. 1-2 Tagen pro Woche
Flache Hierarchien, kurze Entscheidungswege, langfristige Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Ein modernes und angenehmes Arbeitsumfeld mit kompetenten, aufgeschlossenen Teams

Dann möchten wir Dich gerne näher kennenlernen. Bitte sende uns deine kompletten Bewerbungsunterlagen unter Angabe des Gehaltswunsches sowie des frühestmöglichen Einstiegstermins zu. Für Rückfragen steht unser HR-Team gerne zur Verfügung.

Auch wenn du noch nicht alle Anforderungen erfüllst doch du kannst bei 70-80% ein „Check“ setzen, und du hast Bock mehr zu lernen, dann werden wir die nächsten Skills gemeinsam erreichen. Wir sind ein vielseitiges, diverses, multikulturelles und familiäres Team.
WIR FREUEN UNS AUF DEINE BEWERBUNG!

4281490712,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4281490712?position=26&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=oV%2BoN2RoshdcB7x0iqO0ng%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Geneva, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

  • In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
  • Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.



Qualification Path


No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.


Basic Requirements

  • Full Professional Proficiency in English &
column2:

Bist du ein erfahrener Data Engineer mit einer Leidenschaft für Daten und technische Innovation? Wir von Scigility unterstützen Unternehmen mit Strategie, Expertise und Umsetzung, eine datengetriebene Kultur zu etablieren. Dafür suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine:n Data Engineer, der moderne Data Solutions entwickelt und unsere Kunden in der digitalen Transformation begleitet. Bei Scigility setzen wir auf Zusammenarbeit und modernste Technologien. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen einzubringen und innovative Datenprodukte zu gestalten, dann werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams!

Möchtest du Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams sein, deine Ideen einbringen und Verantwortung übernehmen? Als Data Engineer entwickelst du skalierbare Datenpipelines, optimierst Datenarchitekturen und ermöglichst Kunden, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen.
Du bist für das Design, die Implementierung und Optimierung von Datenarchitekturen, Pipelines und Data Products zur Sicherstellung effizienter Analyse- und Transformationsprozesse zuständig.
Du wendest Ingestion Patterns und Best Practices in der Datenverarbeitung erfolgreich an.
Du verantwortest die technische Qualität, Implementierung und Optimierung von Testing-Strategien für Datenpipelines und -modelle.
Du bist zuständig für das Stakeholder-Management und die Kommunikation von Risiken, Herausforderungen und Lösungsansätzen.
Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungsanalyse und technischer Umsetzung zusammen.
Du schulst und befähigst unsere Kunden-Teams zur effektiven Nutzung der entwickelten Lösungen.
Du stellst eine umfassende Dokumentation und den Wissenstransfer innerhalb des Teams sicher.
Du leistest einen wertvollen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung unseres internen Frameworks und der Verbesserung der Projektstandards und Best Practices.
Was dich zur idealen Besetzung macht:
Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Software Engineer mit Fokus auf Datenverarbeitung
Kenntnisse in Big Data- und verteilten Systemen wie Spark, Kafka, Flink, und Trino
Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Optimierung von Datenpipelines (Batch und Streaming) mit Technologien wie Airflow, Meltano oder NiFi
Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, idealerweise in mehr als einer Plattform (Azure, AWS, GCP, Cloudera) und sowohl On-Prem- als auch Cloud-Umgebungen
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, Problemlösungskompetenz und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe
Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations-, Teamfähigkeiten und Stakeholder Management Skills
Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten
Sehr gute Deutsch- (C2) und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Französisch von Vorteil
Erfahrung in der Beratung und im Umgang mit Kundenprojekten
Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Governance, Compliance und regulatorischen Anforderungen
Erfahrung mit Container- und Orchestrierungstechnologien wie OpenShift, Kubernetes oder Docker
Software-Engineering-Hintergrund, Erfahrung mit weiteren Sprachen wie Java, Scala sind ein Plus
🚀 Bereit für die nächste Herausforderung? Werde Teil von Scigility und gestalte die Zukunft der Datenarchitektur mit uns!

Data Engineer

Zürich/Fribourg


Bist du ein erfahrener Data Engineer mit einer Leidenschaft für Daten und technische Innovation? Wir von Scigility unterstützen Unternehmen mit Strategie, Expertise und Umsetzung, eine datengetriebene Kultur zu etablieren. Dafür suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine:n Data Engineer, der moderne Data Solutions entwickelt und unsere Kunden in der digitalen Transformation begleitet. Bei Scigility setzen wir auf Zusammenarbeit und modernste Technologien. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen einzubringen und innovative Datenprodukte zu gestalten, dann werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams!



So schaffst du Mehrwert

Möchtest du Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams sein, deine Ideen einbringen und Verantwortung übernehmen? Als Data Engineer entwickelst du skalierbare Datenpipelines, optimierst Datenarchitekturen und ermöglichst Kunden, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen.


Deine Hauptaufgaben:

  • Du bist für das Design, die Implementierung und Optimierung von Datenarchitekturen, Pipelines und Data Products zur Sicherstellung effizienter Analyse- und Transformationsprozesse zuständig.
  • Du wendest Ingestion Patterns und Best Practices in der Datenverarbeitung erfolgreich an.
  • Du verantwortest die technische Qualität, Implementierung und Optimierung von Testing-Strategien für Datenpipelines und -modelle.
  • Du bist zuständig für das Stakeholder-Management und die Kommunikation von Risiken, Herausforderungen und Lösungsansätzen.
  • Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungsanalyse und technischer Umsetzung zusammen.
  • Du schulst und befähigst unsere Kunden-Teams zur effektiven Nutzung der entwickelten Lösungen.
  • Du stellst eine umfassende Dokumentation und den Wissenstransfer innerhalb des Teams sicher.
  • Du leistest einen wertvollen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung unseres internen Frameworks und der Verbesserung der Projektstandards und Best Practices.


Was dich zur idealen Besetzung macht:

  • Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
  • Mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Software Engineer mit Fokus auf Datenverarbeitung
  • Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python
  • Kenntnisse in Big Data- und verteilten Systemen wie Spark, Kafka, Flink, und Trino
  • Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Optimierung von Datenpipelines (Batch und Streaming) mit Technologien wie Airflow, Meltano oder NiFi
  • Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, idealerweise in mehr als einer Plattform (Azure, AWS, GCP, Cloudera) und sowohl On-Prem- als auch Cloud-Umgebungen
  • Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, Problemlösungskompetenz und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe
  • Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations-, Teamfähigkeiten und Stakeholder Management Skills
  • Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- (C2) und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Französisch von Vorteil



Optionale Superkräfte:

  • Erfahrung in der Beratung und im Umgang mit Kundenprojekten
  • Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Governance, Compliance und regulatorischen Anforderungen
  • Erfahrung mit Container- und Orchestrierungstechnologien wie OpenShift, Kubernetes oder Docker
  • Software-Engineering-Hintergrund, Erfahrung mit weiteren Sprachen wie Java, Scala sind ein Plus


🚀 Bereit für die nächste Herausforderung? Werde Teil von Scigility und gestalte die Zukunft der Datenarchitektur mit uns!

4269393519,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-consultant-artificial-intelligence-data-data-management-data-platforms-focus-at-deloitte-4269393519?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=MkOL1hq4g1IBEcX3PZftkA%3D%3D,Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus),Deloitte,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Job Description
Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.
For this role, we are currently offering start dates from August 2025.
How You Can Make An Impact
Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.

Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.
Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.
Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.

column2: fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.

column1: First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .
We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.
If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch

We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria

column2: Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science &amp
column3:
AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

For this role, we are currently offering start dates from August 2025.

How You Can Make An Impact

  • Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
  • Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.
  • Design complex data &
column4:
analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.

column5:
AI use cases from business value concept to production

  • Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.

column6:

4281488024,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4281488024?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=9PVrVgmYBs9Vu%2FHgP1UHEw%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Lugano, Ticino, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4283963382,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/intern-applied-data-science-machine-learning-80-100%25-9-12-months-at-swissgrid-ag-4283963382?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=2a4DZZAvDWXMubi%2BCpWBsA%3D%3D,Intern Applied Data Science & Machine Learning (80-100%) - 9-12 Months,Swissgrid AG,"Aarau, Aargau, Switzerland","Electricity flows with us. On behalf of Switzerland and in cooperation with international partners, we do our utmost every day to develop the best solutions for the Swiss electricity grid.

Are you passionate about solving real-world problems with data and innovation? Curious about how data science powers the energy transition? Join our forward-thinking and collaborative Development & Optimization team as an intern, where your work will have a tangible impact on shaping the future of electrical grid operations.
Intern Applied Data Science & Machine Learning (80-100%) - 9-12 Months - 1389
Participate in the power supply in Switzerland

You’ll dive into challenging and meaningful data science projects in a dynamic, cross-functional environment. You’ll work with cutting-edge cloud technologies and a modern tech stack, experience agile teamwork, and gain hands-on exposure to Switzerland’s transmission system operation – all while learning from and contributing to an interdisciplinary, supportive, and passionate team.
Get ready to roll up your sleeves and explore challenges like:
Building forecasting models that solve real-world problems in the energy sector with a focus on scalability, robustness, and real-world application.
Building data pipelines that efficiently handle large-scale, time-series data to support reliable and scalable model development and deployment.
Exploring and analyzing data to uncover valuable insights, engineer suitable features, and improve forecasting accuracy.
Experimenting with different techniques to optimize performance - from hyperparameter tuning to innovative algorithmic approaches.
Implementing your models into Swissgrid’s important operational workflows, ensuring they run reliably, securely, and efficiently at scale.
Monitoring the deployed models to track performance and handle model drift.
Documenting your work clearly and consistently so others can understand, track, and build on your progress - because great science is shared science.
Collaborating across teams, engaging with stakeholders for feedback, alignment, and continuous improvement, and ensuring your work ties directly into broader business needs.
This Is How You Make The Difference
We are looking for someone who has a strong analytical mindset to develop innovative data science solutions - not someone who checks every box. But here’s what will help you thrive:
You are studying (or recently finished) a Master’s or PhD in a relevant field like Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, or similar.

You have strong Python skills and have hands-on experience with MLOps tools (Scikit-learn, PyTorch, MLflow), Apache Spark, and data analytics and infrastructure platforms such as Databricks and Azure.
You are familiar with time-series data analysis and predictive models.
You have a solid knowledge of Git and GitHub, such as resolving merge conflicts, and collaborating via pull requests.
Knowledge of transmission grid operations and electricity market is a plus.

Above all, we value curiosity, a strong drive to learn, and a problem-solving mindset over prior experience and educational background. If you're eager to tackle complex data science challenges and grow in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply – even if you don’t meet every requirement. 🚀
A comprehensive look behind the scenes of the electricity industry and an understanding of its challenges, as well as in-depth insights into the development of the grid of the future
Varied and exciting tasks within a company unique to SwitzerlandFlexible working hours as part of a motivated team
25–30 days of holiday, as well as company holiday between Christmas and New Year
A state-of-the-art work environment in the immediate vicinity of Aarau railway station
After completion of the internship, opportunities for continuing to work for the company can be discussed if desired

Swissgrid is revolutionizing the energy sector through cutting-edge automation and machine learning solutions. Our team Development & Optimization serves as the critical bridge between backoffice functions and real-time system operations, developing innovative forecast models and automation tools that directly support grid operators in their 24/7 mission. Additionally, our team is responsible for the development and operation of the Swiss ancillary services platform, which is essential for maintaining grid stability.

Electricity flows with us. On behalf of Switzerland and in cooperation with international partners, we do our utmost every day to develop the best solutions for the Swiss electricity grid.

Are you passionate about solving real-world problems with data and innovation? Curious about how data science powers the energy transition? Join our forward-thinking and collaborative Development &
column2:
Optimization team as an intern, where your work will have a tangible impact on shaping the future of electrical grid operations.

Intern Applied Data Science &
column3:
Machine Learning (80-100%) - 9-12 Months - 1389

Participate in the power supply in Switzerland

You’ll dive into challenging and meaningful data science projects in a dynamic, cross-functional environment. You’ll work with cutting-edge cloud technologies and a modern tech stack, experience agile teamwork, and gain hands-on exposure to Switzerland’s transmission system operation – all while learning from and contributing to an interdisciplinary, supportive, and passionate team.

Get ready to roll up your sleeves and explore challenges like:

  • Building forecasting models that solve real-world problems in the energy sector with a focus on scalability, robustness, and real-world application.
  • Building data pipelines that efficiently handle large-scale, time-series data to support reliable and scalable model development and deployment.
  • Exploring and analyzing data to uncover valuable insights, engineer suitable features, and improve forecasting accuracy.
  • Experimenting with different techniques to optimize performance - from hyperparameter tuning to innovative algorithmic approaches.
  • Implementing your models into Swissgrid’s important operational workflows, ensuring they run reliably, securely, and efficiently at scale.
  • Monitoring the deployed models to track performance and handle model drift. 
  • Documenting your work clearly and consistently so others can understand, track, and build on your progress - because great science is shared science.
  • Collaborating across teams, engaging with stakeholders for feedback, alignment, and continuous improvement, and ensuring your work ties directly into broader business needs.

This Is How You Make The Difference 

We are looking for someone who has a strong analytical mindset to develop innovative data science solutions - not someone who checks every box. But here’s what will help you thrive:

  • You are studying (or recently finished) a Master’s or PhD in a relevant field like Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, or similar.
  • You have strong Python skills and have hands-on experience with MLOps tools (Scikit-learn, PyTorch, MLflow), Apache Spark, and data analytics and infrastructure platforms such as Databricks and Azure.
  • You are familiar with time-series data analysis and predictive models. 
  • You have a solid knowledge of Git and GitHub, such as resolving merge conflicts, and collaborating via pull requests.
  • Knowledge of transmission grid operations and electricity market is a plus.
  • You communicate fluently in English.

Above all, we value curiosity, a strong drive to learn, and a problem-solving mindset over prior experience and educational background. If you're eager to tackle complex data science challenges and grow in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply – even if you don’t meet every requirement. 🚀

What We Offer

  • A comprehensive look behind the scenes of the electricity industry and an understanding of its challenges, as well as in-depth insights into the development of the grid of the future
  • Varied and exciting tasks within a company unique to SwitzerlandFlexible working hours as part of a motivated team
  • 25–30 days of holiday, as well as company holiday between Christmas and New Year
  • A state-of-the-art work environment in the immediate vicinity of Aarau railway station
  • After completion of the internship, opportunities for continuing to work for the company can be discussed if desired

About Us

Swissgrid is revolutionizing the energy sector through cutting-edge automation and machine learning solutions. Our team Development &

4283348640,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-database-engineer-intern-at-m365connect-4283348640?position=34&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=R8c%2FDZi8IF4IVDXt7AUKTA%3D%3D,Junior Database Engineer Intern,M365Connect,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Company Overview

Join our team as a Junior Database Engineer Intern and gain hands-on experience with modern database design, PostgreSQL administration, and enterprise data synchronization. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to learn professional database management while working on a real-world recruitment platform integration.

As a Junior Database Engineer Intern, you will assist in maintaining and improving our Manatal database synchronization system. You'll work closely with senior engineers to learn best practices in database design, performance optimization, and professional documentation.
Assist in monitoring database performance and creating performance reports
Learn PostgreSQL database administration and optimization techniques
Help document database schemas and relationships using professional ERD tools
Support data validation and quality assurance processes
Assist in writing SQL queries for reporting and analysis
Learn Docker basics and container management
Contribute to technical documentation and data dictionaries
Explore modern database platforms like Supabase
Participate in database design reviews and team meetings
Currently pursuing or recently completed degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field
Strong academic performance in database or data structures courses
Understanding of relational database concepts and SQL basics
Familiarity with at least one programming language (Python, JavaScript, or similar)
Basic understanding of data structures and algorithms
Good written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently and in a team
Previous internship or project experience with databases
Familiarity with PostgreSQL or other SQL databases
Experience with any ERD or database design tools
Basic knowledge of Docker or containerization
Familiarity with modern database platforms (Supabase, PlanetScale, etc.)
Professional ERD tools and documentation standards
PostgreSQL advanced features and performance tuning
Modern database platforms and cloud services
Duration: 3-6 months (with possibility of extension or full-time conversion)
Certificate of completion and recommendation letter for successful interns

Company Overview

Join our team as a Junior Database Engineer Intern and gain hands-on experience with modern database design, PostgreSQL administration, and enterprise data synchronization. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to learn professional database management while working on a real-world recruitment platform integration.

Position Summary

As a Junior Database Engineer Intern, you will assist in maintaining and improving our Manatal database synchronization system. You'll work closely with senior engineers to learn best practices in database design, performance optimization, and professional documentation.

Learning Opportunities &
column2:
Responsibilities

  • Assist in monitoring database performance and creating performance reports
  • Learn PostgreSQL database administration and optimization techniques
  • Help document database schemas and relationships using professional ERD tools
  • Support data validation and quality assurance processes
  • Participate in troubleshooting data inconsistencies
  • Assist in writing SQL queries for reporting and analysis
  • Learn Docker basics and container management
  • Contribute to technical documentation and data dictionaries
  • Explore modern database platforms like Supabase
  • Participate in database design reviews and team meetings


Required Basic Skills

  • Educational Background:
    • Currently pursuing or recently completed degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field
    • Strong academic performance in database or data structures courses
  • Technical Foundation:
    • Understanding of relational database concepts and SQL basics
    • Familiarity with at least one programming language (Python, JavaScript, or similar)
    • Basic understanding of data structures and algorithms
    • Comfortable with command-line interfaces
    • Strong analytical mindset
  • Soft Skills:
    • Excellent attention to detail
    • Strong problem-solving abilities
    • Good written and verbal communication skills
    • Ability to work independently and in a team
    • Eagerness to learn new technologies


Good to Have Skills

  • Previous internship or project experience with databases
  • Familiarity with PostgreSQL or other SQL databases
  • Experience with any ERD or database design tools
  • Basic knowledge of Docker or containerization
  • Understanding of JSON data format
  • Exposure to Linux/Unix environments
  • GitHub experience for version control
  • Familiarity with modern database platforms (Supabase, PlanetScale, etc.)
  • Basic understanding of API concepts


What You'll Learn

  • Enterprise-level database design and optimization
  • Professional ERD tools and documentation standards
  • PostgreSQL advanced features and performance tuning
  • Modern database platforms and cloud services
  • Docker and containerization for databases
  • Real-world data synchronization challenges
  • Professional development practices


Internship Details

  • Duration: 3-6 months (with possibility of extension or full-time conversion)
  • Flexible hours (minimum 20 hours/week)
  • Remote work available
  • Mentorship from senior database engineers
  • Hands-on experience with production systems
  • Certificate of completion and recommendation letter for successful interns

4281489755,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4281489755?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=6HVNjNw1AQ9Uwbf4qwYy3w%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

  • Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

  • Full Professional Proficiency in English &

4282205366,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-prime21-ag-4282205366?position=37&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=cCTsUbdtdQprgw5Lhd4acw%3D%3D,Data Engineer,Prime21 AG,"Lucerne, Switzerland","Du möchtest die Zukunft einer Datenplattform aktiv mitgestalten und unseren Kunden auf dem Weg zum datengetriebenen Erfolg begleiten? Als Data Engineer bringst du dein Know-how ein, entwickelst moderne Data Solutions mit den neuesten Technologien und machst den Unterschied, von der Konzeption bis zum stabilen Betrieb. Dich erwartet ein innovatives Umfeld, viel Raum für eigene Ideen, flexible Arbeitsmodelle und ein Team, das Data Engineering wirklich lebt.
Du entwickelst und erweiterst eine moderne Data Platform, implementierst neue Features und stellst die Code-Qualität sicher.
Modellierung von Daten nach gängigen Frameworks (z. B. Data Vault) und Entwicklung von dbt-Modellen auf Basis moderner Cloud-Technologien wie Azure Databricks.
Du verantwortest den gesamten Entwicklungsprozess – von der Anforderungsanalyse über die Konzeption bis hin zur Integration, Validierung und Auslieferung der Lösungen.
Dabei behältst du die Aspekte Datensicherheit und IT-Governance stets im Blick.
Du sicherst den Betrieb der Data Platform, überwachst Datenpipelines und reagierst proaktiv auf Störungen.
Supportanfragen und Optimierungen gehören ebenfalls zu deinem Verantwortungsbereich, um die Plattform kontinuierlich zu verbessern.
Du unterstützt Kolleginnen und Kollegen bei technischen Fragestellungen, teilst dein Wissen im Team und hilfst mit, Standards zu etablieren.
Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung.
Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Bereich Data Engineering oder in einer ähnlichen Funktion.
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL und Python sowie Erfahrung in der Datenmodellierung (z. B. mit Data Vault) und der Arbeit mit Databricks oder ähnlichen Cloud-Data-Plattformen.
Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und im Betrieb moderner Data Products sowie Kenntnisse zu Cloud-Technologien und Automatisierungen.
Eine analytische und strukturierte Arbeitsweise, Eigenverantwortung und ein Gespür für Trends im Bereich Data Engineering.
Freude an Teamarbeit und daran, gemeinsam mit funktionsübergreifenden Teams Lösungen zu entwickeln.
Flexible Arbeitsmodelle: Teilzeitoptionen, Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten und eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance.
Attraktive Rahmenbedingungen: Leistungsorientierte Vergütung, spannende Benefits und finanzielle Zusatzleistungen.
Gestaltungsspielraum: Bringe deine Ideen ein und arbeite mit den neuesten Technologien in einem modernen Umfeld.
Weiterentwicklung: Unterstützung bei interner und externer Weiterbildung – mit Zeit und Budget.
Teamkultur: Offene Kommunikation, Wertschätzung und regelmässige Team-Events.

Du möchtest die Zukunft einer Datenplattform aktiv mitgestalten und unseren Kunden auf dem Weg zum datengetriebenen Erfolg begleiten? Als Data Engineer bringst du dein Know-how ein, entwickelst moderne Data Solutions mit den neuesten Technologien und machst den Unterschied, von der Konzeption bis zum stabilen Betrieb. Dich erwartet ein innovatives Umfeld, viel Raum für eigene Ideen, flexible Arbeitsmodelle und ein Team, das Data Engineering wirklich lebt.



STELLENBESCHREIBUNG


  • Du entwickelst und erweiterst eine moderne Data Platform, implementierst neue Features und stellst die Code-Qualität sicher.
  • Modellierung von Daten nach gängigen Frameworks (z. B. Data Vault) und Entwicklung von dbt-Modellen auf Basis moderner Cloud-Technologien wie Azure Databricks.
  • Du verantwortest den gesamten Entwicklungsprozess – von der Anforderungsanalyse über die Konzeption bis hin zur Integration, Validierung und Auslieferung der Lösungen.
  • Dabei behältst du die Aspekte Datensicherheit und IT-Governance stets im Blick.
  • Du sicherst den Betrieb der Data Platform, überwachst Datenpipelines und reagierst proaktiv auf Störungen.
  • Supportanfragen und Optimierungen gehören ebenfalls zu deinem Verantwortungsbereich, um die Plattform kontinuierlich zu verbessern.
  • Du unterstützt Kolleginnen und Kollegen bei technischen Fragestellungen, teilst dein Wissen im Team und hilfst mit, Standards zu etablieren.



ANFORDERUNGSPROFIL


  • Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung.
  • Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Bereich Data Engineering oder in einer ähnlichen Funktion.
  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL und Python sowie Erfahrung in der Datenmodellierung (z. B. mit Data Vault) und der Arbeit mit Databricks oder ähnlichen Cloud-Data-Plattformen.
  • Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und im Betrieb moderner Data Products sowie Kenntnisse zu Cloud-Technologien und Automatisierungen.
  • Eine analytische und strukturierte Arbeitsweise, Eigenverantwortung und ein Gespür für Trends im Bereich Data Engineering.
  • Freude an Teamarbeit und daran, gemeinsam mit funktionsübergreifenden Teams Lösungen zu entwickeln.



PERSPEKTIVE


  • Flexible Arbeitsmodelle: Teilzeitoptionen, Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten und eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance.
  • Attraktive Rahmenbedingungen: Leistungsorientierte Vergütung, spannende Benefits und finanzielle Zusatzleistungen.
  • Gestaltungsspielraum: Bringe deine Ideen ein und arbeite mit den neuesten Technologien in einem modernen Umfeld.
  • Weiterentwicklung: Unterstützung bei interner und externer Weiterbildung – mit Zeit und Budget.
  • Teamkultur: Offene Kommunikation, Wertschätzung und regelmässige Team-Events.

4270503735,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-data-domain-%E2%80%93-customer-solutions-at-audemars-piguet-4270503735?position=40&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=tr8zDaZS5yL05ON5Pmiyww%3D%3D,Business Analyst Data Domain – Customer Solutions,Audemars Piguet,"Le Brassus, Vaud, Switzerland","Description de l'entreprise

Le présent et le futur d’Audemars Piguet se construisent grâce à la contribution de tous nos talents. Inspirés par la richesse de notre passé, nous sommes enthousiastes à l’idée de ce que nous créerons dans le futur. Ensemble, nous sommes résolument tournés vers l’avenir et en quête continue d’excellence dans tous nos métiers.
Si notre mission vous inspire, venez poursuivre votre parcours au sein de notre famille pour que l’on continue de créer l'extraordinaire. Écrivons le prochain chapitre de votre carrière ensemble !

Intégré au sein de notre département du Data Office, votre mission principale sera d’analyser les besoins opérationnels d’optimisation des processus pour notre Domain Customer, afin de les traduire en spécifications fonctionnelles et techniques précises. Dans ce cadre-là :

Vous étudierez et représenterez les processus métiers de votre périmètre, en mettant en lumière les dysfonctionnements, les points de blocage et les risques. À partir de cette analyse, vous formulerez des recommandations concrètes dans le cadre d’un plan d’amélioration continue.

Vous recueillerez, prioriserez et documenterez les besoins d’évolution, en menant des entretiens approfondis avec les parties prenantes. Vous évaluerez l’impact, l’urgence, la complexité, la faisabilité et la valeur ajoutée de chaque demande en élaborant des business cases détaillés.

Vous définirez les spécifications fonctionnelles en lien étroit avec les équipes métiers et techniques en participant activement au choix des solutions technologiques les plus pertinentes et en accompagnant les décisions stratégiques.

Vous participerez à la mise en œuvre des projets, en coordonnant les efforts d’intégration et de migration des solutions dans le SI existant. En parallèle, vous définirez des procédures d’assurance qualité et des indicateurs de performance pour mesurer l’efficacité des solutions déployées.

Vous suivrez l’avancement des projets, apporterez votre expertise pour résoudre les situations complexes, participerez aux phases de tests (recettage), et accompagnerez les utilisateurs dans l’adoption des nouveaux outils et processus.
Vous mesurerez l’impact des projets sur les indicateurs de performance clés (KPI) afin de vérifier l’atteinte des objectifs et du retour sur investissement.

Enfin, vous assurerez un reporting régulier auprès de votre hiérarchie et veillerez à maintenir une documentation claire, structurée et à jour, afin de faciliter le partage des connaissances et garantir la continuité des opérations.
Au bénéfice d’un diplôme supérieur dans le domaine de l’IT, vous justifiez d’une expérience significative sur un poste similaire dans le domaine du luxe.
Des expériences préalables sur Salesforce et Google Analytics sont un atout.
Vous maîtrisez parfaitement le français et l’anglais.
Autonome et rigoureux, vous êtes reconnu pour votre polyvalence et votre sens de responsabilité.
Vous êtes doté d’une bonne capacité d'écoute et avez de la facilité à communiquer avec vos interlocuteurs.
Enfin, vous êtes reconnu pour votre esprit d’analyse, votre force de proposition et votre organisation.
La prise en charge des assurances maladie (base et complémentaire)
5 semaines annuelles de vacances et 2 semaines supplémentaires entre Noël et Nouvel An grâce au cumul quotidien de minutes additionnelles
Une contribution à vos activités sportives ou culturelles
La possibilité selon la fonction de travailler à distance

Vous souhaitez exprimer votre expertise au sein d’Audemars Piguet ? N’hésitez pas et postulez en ligne ! Nous nous réjouissons de discuter des opportunités qui pourraient correspondre à votre prochaine aventure professionnelle.
Le masculin vaut pour le féminin.

Description de l'entreprise

Le présent et le futur d’Audemars Piguet se construisent grâce à la contribution de tous nos talents. Inspirés par la richesse de notre passé, nous sommes enthousiastes à l’idée de ce que nous créerons dans le futur. Ensemble, nous sommes résolument tournés vers l’avenir et en quête continue d’excellence dans tous nos métiers.

Si notre mission vous inspire, venez poursuivre votre parcours au sein de notre famille pour que l’on continue de créer l'extraordinaire. Écrivons le prochain chapitre de votre carrière ensemble !

Description du poste

Intégré au sein de notre département du Data Office, votre mission principale sera d’analyser les besoins opérationnels d’optimisation des processus pour notre Domain Customer, afin de les traduire en spécifications fonctionnelles et techniques précises. Dans ce cadre-là :

  • Vous étudierez et représenterez les processus métiers de votre périmètre, en mettant en lumière les dysfonctionnements, les points de blocage et les risques. À partir de cette analyse, vous formulerez des recommandations concrètes dans le cadre d’un plan d’amélioration continue.
  • Vous recueillerez, prioriserez et documenterez les besoins d’évolution, en menant des entretiens approfondis avec les parties prenantes. Vous évaluerez l’impact, l’urgence, la complexité, la faisabilité et la valeur ajoutée de chaque demande en élaborant des business cases détaillés.
  • Vous définirez les spécifications fonctionnelles en lien étroit avec les équipes métiers et techniques en participant activement au choix des solutions technologiques les plus pertinentes et en accompagnant les décisions stratégiques.
  • Vous participerez à la mise en œuvre des projets, en coordonnant les efforts d’intégration et de migration des solutions dans le SI existant. En parallèle, vous définirez des procédures d’assurance qualité et des indicateurs de performance pour mesurer l’efficacité des solutions déployées.
  • Vous suivrez l’avancement des projets, apporterez votre expertise pour résoudre les situations complexes, participerez aux phases de tests (recettage), et accompagnerez les utilisateurs dans l’adoption des nouveaux outils et processus.
  • Vous mesurerez l’impact des projets sur les indicateurs de performance clés (KPI) afin de vérifier l’atteinte des objectifs et du retour sur investissement.
  • Enfin, vous assurerez un reporting régulier auprès de votre hiérarchie et veillerez à maintenir une documentation claire, structurée et à jour, afin de faciliter le partage des connaissances et garantir la continuité des opérations.

Qualifications

  • Au bénéfice d’un diplôme supérieur dans le domaine de l’IT, vous justifiez d’une expérience significative sur un poste similaire dans le domaine du luxe.
  • Des expériences préalables sur Salesforce et Google Analytics sont un atout.
  • Vous maîtrisez parfaitement le français et l’anglais.
  • Autonome et rigoureux, vous êtes reconnu pour votre polyvalence et votre sens de responsabilité.
  • Vous êtes doté d’une bonne capacité d'écoute et avez de la facilité à communiquer avec vos interlocuteurs.
  • Enfin, vous êtes reconnu pour votre esprit d’analyse, votre force de proposition et votre organisation.

Informations supplémentaires

Ce que nous offrons :

  • La prise en charge des assurances maladie (base et complémentaire)
  • 5 semaines annuelles de vacances et 2 semaines supplémentaires entre Noël et Nouvel An grâce au cumul quotidien de minutes additionnelles
  • Une contribution à vos activités sportives ou culturelles
  • La possibilité selon la fonction de travailler à distance
  • Un restaurant d’entreprise
  • Une LPP avantageuse

Vous souhaitez exprimer votre expertise au sein d’Audemars Piguet ? N’hésitez pas et postulez en ligne ! Nous nous réjouissons de discuter des opportunités qui pourraient correspondre à votre prochaine aventure professionnelle.

Le masculin vaut pour le féminin.

4281491598,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4281491598?position=43&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=D5vab1qy9IQWVMHZjfZm5A%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Berne, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4269393511,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-consultant-artificial-intelligence-data-data-management-data-platforms-focus-at-deloitte-4269393511?position=45&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=qYNSytcYm7XUNUgdCQCe%2Bw%3D%3D,Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus),Deloitte,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","Job Description
Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.
For this role, we are currently offering start dates from August 2025.
How You Can Make An Impact
Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.

Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.
Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.
Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.

column2: fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.

column1: First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .
We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.
If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch

We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria
column2: don’t hold yourself back – apply today.

  • Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.




    • Who we are looking for

    Drive and Motivation:

    • Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI &
column6:
Data space.
  • Drive to learn new topics and master them
  • Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
  • Consulting and Communication Skills:
  • Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
  • Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
  • Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.


    • Technical design:

    • Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
    • Technical expertise:
    • First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.
    • Familiarity with SQL and Python.


    Language Proficiency:

    • Fluent in English
column7:
fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.


Industry Experience:

  • First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
  • Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.


Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI &
column8:
data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI &
column9: Data is the leading data &amp
column10:
analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit &
column11: Assurance, Tax &amp
column12: Legal, Strategy, Risk &amp
column13: Transactions Advisory, and Technology &amp
column14:
Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch

  • We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria
column15:
don’t hold yourself back – apply today.


Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

4281492528,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4281492528?position=46&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=ZTySG5%2B%2BL91wBtzI0wWfrA%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Schwyz, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.
